loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is 56 years old.  He is married and has three sons.  

He is a market vendor and sells wheat and flour in his wholesale shop.  He has been in business for 13 years. During this time, he has gained skills, experience as well as wide range of permanent customers.  He sells items with attractive prices and high quality.  His monthly income is 300 AZN.  Rafiq says the location of his shop has brought him success and made his business profitable.

Rafiq has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to expand his business and purchase more merchandise.  He requires the loan because demand for wholesale products is high and sometimes Rafiq cannot afford all his customers’ orders.  This will be his second loan and Rafiq has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Husen

texts.ru: Хусен трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец троих детей. Хусен занимается откормом и реализацией крупного рогатого скота. Он откармливает их в течении 15- 25 дней, а затем продает на рынке. Кроме этого он работает в колхозе и имеет 2,5 гектар арендованную землю. Он там выращивает кукуруза и пшеницу. В бизнесе помогает жена. Хусен хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Husen is a hardworking and conscientious man.  He is married and the loving father of three children.  Husen is engaged in fattening cattle for resale.  He fattens them over the course of 15 - 25 days before selling them at the market.  Besides this, he works on a collective farm and rents 2.5 ha of land where he grows corn and wheat.   His wife helps him with in his business.  

Husen would like to get a loan for 5000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rafael Arles

texts.es:
Rafael  tiene 23 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. En su tiempo libre disfruta pasear con su pequeño en el auto sobre todo para distraerse de los problemas;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Rafael  le encanta mucho el Ají de Gallina. 
	
"Rafael se dedica al trabajo como chofer de taxi,  trabaja 15 horas diarias y puede atender alrededor de 70  clientes el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece un buen servicio y sobre todo respeto a los clientes.

Actualmente agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo, lo que permitirá tener un vehículo en buen estado para brindar un servicio con seguridad, asimismo  le ayudara a tener mayores ingresos y así seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño: Tener una flota de autos y formar su empresa de taxis."
texts.en:
Rafael is 23 and lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours south of Lima, the capital, and is described by Peruvians as the Land of Sun. It is known for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus and olives and, perhaps above all, for being the origin of the traditional Peruvian national drink, pisco. In this hot, arid climate lives Rafael and his customers. In his free time he likes to go out driving with his son to distract himself from his problems. It is well known that Peru is famous for having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Rafael loves is 'aji de gallina' (chilli chicken).

Rafael is a taxi driver and works 15 hours a day providing transport for around 70 customers. He thinks that he does well in his job because he offers a good service and because he respects his customers. He is grateful to Kiva's lenders because, with the help offered, he will be able to carry out maintenance on his vehicle to keep it in a good state, which will mean he can provide a safe service as well as earning a greater income and progress in his biggest dream of owning a fleet of cars and starting a taxi business.

loans.use: Para realizar mantenimiento a su vehiculo

loans.name: Banco Comunal El Milagro Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal  está  conformado por 11 emprendedoras que han salido adelante juntas, estas emprendedoras no es la primeras vez que está solicitando financiamiento ya que anteriormente se le brindo para aumentar su inversión, ellas nos expresa que gracias al crédito que se le brindo han aumento sus clientela ya que tiene suficiente productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Daniela Lisseth tiene 28 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica  es la venta de  de ropa usada y además vende enchiladas esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante, con el crédito desea comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts, camisolas y trajes entre otros productos
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of eleven entrepreneurs that have gotten ahead together. This is not the first time these entrepreneurs have requested a loan. The previous loan helped them increase their investment. They tell us that thank to the loan they received they have increased their customer bases as they now have sufficient products to offer to their customers. 

Daniela Lisseth is 28 years old. She makes her living in the business of used clothing sales in addition to selling enchiladas. She does her business as a street vendor. She wants to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, camisoles and suits, among other products, with this loan.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, camisoles and suits, among other products.

loans.name: Celia María

texts.es:
La Señorita. Celia es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas,  vive en el Cantón de Gualaceo que es un pueblo próspero, asentado en uno de los más bellos valles de la provincia y del país, espléndidos paisajes y agradable clima, por lo que constituye uno de los centros turísticos de primer orden. Sus habitantes cultivan verduras, legumbres, maíz, caña de azúcar, frutas, etc. También se dedican a crear preciosas artesanías. El centro tradicional, aunque pequeño, conserva aún casas de estilo colonial con los típicos portales y segundos pisos sobre pilares, amplios balcones sobre todo, las de la calle Cuenca frente al parque Central.
 
La Señorita Celia tiene 37 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de familiares.
 
Ella una tienda de comestibles, actividad que le desempeña hace 3 años y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio.
 
Su meta es estudiar belleza.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the "Gualaceñitas" communal bank. She lives in Gualaceo canton, which is a prosperous town located in one of the most beautiful valleys in the province and country. With splendid scenery and pleasant climate, it is a tourist center of the highest order. 

Its inhabitants grow vegetables, legumes, corn, sugar cane, fruit, etc. They also create beautiful crafts. The traditional center, although small, still retains colonial-style homes, with typical doorways, second floors on columns, and spacious balconies, especially those on Cuenca Street across from Central Park.

Celia is 37, single. and lives with her parents, with whom she shares the household expenses. They don't have their own house, so they live in the home of family members. She has a grocery store, a business she has run for three years. She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 6:00 in the morning to 10:00 at night.  

She has been in the communal bank for two years, and she is going to use her loan to buy food products for her business. Her goal is to study to be a beautician.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 21 años, vive en la comunidad de Huari junto a sus padres y 3 hermanos a los que apoya, y juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de El Tambo. Su frágil apariencia, es solo antónimo de su fortaleza y coraje. Ella estudia Radiología en una universidad reconocida. Para poder costear los gastos comenzó el negocio de compra y venta de ganados, ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a vivir de la agricultura. Su mayor inspiración es su papá, pues estudió ingeniería de minas y ahora trabaja en una mina, donde llega cada 2 semanas a verlos. “Quiero ser como él”, afirma. En la localidad de Huari, su mamá tiene vacas, ovejas y siembra papa, ahí recolecta las ovejas que compró a los ganaderos, los alimenta y engorda, para luego venderlos a un mayor precio en las diversas ferias que se realizan cada semana en Huancayo. Ahora desea ahorrar y poder abrir un restaurante por donde vive ya que no existe ninguno. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa teresa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Rocío de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más ganado para su negocio.
texts.en: 21 year old Rocío lives in the community of Huari along with her parents and three siblings who she supports. They live together in their own home, located in the city of El Tambo. Although she looks fragile, this belies her strength and courage. She studies radiology in a well known university. To be able to afford the fees, she started a business buying and selling cattle as her parents had taught her how to make a living from farming since she was very little. Her father is her main inspiration - he studied mining engineering and now works in a mine and comes to see them every two weeks. "I want to be like him" she states. At home in Huari, her mother has cows and sheep and grows potatoes. She pens the sheep that she buys from the shepherds there, feeds them and fattens them up to sell them later on for a better price at the different markets that are held each week in Huancayo. Now she wants to save some money and open a restaurant where she lives as there aren't any at the moment. She belongs to the loan group "Santa Teresa" and this is her first loan from MFP, and she is waiting for a small loan so that she can meet her goals. She also promises to make her repayments. She is grateful to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and united. When she receives her loan, Rocío will use it to buy more cattle for her business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan , es habitante del Municipio de la Concepcion , junto a sus hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Juan desde hace varios años se dedica al a la agricultura , gracias a los prestamo que le otorga afodenic atraves de loa fondo Kiva , a logrado darle um mejor mantenimiento a toda su plancion , teniendo como resultados mejores ventas y calidad del produccto , los planes hacia su humilde finca es poder sembrar un cuanto de manzana de citricos especialmente limones ya que este es de mucho consumo y su precio se mantiene , por ahora necesita el financimineto para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para seguirle dando el mantenimiento adecuado a la planatacion .
texts.en: Juan lives in the municipality of Concepcion along with his children. His plan for the future is to improve their living conditions. Juan has been a farmer for some years. Thanks to the loan that has been offered to him by AFODENIC by way of Kiva, he has been able to better maintain his land and as a result has had better sales and higher quality produce. His plan for his humble farm is to plant an area with citrus fruit, especially lemons, as these are consumed a lot and their price is stable. For now, he needs this loan to buy fertilizers and supplies necessary to keep his land in good condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto, es habitante del municpio de la Concepcion, el esta muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Kiva durante varios ciclos en cuanto a la agricultura ya que gracias a ese financimineto logro establecerlo muy bien , pero ahora necesita un prestamo para realizar el muro frontal de su humilde vivienda ya que es de mucha necesidad para èl , por que en tiempos de lluvia pasa una gran corriente y se pasa llevando arboles , todo lo ques basura y quedan mucho residuos de todos eso enfrente de la humilde vivienda .
texts.en: Humberto is a resident of the Concepcion municipality. He is very happy about the support that Kiva has given him over several agricultural loan cycles. Thanks to these loans he was able to establish himself very well. But now he needs a loan to build a wall in front of his humble home. This is a big necessity of his because during the rainy season a lot of water goes by taking trees and trash with it. It leaves behind a lot of residue in front of his humble home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 36 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Gregorio, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que cuidan en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Acraquia. Se siente muy feliz, ya que está a punto de tener una casa propia donde vivir. La actividad que desarrolla es múltiple. Cuenta que durante las mañanas trabaja en una casa donde cocina y limpia, ya por las tardes en la construcción de una nueva universidad, donde la paga el estado un sueldo mensual por sus servicios de limpieza. Pero la actividad que nunca deja de desarrollar es la agricultura. Siembra maíz, cebada y papa en sus terrenos agrícolas que son propios. En cada cosecha y después de mucho cuidado, los comercializa al mercado mayorista de su localidad, donde aprovecha para vender los animales que cuida, entre vacas, cerdos, ovejas y gallinas. Le gustaría dedicar todo su tiempo a esto, pero como ella dice “son inversiones a largo plazo”. Por ello tiene que generar ingresos que le permita solventar los gastos de alimentación y estudios para sus hijos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Irma de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la construcción de su nueva casa, que es propia. Comprará ventanas, puertas y demás accesorios.
texts.en: 36 year old Irma is a cheerful woman. She lives with Gregorio, her husband of 8 years. Together they have 3 small children who they care for in a rented house in the Acraquia area. She feels very happy as she is on the point of owning her own house to live in. She makes a living in multiple ways. During the mornings, she works in a house where she cooks and cleans, and, in the afternoons, she works at a new university that is being built. The state pays her a monthly wage for cleaning services here. But the activity that she never fails to develop is farming. She grows corn, barley, and potatoes on her own land. At each harvest, and after much care, she sells her crops at the main market and also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell the animals that she raises, which include cows, sheep, and chickens. She would like to spend all her time farming but, as she says, "this is a long-term investment."  So, she has to generate income to cover the costs of feeding and educating her children. This is her second loan from MFP, and she is waiting for a small loan so she can meet her goals. She promises to make her repayments. She is grateful to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and united people. On receiving her loan, Irma will use it for building her new house, which she will own. She will buy windows, doors, and other items.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida, de 35 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo con quien se casó desde hace 3 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampa blanca. Su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta de comida a las enfermeras de su anexo. Quienes le pagan por la alimentación que reciben durante el día. Además abrió una tienda de comestibles hace 3 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su zona. Por su parte su esposo, trabaja como chofer llevando carga en el camión de sus padres a todo el país, “a veces se ausenta varios días”, comenta. Por ello, ella tiene que administrar sus sembríos de papa en terrenos heredados, donde supervisa el crecimiento y ya en la cosecha lo comercializa a la capital del país, donde aprovecha el trabajo de su esposo para trasladarlos y obtener mejores ganancias. Ahora piensa trasladar sus cosas a un cuarto seguro, pues el sismo que ocurrió hace poco rajó la pared de casa, la que derrumbará para construir una más resistente. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Nelida de recibir su apoyo; podrá implementar dos cuartos con buen material a fuera de su casa.
texts.en: Nélida, who is 35 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, to whom she has been married for 3 years. They have 3 children whom they are raising in their own home, located in Pampa Blanca. Her principal source of income is the sale of food to the nurses in their annex, who pay her for the food they receive during the day. In addition, she opened a grocery store 3 years ago, where she sells basic products to the residents of her zone. On his part, her husband works as a driver, carrying cargo in his parents' truck all over the country. "Sometimes he is absent for a few days," she comments. For that reason, she has to manage their plantings of potatoes on inherited land, where she supervises the growing and then at harvest time she sells them in the capital of the country, where she takes advantage of her husband's work to transport them and obtain better earnings. Now she is thinking of moving her things to a secure room, since the earthquake that occurred a little while ago split the wall of the house, which she will pull down to build a more resistant one. This is her second loan from MFP, where she is hoping for a small loan so that she can complete her objectives. On the other hand, she promises again to make her payments. In addition, she is thankful to be part of her association (communal bank), because all the members are responsible and united. Nélida, on receiving her support, will be able to set up two rooms with good materials in the manner of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to prepare two rooms

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: La señora Ana , es habitante del municipio de la concepcion , gracias al apoyo que durante varios ciclos le a brindado Afodenic atarvez de  los fondos Kiva , logro mejorar su condicioón de vida , ya que su cultivo puede sostenerse con su propia cosecha , ahora su sueño es poder construir su cocina que es uno de sus grandes sueños , pero no tiene el dinero suficiente para iniciar la contrucción ya que necesita comprar , bloques , cemento , arena, piedrin, entre otros materiales .
texts.en:
Ana lives in the municipality of Concepción. Thanks to the support that Afodenic has provided her for several loan cycles by means of Kiva funding, she has succeeded in improving her living conditions. This is because she can support herself by harvesting her own crop.

Now one of her great dreams is to be able to build her kitchen. But she doesn't have enough money to begun construction, as she needs to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel, and other materials.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Silvia Ines

texts.es:
Silvia de 58 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con su hijo, su casa en la que actualmente viven está ubicada en  el  Caserío Atahualpa Distrito de Tambogrande, distrito que pertenece a la provincia a de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito el cual poco esta progresando por lo que por ahora solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Silvia vive en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera por lo que ella no es ajena a esta actividad siendo su principal actividad económica, junto a su esposo crían y venden ganado ya un aproximado de 15 años dedicándose a esta actividad y mucho mas dedicándose a la agricultura, en la actualidad desean sembrar limón para lo que se asisten con tecnología media, la buena relación que existe entre ellos como familia es que ha generado que siempre se mantengan unidos en sus negocios y sus proyectos de vida.

Silvia en su deseo de cumplir sus metas y objetivos desea comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así poder comercializarlos ya sea en el mercado local o a sus clientes en los mercados aledaños. Inversión que con el tiempo tendrá sus frutos y mejorará su calidad de vida.

Silvia es una persona muy responsable, amable y trabajadora por lo que tiene una muy buena relación con todos los vecinos de caserío en el que vive.
texts.en:
Silvia is 58 years old and lives with her husband and her child. The house where she lives now is located in the Atahualpa neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. She lives in a rural part of the district which has progressed very little as right now, the area only has basic electricity service. 

Silvia lives in an area that is purely agricultural and focused on livestock. As a result, she too engages in this business as her principal financial activity. Together with her husband she has been selling livestock for 15 years, making her living in this business as well as working in agriculture. They currently want to plant lime trees which they can attend to with moderate technology. The good relationship that exists among them as a family is what has kept them united always in their businesses and their life projects. 

In her dream of fulfilling her goals and objectives, Silvia wants to buy fertilizers for her lime planting as well as feed to fatten up her livestock and in tha tway be able to sell them either in the local market or to her customers in neighboring markets. 

Silivia is a responsible, friendly and hardworking person. As such she has a good relationship will of her neighbors in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Diappo Liguey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité de Diappo Liguey a été crée le 21/12/2009. Il est composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce. Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est âgée de 49 et fait du commerce, elle vend divers produits alimentaires dans sa boutique. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter divers produits à savoir du riz, du sucre, du savon, des biscuits et bonbons et des produits de détergents. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études et leur assurer une bonne alimentation .
texts.en: The solidarity group Diappo Liguey was created on 21 December 2009. It comprises eight women who all come from the same area. Their main activity is business. Standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, the group leader is married and has nine children. She is 49 years old and sells various food items at her store. With her loan, she intends to buy various products, namely rice, sugar, soap, biscuits, sweets, and detergents. The profits generated from her business will allow her to support her children in their education and ensure that they are well fed.

loans.use: To buy various food items: rice, oil, sugar, soap.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra est créé le 27 décembre 2010, il est composé de neuf femmes qui sont parentes et amies. Le commerce est leur principale activité.

Madame Nogaye est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée mère de six enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de poisson séché avec une bonne expérience de plus de 32 ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou blanc avec fleurettes orange et un châle saumon sur les épaules.

Elle achète son poisson dans les villes où elle peut en trouver et le revend au marché central de sa localité.


Son prêt lui servira à acheter une bonne quantité de poisson séché pour se faire ainsi plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite constituer une bonne épargne qui lui permettra de mieux soutenir son mari et ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra solidarity group was created on December 27, 2010. It is made up of friends and relatives. There are nine women in total. Commerce is their main activity.

Nogaye is 52 years old, married, and mother of six children. She runs a business selling dried fish and has over 32 years of experience. In the photograph, she is on the right-hand side, standing, dressed in a white boubou with little orange flowers and a salmon-colored shawl over her shoulders.

She buys her fish in the cities where she can find it, and resells it at the central market in her town.

She will use her loan to buy a large quantity of dried fish so that she can increase her revenue.

She hopes to build up a large amount of savings, which will allow her to better support her husband and her children.

loans.use: to buy dried fish intended for resale

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé le 28 décembre 2010, il est composé de quinze femmes issues du même village et dont les activités principales sont l'élevage et le petit commerce.


Madame Fatel la responsable du groupe est une femme mariée mère de quatre enfants; elle est âgée de 74 ans. Elle mène une activité de transformation et de petit commerce d'arachide. Elle fait aussi de l'élevage, elle a une bonne expérience.Elle est debout à droite habillée d'un boubou khartoum rayé orange vert.



Son prêt lui servira à acheter des moutons et de l'arachide pour renforcer ses activités.



Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son épargne, appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille en nourriture et gérer ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was created on 28 December 2010 and comprises 15 women who come from the same town and whose main activities are animal-rearing and business.

Ms. Fatel, the group leader, is a married mother of four children; she is 74 years old. She runs a business preparing and selling peanuts. She also raises animals, and has gained lots of experience. She is standing on the right in the photo, dressed in a Khartoum-style boubou with orange and green stripes.

Her loan will serve to buy sheep and peanuts to strengthen her business.

She also hopes to increase her savings, support her husband in providing for the family's food needs, and manage her personal needs.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and re-sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 19 años vive en compañía de sus padres y 3 hermanos menores a quienes apoya, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad de Huancayo.  A su corta edad, ya está logrando muchas cosas. Estudia la carrera de contabilidad en un instituto reconocido, gracias a ello ahora se encuentra trabajando en una empresa reconocida, en el área de digitación administrativa. Esto lo realiza durante las mañanas ya que en las tardes, estudia. Ahora que se encuentra de vacaciones, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ovejas, las cuales cuida en Huari, donde tiene su casa propia. Ahí comercializa los ovinos a un precio mayor al que compró. Además de apoyar a su mamá en la siembra de papa, oca, Nashua y habas, comprando fertilizantes y sugiriendo para la compra. Su principal objetivo es terminar una carrera universitaria por eso trabaja sin descanso, pues los gastos de mensualidad son altos y tiene que costearlos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa teresa” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Rocío de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cabezas de ganado ovino para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocio, 19, lives with her parents and her 3 younger siblings, whom she supports, in a rented home located in the city of Huancayo.  In spite of her young age, she is accomplishing a lot.  She is studying for an accounting degree in a distinguished institute, and thanks to this she is now working in a well-known firm, doing word processing for the business.  She does this in the mornings, because in the afternoons she studies.  Now that it is the school vacation she is working in her business buying and selling sheep, which she cares for in Huari, where she has her own home.  There she sells the sheep for a better price than what she paid for them.  In addition, she supports her mother with her cultivations of potatoes, oca (a South American tuber), nashua and beans, by purchasing fertilizers and advising her on these purchases.  Her main goal is to finish her university degree, and so to do this she works tirelessly, as the monthly household expenses are high and she has to pay them.  She is a member of the communal bank "Santa Teresa," and this is the second loan that she has taken with MFP, where she awaits a small loan to help her achieve her goals.  Moreover, she promises once again to comply with the payment terms of the loan.  In addition, she appreciates being part of her communal bank, because all of the members are supportive and responsible people.  

Upon receiving your support, Rocio will invest the money requested in the purchase of a number of sheep for her business.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigslets and construct a housing unit for pigs.

loans.name: Ulfatoi

texts.ru: Улфатой замужем и любящая мать шестерых детей. В 2005 году она начала заниматься скотоводством, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Имеет богатый опыт работы в животноводстве. Раньше она жила очень бедно и не могла развивать свой бизнес, а затем постепенно приобрела 2-х голов мелкого рогатого скота. Теперь она очень старается расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое жилищные условия. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Улфатой очень надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ulfatoi is married and the loving mother of six children.  In 2005 she took up animal husbandry to support her family.  She has a great deal of experience with livestock.   She used to be very poor and couldn't develop her business, but later she eventually acquired two head of small cattle.  Now she is trying very hard to expand her business and improve her living conditions.  With this goal, she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy sheep and goats.  Ulfatoi is hoping very much for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Donoziyo

texts.en: Donoziyo, aged 45 years-old, is a married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He has been trading in produce for seven years and the business has been very lucrative.  He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money which he used to start his produce business.  Donoziyo needs the loan to buy maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 32 years old, married and a father of one child who is three years old.  His spouse is Everlyne, a business lady.  Philip does farming in Kapsabet  and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He is servicing a first loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD  which he wishes to use to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farm.  The anticipated profit he will use to expand the farm and support his wife's business.

He hopes to till more land and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single lady aged 27 years old and supporting three members of her family. Her child is six years old. She owns a retail shop in Awasi trading centre and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is servicing a second loan from KADET LTD after she successfully repaid the previous loan and she intends to use this amount to purchase more business stock, e.g., washing detergent, sweets, and wheat flour for sale.  


The anticipated  profit will be used to plough back into the business and improve her living standards.She hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase washing detergent, sweets, and wheat flour, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Stadhy Hermine Thècle Claudia

texts.fr:
Cliente  âgé de  35 ans, mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants dont l’âge varie entre 16  ans et  4 mois. 
N’ayant pas de soutient pour poursuivre ses études universitaires, elle  se lance dans le commerce depuis 09 ans.
Ses ventes sont considérables ; elle encaisse en moyenne 20 000 à 35000 F par jour. A l’octroie de se prêt ; elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 4 cartons de poissons fumés, 2 bidons d'huile, 3 sacs de foufou, cuvette de tomate fraiches, carton des boites de tomate, 2 filets d'oignon, 2 cartons de poisson salés, 10 quakers d’arachides.
Afin de gagner une grande clientèle, elle achète sa marchandise en grande quantité.
Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes, elle pense épargner et à la longue ouvrir un dépôt de boissons. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle aide son époux en faisant face au besoin de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is a 35-year-old married mother of four children whose ages vary from 4 months to 16 years.
Not having had the means to pursue a university education, she has run a business for nine years.
Her sales are considerable; she earns on average 20,000 to 35,000 F per day. Upon the granting of this loan, she is going to expand her stocks of merchandise by buying four boxes of smoked fish, two cans of oil, three bags of fufu, a pot of fresh tomatoes, a box of canned tomatoes, two mesh bags of onions, two cartons of salted fish, and 10 bags of peanuts.
In order to gain a large customer base, she sells her merchandise in large quantities.
With the profits from her sales, she is thinking of saving and, in the long term, opening a drinks store. As a good wife and mother, she helps her husband in meeting the needs of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy four boxes of smoked and salted fish, fresh tomatoes, condiments, two cans of oil, three bags of fufu, tomato-growing pots, a box of canned tomatoes, and two mesh bags of onions.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr:
Clementine, age 88,  is a single mother of 9 children. She now has one child still attending school.
 She also cares for 2 other people who are unable to provide for themselves. She has been selling clothes in the market for 32 years. She began selling men's and women's under garments and has since then begun to sell baby clothes. 
She buys baby clothes from a supplier and then resells her merchandise in a local market in Brazzaville. Clementine uses friendly customer service to improve her business' sales. 

She has received 3 loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, to buy clothes to sell in her business. The loans were paid back in full and on time. She is now seeking her 4th loan in order to continue to expand her inventory. Clementine wishes to provide a good life and improved living conditions for her family with the profits from her business.
texts.en:
Clementine, age 88,  is a single mother of 9 children. She now has one child still attending school.
 She also cares for 2 other people who are unable to provide for themselves. She has been selling clothes in the market for 32 years. She began selling men's and women's undergarments and has since then begun to sell baby clothes. 
She buys baby clothes from a supplier and then resells her merchandise in a local market in Brazzaville. Clementine uses friendly customer service to improve her business' sales. 

She has received 3 loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, to buy clothes to sell in her business. The loans were paid back in full and on time. She is now seeking her 4th loan in order to continue to expand her inventory. Clementine wishes to provide a good life and improved living conditions for her family with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy diapers, brassieres, blankets, feeding bottles, sheets, drawsheets

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 50-year-old widowed lady from Kisumu and she has four children aged between  13 and 31 years.

Salome sells personal beauty products like wigs and hair weaves, a business she has been doing for the last 28 years, making a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy weaves and wigs, and material for petticoats for sale . She will use the profits to grow her business.

Her dream is to grow the business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more stock of weaves, wigs and material for petticoats.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Jacobs Town. She is 37 years old and married with three children between the ages 7 and 19, all of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband is a doctor. 

For eight years now Rebecca has been selling chocolate, biscuits, candy, and juices in her community. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She has a lot of customers and not enough inventory. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chocolate, biscuits, candy, and juices for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chocolate, biscuits, candy, and juices for her business.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza used the previous loan to buy cassava, maize and millet flour to resell.  Her major challenges are continuous price fluctuations and inflation of agricultural products. Nevertheless, she aims to educate her children and her business goal is to diversif her businesses or firm. Tereza needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Willyfred

texts.en: Willyfred is a 32 year-old male who lives in Kagadi, Uganda.  He has five children with his wife.  For the last eight years, he has operated a business dealing in stationary.  He started by carrying out agriculture from which he got money and started the stationary business. The main hardships he gets in the business is customers not paying on time. His goals are to have his children attain good education and he would like to expand the business into other markets. Willyfred wants a loan to buy books,paper and other scholastic items to sell.

loans.use: to buy books, paper and other scholastic items to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 38 year-old man with three children.  He operates a retail shop dealing in home products .He started by practicing agriculture where he got start up capital for the retail shop which he has run for two years now. The most hurdle he faces is high prices and inflation rates which limits his profits. Henry has a dream of educating his children and wishes to start up a big income generating activity. He wants a loan to buy beans, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans,sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 23-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is married to George and they have one child who is four years old.

Mercy sells  fish baskets (used for transporting fish), a business she has done for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 6,000 and is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more fish baskets for sale. 


She will use her profits to invest in a motorbike business.Her dream is to venture into the transport business.

loans.use: To buy more fish baskets.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Victor , es un humilde agricultor de la zona de San Ignación , junto a su familia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Victor se siente muy preocupado debido a los grandes chubascos de agua que afecto al pais , afectando casi en su totalidad el cultivo de pitahaya , ya que todas las flores se deterioraron  de tanta agua que recibieron ,pero no pierde las esperanzas que este 2012 será un años mejoror para la agricultura , ahora sus planes es poder realizar canales de evacuasion para que el agua no le estanque y se pudra las plantas  .El va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos .
texts.en: Victor is a humble farmer who lives in the San Ignacion area with his family.  He has plans to improve his family's living conditions.  Victor is very worried about the torrential rains that are affecting the country, and which have damaged almost all of his dragon fruit crops.  All of his flowers have been spoiled by the large amount of rain that they have received.  But he is not losing hope that 2012 will be a better year for agriculture.  Now he is planning to make irrigation channels so that the water does not collect and rot the plants.  He is going to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Taku Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité Taku Liguey a été crée le 21-12-2009. Il est composé de 06 femmes issue de la même localité. Elles exercent comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.		
Debout à droite de la photo le responsable du groupe est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.Elle a en charge aussi sa sœur et ses 2 neveux. 		
Avec son prêt reçu, elle va acheter de 4 brebis et divers produits alimentaires( sucre, riz, savon)		
Ses recettes lui permettront d'aider son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.Elle veut aussi renforcer ses épargnes dans le banc villageois.		
Le membre Ndéye ne figure pas sur la photo.
texts.en:
The Taku Liguey solidarity group was created on December 21, 2009. It is made up of six women from the same town. Their business activities include commerce and animal fattening.

The head of the group is standing on the right-hand side of the photograph. She is 38 years old. She is married and mother of six children. She also takes care of her sister and her two nephews.

With the loan, she will buy four ewes as well as various foodstuffs (sugar, rice, soap). Her revenue allows her to help her husband cover the family's needs. She also wants to increase her savings at the "banc villageois".

The group member, Ndéye, is not in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy various foodstuffs (sugar, soap, rice...) and 4 ewes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has operated her retail shop in Nakuru town for the last four years.  She is 58 years old, married to Joseph and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be her 1st loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods for sale in her retail shop hence get more income.She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more stock of tea leaves, coffee sachets, maize flour, and rice for sale.


In future, Margaret hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale hence improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tea leaves, coffee sachets, maize flour, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta has practiced farming in Nakuru town for the last 23 years.  She is 56 years-old, married to John and they have two school going children.  Besides farming as her primary business, Jecinta also ventures in charcoal selling business in the town.

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD,by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more dairy meal for her cows so as to increase her milk production, and also to add more stock of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Jecinta hopes to become one of the leading dairy farmers in Nakuru  and also to venture in other businesses therefore to be able to provide a good education for her children as well as better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dairy meal worth KES. 15,000 and sacks of  charcoal  worth KES. 15, 000 to sell.

loans.name: Magamoe

texts.en: Magamoe is 43 years-old , and live in Jacob Town.  She has four children ages 18 to 23 years-old and,her husband is a driver.  For the past 25 years she has been selling groundnuts in the market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her oldest sister. She is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnuts for her business.  Her plans are to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts for her business.

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.ru: Иномчон женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он очень трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Более 3-х лет он занимается выращиванием лука. Он очень хорошо справляется с бизнесом, ведь его отец занимался этим бизнесом, а он помогал отцу. Иномчон хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 7000 Сомони для покупки семена лука и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Inomjon is married and has one child.  He is a very hardworking and conscientious man.  He has grown onions for more than three years.  He handles this business very well because his father also grew onions, and he helped his father.  Inomjon wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit and with this goal in mind, he is requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy onion seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy onion seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sop Mamadou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mamadou est créé le 27 décembre 2010, il est composé de dix femmes qui sont issues du même quartier et ont pour activité commune le commerce.

Madame Ndické la responsable est mariée mère de deux enfants,elle est restauratrice dans une gare routière de la place où elle exerce cette activité depuis plus de dix ans avec une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite couverte d'un châle blanc.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des denrées alimentaires pour la restauration elle vend essentiellement du petit déjeuner.

Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes, et compte aussi constituer une bonne épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Mamadou was created on 27 December 2010 and comprises six women who come from the same area and all run businesses.

Ms. Ndické, the group leader, is a married mother of two children. She has a restaurant at the local bus station and has run this business for over ten years with good experience. In the photo, she is standing on the right, covered by a white shawl.

With her loan, she hopes to buy foodstuffs for her restaurant, where she mainly sells breakfast meals.

With her profits, she helps her husband in paying for the family's daily expenses, and also intends to build up a good amount of savings.

loans.use: To prepare and sell meals.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Babacar est composé de cinq femmes qui habitent le même quartier, il existe depuis le 27 décembre 2010. La principale activité est le commerce 

Marie la responsable du groupe est âgée de 26 ans, mariée mère d'un enfant, elle mène une activité de vente d'ustensiles depuis trois ans; elle a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est à  droite habillée en bleu.

Elle achéte ses marchandises dans les grands marchés de la capitale (bols, plats, cuillères, couteaux....) et revend dans son quartier.


Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce en achetant en quantité des articles ménagers, pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Les bénéfices attendus l'aideront à mieux s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar comprises five women who live in the same area. It has existed since 27 December 2010 and the main activity of its members is business.

Marie, the group leader, is a 26-year-old married mother of one child, and has run a business selling utensils for three years. She has thus gained good experience. In the photo, she is on the right, dressed in blue.

She buys her merchandise (bowls, plates, spoons, knives) at the large markets in the capital and re-sells them in her area.

Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business by buying household items in bulk in order to then generate a large income.

The expected profits will help her better take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy utensils for resale.

loans.name: Konnah

texts.en:
Konnah is 20 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is single with a child aged  two years old. For the past few years she has been selling powder, soap, and cream in the local market.

Konnah says she started this business with help from her friend and learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes buying the merchandise to stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more medicated powder, soap, and  body cream for her business. Her plans is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more medicated powder, soap, and  body cream for her business.

loans.name: Armando Ivan

texts.es:
Armando  tiene 38 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.  En su tiempo libre disfruta escuchar música;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Armando le gusta mucho es lomo Saltado. Armando estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Derecho. Armando es padre soltero y tiene 2  hijos a los cuales ama mucho y estudian educación primaria.
	
Armando trabaja como Chofer de taxi, labora alrededor de 15 horas diarias. En un día Armando puede atender hasta 60 clientes el cree quele va bien en su negocios  porque atiende de manera amable a los clientes y es responsable y honrado. 

Actualmente está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con su ayuda el podrá realizar los tramites para revalidar su licencia de conducir ya que tienen mucho costo y realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo, con esta mejora podrá evitar tener multas y tener un vehículo en buen estado para brindar un servicio de seguridad y así poder en algunos meses  lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: “Darle una profesión a sus hijos  y tener un auto nuevo."
texts.en:
Armando is 38, and lives in Ica. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours south of Lima, the country's capital. It is celebrated by Peruvians as the "Land of the Sun."  In Peru, it is known for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007, and 6.9 in 2011); its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives; and perhaps especially, as the source of the traditional national drink of Peru, pisco.

The home and business of the client is located in this warm and dry climate. In his free time, he likes to listen to music. As is well known, Peru is noted for having some of the most delicious foods in the world, and one of the dishes that Armando really likes is lomo saltado (beef sautéed with onions and potatoes).  

Armando studied as far as fifth year of secondary school, but he really would have liked to study law. Armando is a single father, and has two children whom he loves very much, and who go to primary school. 

Armando works as a taxi driver, around 15 hours a day. In one day, Armando can serve up to 60 customers. He believes that his business is going well because he serves his customers in a friendly way, and is responsible and honest.

Now, he is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, because with their help, he will be able to have the paperwork processed to renew his driver's licence, as this is very costly, and to carry out maintenance work on his vehicle. By doing this, he will be able to avoid getting fines, and will have a vehicle in good condition for offering a safe service. 

This will enable him, in a few months, to fulfill his great dream, "To provide an occupation to his children, and have a new car."

loans.use: To process the renewal of his driver's licence, and pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Modesta Felicidad

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar vive la señora  Modesta,  tiene 58 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. El esposo es agricultor.
 
Hace muchos años ella aprendió corte y confección en una Academia Artesanal, por lo cual decidió poner un taller de costura en su casa,  primero empezó con una máquina de coser y ahora ya cuenta con tres maquinas ya que una de sus hijas también aprendió esta profesión y cose junto a ella, confeccionan todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más le agrada es hacer ropa de mujer ya que siempre le traen nuevos modelos de lo que quieren sus clientes, en temporadas también elaboran uniformes de escuelas y colegios. Trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 20h00.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas y materiales para la costura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. 

Su sueño es tener un gran taller de costura en el Portoviejo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Ilusión" meets every 15 days in Cadi, in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place that is known for its hardworking people who are farmers and raise animals.

Here we meet Modesta, 58, who is married and has 3 grown children.  Two of the children still live with her.  Her  husband is a farmer.

Many years ago, she learned dressmaking in a craft academy, and so she decided to put a dressmaking workshop in her house.  She started out with one sewing machine, and now has three machines, because one of her daughters has also learned this trade and works with her making all types of clothing.  But what she likes the most is making women's clothing, because her customers always bring her new styles that they want.  In certain seasons she also makes school uniforms.  She and her daughter work every day from 8am until 8pm.

Modesta will use this loan to buy fabric and dressmaking supplies.  She has been a member of her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because the interest rates on the loans are low.

Her dream is to have a big dressmaking shop in Portoviejo.

loans.use: to buy fabric and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and married to Hellen and supports seven members of his family. He runs a cafe business that he started three years ago. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase bales of maize flour, cooking fat,and one sack of sugar required in his business. 

The anticipated profit will help him repay his loan and expand his business. His dream is to expand his business in order to raise his family's living standards as well as to educate his children. This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD.

loans.use: To purchase bales of maize flour, cooking fat, and a sack of  sugar.

loans.name: Khaladdin

texts.en:
Khaladdin is a 30 year-old man who is married and has one child. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products in the central bazaar. Khaladdin has more than three years of experience in this field, which considers him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaroni, yogurt, ketchup, sugar and other items.  The products he sells are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life.  Also these products are in very high demand among local people and his monthly profit is 350 AZN. His father helps him to update merchandise in his shop. 

This business is only one financial income in his family and Khaladdin would like to increase his sales as well as to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell.

loans.name: Dilsad

texts.en:
Dilsad is a 54 year-old woman, married with one daughter. She raises fruits and vegetables in her garden. She started this business 10 years ago. She chose this field because fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan and people like to eat them fresh and make fresh juices, which is very healthy.
 
Her husband sells Dilsad`s crops in the central bazaar and her monthly income is 250 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air is very hard for woman and that is why her son helps Dilsad. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase monthly turnover.  For this purpose she applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alhamdoulillah Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Alhamdoulilahi est créé depuis le 27 décembre 2010, il est constitué de huit femmes qui sont issues du même quartier et dont l'activité dominante est le commerce.

La responsable Codou est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée mère de cinq enfants; elle fait du commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques avec une bonne expérience de plus de 10 ans.Elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou multicolore avec un châle blanc autour des épaules.

Elle s'approvisionne en tissus (wax, voile, khartoum...)et parfums, lait de beauté... dans la capitale pour revendre au marché central de sa localité.

Elle souhaite renforcer son commerce pour satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenus.


Elle participe aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Alhamdoulilahi solidarity group was created on 27 December 2010 and comprises eight women from the same area whose main activity is business.

The group leader, Codou, is a 46-year-old married mother of five children; she has sold fabric and cosmetics for over 10 years and has gained considerable experience. In the photo, she is standing on the right, dressed in a multicoloured boubou with a white shawl around her shoulders. 

She gets her supplies of fabric (of 'wax', 'voile', 'khartoum', etc. styles), perfume, beauty creams, etc. in the capital and re-sells them at the central market in her area.

She hopes to expand her business in order to satisfy her customers and earn a greater income.

She contributes to providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy fabric and bath items for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 39 years old, married and a mother of four children. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by farming in Mpeketoni. She earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for her third loan, for KES 20,000, to buy additional farm inputs for her farm. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees and her goal for the future is to continue growing her farming business so that her family will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional farm inputs for her farm.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 45 years old, married and a father of four children. For the last twenty years, he has earned a living by operating a tailoring shop in Mpeketoni. He earns a monthly profit of KES 25,000. 


He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan of KES 60,000, to buy additional clothing material and spare parts for the sewing machines used in his business. 


He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees as well as take care of his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing material and spare parts for his sewing machines.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala north region of Uganda. For the past two years, Angella has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Angella has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Angella to generate greater profits and expand her business. Angella hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Angella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Angella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary Wangare

texts.en:
Mary is 27 years old and married to Samuel and blessed with a seven-year-old son. She sells used clothes, a business she ventured into eight years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000.

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 that she will use to purchase bales of used clothes for sale. The profit she earns from this business will help her expand her business and pay back the loan. Her dream is to be a millionaire. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Fabricio Del Socorro

texts.es: Fabricio Del Socorro su actividad económica  a la que se dedica es a una pulpería, él ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en varios ciclos en el cual ha demostrado ser una personas con buenos valores y con un record crediticio excelente, nos cuenta el emprendedor que con el financiamiento ha aumentado su inventario y sus clientes de igual manera. Este emprendedor actualmente está solicitando financiamiento  para  invertir nuevamente en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, jabón, detergente, shampoo, huevos, pan entre otros.
texts.en: Fabricio Del Socorro has a grocery store.  He has already taken loans from Fundación León 2000 over a number of cycles in which he has demonstrated himself to be a person with good values and an excellent credit history.  This entrepreneur tells us that with the loans, he has increased his inventory and also his customer base.  He is now requesting a loan to invest again in his business, by purchasing staple grains, soap, detergent, shampoo, eggs, bread, and other products.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soap, detergent, shampoo, eggs, bread, and other products

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mansour Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Mansour est composé de sept femmes qui sont voisines issues du même quartier; il existe depuis le 27 décembre 2010 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois.Le commerce est leur principale activité.


La responsable madame Khary est âgée de 64 ans, elle est veuve mère de cinq enfants, elle vend des tissus et autres articles divers et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 20 ans. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou bleu-blanc avec un châle blanc autour des épaules et elle s'est adossée au mur.

Elle se ravitaille en tissus, balais, chaussures...au marché central de la ville et revend sur place. 

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce pour gagner plus de revenus.

Elle souhaite réaliser de grands bénéfices pour mieux épargner afin d'obtenir un crédit élevé et aussi agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Mansour solidarity group is made up of seven women who are neighbors from the same part of town. The group has been in existence since December 27, 2010, the inauguration day of the "Banc Villageois". Commerce is their main activity.

Khary, the group's leader, is 64 years old. She is a widow and mother of five children. She sells fabric and various other items, and has over 20 years of experience. In the photograph, she is standing on the right-hand side, leaning against the wall, dressed in a blue and white boubou with a white shawl around her shoulders.

She stocks up on fabric, brooms, shoes...at the central market in the city and resells them locally.

Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue.

She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and also expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and various items intended for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 02 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 ans et 18 ans. 
Il a une cave où il vend des boissons locales et importés depuis 05 ans.
Ses ventes journalières sont considérables. Il encaisse en moyenne 35 000 à 50 000 F CF par jour. A l’octroie de ce prêt, il va renforcer son commerce en achetant 5 cartons de vin rouge, 5 cartons de vin blanc, 3 cartons de vin rosés, 10 cartons de jus importés, 10 casiers de bière légère, 10 casiers de Primus, cartons de boissons importées.
Avec un bon accueil des clients et une grande publicité, le client à une bonne réputation dans la zone
 il s’approvisionne auprès des grands fournisseurs de  Kinshasa et de Pointe Noire.
Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes ; il pense épargner à la longue afin d’ouvrir une alimentation où il pourra vendre en gros aux autres vendeurs de la zone. Comme un bon père ; il fait face au besoin de sa famille en finançant les études de ses enfants et en initiant sa famille au commerce.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 40-year-old married father of two children aged 2 and 18.
He has a cellar where he has been selling local and imported drinks for five years.
His daily sales are considerable. He earns on average 35,000 to 50,000 FCF per day. Upon the granting of this loan, he is going to expand his business by buying five cases of red wine, five cases of white wine, three cases of rosé wine, ten cases of imported juice, ten cases of light beer, ten cases of Primus beer, and cases of imported drinks.
With good customer service and widespread publicity, he has a good reputation in the area.
He gets his merchandise from large suppliers in Kinshasa and Pointe Noire.
With the profits from his sales, he is thinking of saving for the long term in order to open a store where he will be able to sell in bulk to other sellers in the area. 
As a good father, he provides for the family by financing his children's education and introducing his family to business.

loans.use: to buy five cases of red wine, five cases of white wine, three cases of rosé wine, ten cases of imported juice, ten cases of Ngok beer, ten cases of Primus beer, and cases of whiskey.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is forty-one years old and a widowed lady from Migori. She has six children under her care.

Hellen operates a grocery selling mainly green vegetables and fruit, a business she has done for the last four years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more kale and oranges for sale. She will use her profits to educate her children and repay the loan.

Her dream is to enlarge her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables (kale) and oranges for resale.

loans.name: Khaladdin

texts.en:
Khaladdin is a 52 year-old man, married with two children. He is farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 20 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, many national dishes are made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.

Khaladdin sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN. His father actively helps him to raise the crop.

As these products are in high demand, Khaladdin wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his fourth loan and he has positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридун трудолюбивый и активный парень. Имеет среднее образование. Более 3-х лет он занимается в агробизнесе. Фаридун хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль. В основном он выращивает картофеля, а затем урожай продает на рынке. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота. Фаридун хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и скота.
texts.en: Faridun is a hardworking and active guy.  He has a secondary education.  For more that three years he has been engaged in agribusiness.  Faridun wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit.  Primarily, he grows potatoes and then sells the harvest at the market.  Besides this, he fattens cattle for resale.  Faridun would like to get a loan for $3,000 to buy seed, mineral fertilizer, and cattle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, and cattle

loans.name: Simon

texts.fr:
Client de 44 ans, marie et père de 5 enfants dont 4 sont scolarises, il arrête ses etudes en classe de seconde et n'ayant pas de soutien financier avec le peu d'argent qu'il avait en  exerçant  plusieurs petits métiers   il monte une briquerie en 2005 .
Il achète du ciment et  du sable et a une capacité de fabriquer 500 briques  par jour et ses clients sont les gens qui construisent aux alentours de son unité de production.Il a des recettes de 150.000 frs par semaine.c'est un client qui a rembourse ses 2 cycles de prêts sans difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables

Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock en achetant des 2 tonnes de ciment soit 20 sacs de 50 kg par tonne, 16m3 de sable et 5 moules a briques.
A l'heure actuelle , il a recrute deux jeunes ouvriers qui travaillent avec lui qu'il paye a la fin de chaque mois.
Il a pour ambition de devenir un entrepreneur,et en tant que bon père de famille, il a fini la construction de sa maison familiale et s'occupe bien de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 44-year-old married father of five children, four of whom attend school. He ended his studies in high school and, not having enough financial support with the small amount of money he had from working several small jobs, he started a brickmaking business in 2005.
He buys cement and sand in sufficient quantity to make 500 bricks per day, and his customers are builders near his workplace. He earns 150,000 Frs. each week. He repaid his two previous loan cycles without difficulty and has built up considerable savings.

With this new loan, he is going to expand his stock by buying 2 tonnes of cement (each tonne consisting of twenty 50-kg sacks), 16 cubic metres of sand, and five brick molds. Currently, he has recruited two young workers who work with him and whom he pays at the end of each month.

His ambition is to become an entrepreneur and, as a good father and husband, he has finished building his family's house and takes good care of his children's education.

loans.use: To buy 2 tonnes of cement bags, 16 cubic metres of sand, and brick molds.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente es un hombre muy activo y trabajador de 38 años de edad; es padre de 04 hijos quienes están en etapa escolar; vive con su esposa en su propia casa. Clemente, desde muy pequeño aprendió a cultivar plantas cacao, café y coca productos que sus padres sembraban en sus tierras. Hace como 12 años, Clemente empezó a sembrar sus propias plantas en la tierra que gracias a su esfuerzo logró obtener con los ahorros de su trabajo. Ahora con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos se dirigen a su chacra desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, para ver su producción; por otro lado él nos cuenta que no solo se puede sembrar cacao, café y coca, sino también plantas de soya y son productos muy rentables ya que la misma gente de su localidad llegan a comprarlas, es por ello que su mayor deseo es cultivar plantas de soya para poder tener un buen ingreso económico. Para mas adelante anhela en tener una tienda  de ropa para que su esposa pueda trabajar de forma tranquila y así ambos laboren en sus oficios y de esa manera darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, promete ser una vez más puntual en sus cuotas, ya que gracias al apoyo de los préstamos le va bien con su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio responsable.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de soya para sembrar en su campo de cultivo.
texts.en:
Clemente is a very energetic and hard-working man of 38. He is the father of four school-age children, and lives with his wife in their own house. From an early age, Clemente learned to grow cacao, coffee and coca; these were  the crops that his parents grew on their land. Twelve years ago, Clemente began to grow his own plants on the land that thanks to his efforts, he managed to buy with savings from his work.  

Now, with the help of his wife and children, he heads to his small farm at a very early hour of the morning to inspect his crop. As well, he tells us that not only is it possible to grow cacao, coffee and coca, but also soybeans; they are a very profitable crop, because the local people themselves come to buy it.

This is why his greatest desire is to grow soybean plants, in order to have good income. In the future, he really wants to have a clothing store so his wife can work comfortably. This way, both will be working in their occupations, and thereby give their children a good education. 

This will be his eighth loan with MFP, and he promises to once more be on time with his payments. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, he will buy soybeans for planting on his crop field.

loans.use: To buy soybean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ruly Justiniano

texts.es:
Ruly  es un joven muy trabajador con un espíritu optimista y sobre todo con mucha valentía  a pesar de sus 18 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. En su tiempo libre disfruta mucho de jugar futbol;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le agrada es el riquísimo “Caldo de Gallina. Ruly estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesor. 		

Ruly se dedica al Venta de Pan  en una carreta que él posee, se dedica a este trabajo 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece un buen servicio y productos con calidad y sobre todo frescos. 

Ruly está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque con la ayuda que le han brindo el podrá  comprar otra carreta, ya que la que él tiene actualmente está muy deteriorada, con esta mejora tendrá una carreta en buenas condiciones y le permitirá realizar mejor su trabajo y seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño: Terminar de construir su casa ."
texts.en:
Ruly is a hardworking young man with an optimistic spirit and above all with a lot of courage despite his 18 years. He lives in Ica, Peru. 

Ica is located in the the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital. It is known to Peruvians as "The Land of Sun". It is also known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (one at 8.0 in 2007 and another at 6.9 in 2011), its grape, asparagus, and olive production, and perhaps more than anything as the birthplace of Pisco, the traditional national drink of Peru. In this hot and arid climate one can find Ruly's home and business. In his free time he like to play soccer. As is well known, Peru is characterized around the world by its delicious food and one of its most well known dishes is the delicious "Caldo de Gallina". Ruly studied up to the fifth year of secondary school but he would have liked to have studied to be a teacher. 

Ruly makes a living selling bread from a cart that he has. He works at this business nine hours a day and makes his sales up until 8:00 PM. He believes that the business is going well because he offers good service and quality products that are above all, fresh. 

Ruly is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have given him he can buy another cart. The one he has right now is quite rundown. With this improvement he will have a cart in good condition and it will allow him to improve his work and continue fighting to fulfill his big dream, which is to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy a cart.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo el cual invertirá en el negocio, comprando insumos de cocina que son necesarios para la preparación de las comidas como aceite, condimentos, carnes, gaseosas, para mantener lo suficiente y así darles a los clientes un buen servicio.
Ella considera haber tenido un efecto positivo de la inversión realizada con el préstamo anterior, que le ayudo a mejorar su condición en el negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Maria is applying for a new loan, which she will invest in the business. She will buy supplies needed for preparing meals, such as cooking oil, condiments, meats, and soft drinks. 

She believes that the investment made with the previous loan has had a positive effect, and that it helped her improve her situation, both in her business and in her personal life.
