loans.use: To buy cooking oil, condiments, meats, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jovarelle

texts.fr:
Cliente de 23 ans, celibataire sans enfant,a la fin de ses etudes universitaires ,  elle se lance dans la vente des habits.
Cliente très exemplaire par son historique de remboursement et sa capacité d'épargne, lorsqu'elle bénéficie des prêts, elle renforce le stock de ses habits en faisant des commandes aux fournisseurs a l'étranger, elle vend des ensembles , des tailleurs, des robes en bazin riches... Elle choisit toujours des tenues a la mode, et réserve un accueil chaleureux a ses clientes.
Pour l'avenir , elle a l'intention d'aller a l'étranger pour s'approvisionner et ouvrir une grande boutique
texts.en:
This client is 23 years old and single. She has no children. After her university studies, she began to sell clothing.

She is an exemplary client, as is proven by her repayment history and her savings capacity. When she receives a loan, she increases her supply of clothing by placing orders to foreign suppliers. She sells outfits, suits, dresses of risk damask...She always picks out stylish clothing, and she is very welcoming to her customers.

In the future, she plans to go outside of the country to stock up and open a large store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, women's outfits, bags of sandals

loans.name: Rene Amilcar

texts.es:
René, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, el cual invertirá en mariscos, como pescado de diferentes especies, camarones de varias tamaños y otras clases de mariscos que son de la preferencia de los clientes, este nuevo préstamo le ayudara para mantenerse en su negocio.
Él considera que hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades y que el efecto del préstamo anterior en su negocio fue muy bueno.
texts.en:
René is again applying for a loan, which he will invest in seafood, such as fish of various species, shrimp of various sizes, and other types of seafood that his customers prefer. This new loan will help him stay in business.  

He considers that he hasn't had difficulties to date, and that the effect of the earlier loan on his business was very good.

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es:
Jean Carlos es un joven de 22 años de edad muy responsable y trabajador, soltero y sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres quines también son personas con buenos valores y se dedican a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven está ubicada en  el  Caserío “Pedregal Bajo” a unos 30 minutos del Distrito de Tambogrande provincia de Piura, la cual queda a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo el lugar donde vive es una zona rural en donde solo cuentan con un servicio básico que es la energía eléctrica, la actividad principal de los pobladores es la agricultura.

Jean Carlos se dedica exclusivamente a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (Bodega) en su domicilio donde atiende de lunes a domingo desde la madrugada hasta altas horas de la noche,  además a la crianza de ganado menor y aves de corral, en la parte posterior de su domicilio para lo cual ha acondicionado lugares estratégicos para el mantenimiento de sus animales, su padre quien participa en el crédito estampando su firma como aval apoya a Jean Carlos en todas las actividades diarias con respecto a sus negocios.

Jean Carlos desea implementar mas su negocio comprando mas productos de primera necesidad debido a que considera que su cartera de clientes esta en aumento, y además necesita comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales que hasta el momento tiene en su casa, por lo que ha tenido la idea de solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles para poder lograr sus objetivos, y es que la unión y el esfuerzo que existe con sus padres le dan las fuerzas suficientes para salir adelante para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Jean Carlos aun siendo una persona joven ha demostrado madurez para los negocios por lo que se ha ganado el reconocimiento, respeto y admiración de los vecinos que lo rodean.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos is a 22 year old young man who is very responsible and hardworking. He is single and does not have children. He lives with his parents who are farmers and also people with good values. The house where they live is located in the small village of Pedregal Bajo, some 30 minutes from Tambogrande District in Piura Province, which is. approximately 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. The place where he lives is a rural area that only has basic services such as electricity. The inhabitants’ principal economic activity is farming.

Jean Carlos works exclusively selling staples in his home where, from Monday to Sunday, from dawn until late into the night, he tends his store.  In addition, he raises sheep, goats and poultry at the rear of the house, where he has set up strategic areas to maintain his animals. His father, who is participating in this loan by affixing his signature as co-signer, supports Jean Carlos in all his daily activities associated with his businesses. 

Jean Carlos wants to expand his business by buying more staple products because he feels that his customer base is growing. He also needs to buy feed for his animals, which he has in his house at the moment. Consequently he has had the idea of requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,000 nuevos soles so that he can meet his objectives. The unity and effort that exists between himself and his parents give him sufficient strength to move ahead in order to improve the family’s quality of life.

Even though Jean Carlos is a young person he has demonstrated maturity in his business dealings and has gained the recognition, respect and admiration of his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy more staples as well as feed for his animals

loans.name: Grace Patricia

texts.es: Grace de 29 años recibió un credikiva con el cual compró útiles escolares, accesorios femeninos artículos de piñatería y papelería en general, su negocio quedó muy bien surtido, vendió todo y volvió a invertir. Su capital de trabajo  ha aumentado ligeramente y hoy planea acceder a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará útiles escolares, mercancía de bisutería, tendrá éxito, porque con el favor de Dios, es lo que sus clientes comprarán, teniendo en cuenta que la temporada que se acerca es de ingreso al colegio y los carnavales que demandan mucha bisutería. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida de que me brinden su apoyo con estos créditos, los cuales son de mucha ayuda para mi y para toda mi familia.”
texts.en: Grace, twenty-nine years old, received a Kiva loan which she used to purchase school supplies, feminine accessories, items to make piñatas, and general paper supplies. Her business was well-supplied; she sold everything and invested again. Her working capital has slowly increased, and today she plans to agree to a new Kiva loan, which she will use to purchase school supplies, costume jewelry merchandise. She will have success because, with God’s help, these are the items her customers will buy, keeping in mind that the coming season is when children prepare to go back to school, and when the carnival festival occurs, when many people want costume jewelry. Her message to the Kiva creditors is the following: “I am very grateful for the support you provide me with these loans, which are a very helpful for me and for everyone in my family.”

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.ru: Угулчон трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она вдова и любящая мать четверых несовершеннолетних детей. Более 11 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции, чтобы обеспечить своих детей. Она также занимается скотоводством. Она хочет получить хорошую прибыль, чтобы построит дом. Угулчон хотела бы получить займ для покупки семян картошки и скота.
texts.en: Uguljon is a hardworking and honest woman.  She is a widow and the loving mother of four minor children.  For more than 11 years she has grown  agricultural products to support her children.  She also is engaged in raising cattle.  She wants to earn a good profit in order to build a house.  Uguljon would like to take out a loan to buy potato seed and cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia Mabel

texts.es:
Ofelia, se ha decidido por solicitar otro préstamo, ya que quiere darle seguimiento a la inversión anterior, sin descuidar el crecimiento del negocio, actualmente invertirá en frutas frescas, peras, manzanas, papayas, mango, para variar el negocio.
Su experiencia anterior fue buena, porque ha logado salir con el pago del préstamo y las ventas en este periodo fueron mejor.
texts.en:
Ofelia has decided to request another loan because she wants to follow up on the previous investment, without neglecting her business.  Currently she will invest in fresh fruit: pears, apples, papayas, and mangos, to vary the business.

Her previous experience was good because she managed to get the payment from the loan, and the sales for this period were better.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit: pears, apples, papayas, and mangos.

loans.name: Mamat

texts.ru: Мамат проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 63 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается изготовлением окон и дверей. В этой области он 12 лет. Его сын работает вместе с ним. Он берет кредит для покупки досок и клея.
texts.en: Mamat lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 63 years old, married and has five children.  He is engaged in the manufacture of windows and doors.  He has been in this field for 12 years.  His son works along with him.  He is taking out the loan to buy lumber and glue.

loans.use: to buy lumber and glue

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry, 31 years old, is married to Emily and supports four members of his family. He owns a retail shop that has existed for two years and it earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Henry has requested a loan of KES 30,000 that he will use to purchase five bales of baking flour, cooking fat and three boxes of bar soap and detergents. He will use his profit to expand his business and support his family. Henry's dream is to own his own enterprises in diverse towns.

loans.use: To purchase baking flour, cooking fat, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Jessica Annabel

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadi de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessica, tiene 25 años de edad, hace un tiempo atrás su marido falleció y quedo sola con sus dos hijas de 6 y 5 años de edad, que ahora son su fuerza y ganas de salir adelante, ellas estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 

Ella tiene un negocio en sociedad con un hermano, se dedican a la compra y venta de de ciertos productos los mismos que los compran en distribuidoras directo de fabrica y luego en el carro de su hermano se desplazan por las tiendas de la ciudad entregando sus productos, ellos vende caramelos y productos de la marca Johnson y Johnson como: colonias y shampoo, también venden papel higiénico y pañales. Llevan más de tres años que se dedican a esta actividad y gracias a esto ella puede salir adelante con sus hijas.

Este crédito es para comprar colonias, caramelos, pañales, entre otras cosas que entregan. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los intereses bajos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeñas hijas.
texts.en:
In the town of Cadi, in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hard-working people, many of whom are farmers and ranchers, every two weeks the members of the Nueva Ilusión [New Dream] Communal Bank meet.

Here we meet Jessica, who is twenty-five years old. A little while ago her husband passed away, leaving her alone with her two daughters, ages six and five, who are now her strength and inspiration to get ahead. Currently, they study in school, and she lives in her parents’ home.

She has a business together with her brother. They buy and sell certain products. They purchase goods direct from factory distributors and then sell the products from her brother’s car to stores in the city. They sell candies and Johnson and Johnson brand products such as cologne and shampoo, as well as toilet paper and diapers. They have worked in this way for more than three years, and thanks to their efforts she is able to get ahead with her daughters.

This loan is to purchase cologne, candies, and diapers, among other things. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for two years, and she likes it because the loans are quickly available and the interest rates are low.

Her dream is to provide her little daughters the best in life.

loans.use: to purchase candies, cologne, and diapers, etc.

loans.name: Mahmudchon

texts.ru: Махмудчон женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Более 16 лет он занимается в агробизнесе и имеет богатый опыт. Махмудчон имеет землю и там выращивает картофеля. Кроме этого он занимается купле- продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Махмудчон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, семян и скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Mahmudchon is married and is a responsible father of four children. He has been in the farming business for over 16 years and has a wealth of experience. Mahmudchon has a plot of land where he grows potatoes. In addition, he also buys and resells cattle and smaller farm animals. Mahmudchon is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizer, seeds and cattle. He is hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, seeds and cattle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 45 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has six children between the ages of 6 and 25. All the children live at home  and are in school. Esther has been selling  fish in the local market for ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh cassava fish and butter nose fish for her business. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh cassava and butter nose fish

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is single and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale,

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 16 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her hair dressing salon.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair braids, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy braids

loans.name: Nelida Sthela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadi de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelida, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 16,  13 y 10 años de edad, todos estudian los tres mayores en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas y de productos  Yanbal y Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana de dos a tres horas diarias, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Las sabanas las compra en Picoaza en una distribuidora que le dejan a muy buen precio. Tiene siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes y cremas ya que  son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a aumentar su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In the town of Cadi, in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hard-working people, many of whom are farmers and ranchers, every two weeks the members of the Nueva Ilusión [New Dream] Communal Bank meet.

Nelida, thirty-five years old, lives here. She is married, and has four children, ages seventeen, sixteen, thirteen and ten, from this relationship. They are all in school, the three oldest in high school, and the youngest in elementary school. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a homemaker who, in order to earn her own income and help her husband cover their daily living costs, sells sheets and Yanbal and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three days a week, two to three hours a day. She leaves her products on credit and collects payments weekly. She purchases the sheets in the Picoazá parish at a distributor that offers them to her at a good price. She has worked this way for seven years, and her business is going well. Her best sellers are the perfumes and creams since they are very good quality products.

This loan is to purchase sheets, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for more than three years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her to increase her business.

Her dream is to have a car to use to sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, perfume, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem, 55, lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is a good mother to 3 children and has tried hard in order to provide a comfortable life and further education to her children. She has spent most of her time working outdoors in her field. Her common crops are rice, potatoes and a few kinds of beans. Her husband helps manage all of the farming process.

Kem is taking this loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase bean seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to keep her crops in good condition. She will open a grocery store from her home if she has enough capital. Kem is very happy and thankful to our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es: Lastenia de 56 años,  es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 24 a 30 años. Desde hace 3 años,  Lastenla inició un negocio comprando una vitrina y surtiéndola de artículos de papelería, como lápices, bolígrafos etc,  que usualmente compran los estudiantes, aprovechando que ubicaron un colegio frente a su casa, en un barrio del sur de la ciudad. Gradualmente ha empezado a vender helados, dulces y a ofrece el servicio de llamadas a celulares a los clientes que mas que los antiguos estudiantes, son hoy,  amas de casa, profesores, y en general vecinos del sector. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para cumplirles a sus clientes de manera efectiva, aumentar su capital y ayudarle a lograr los sueños de sus hijos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará papelería y útiles escolares, productos con los cuales responderá a las exigencias de la temporada. Su meta mas adelante es convertir su pequeño negocio en un almacén de variedades. Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 37%, indicador financiero desde el cual planea crecer.
texts.en:
Lastenia, 56, is married with 3 children, ages 24 to 30 years old. Three years ago, she started a business by buying a display cabinet and stocking it with stationary items, such as pencils, pens, etc. that students commonly buy, taking advantage of the fact that a school is located across from her house in a neighborhood in the southern part of the city. Gradually she began to sell ice cream and sweets and to offer cell phone services to customers, who, in addition to students are today also house wives, teachers and neighbors in the area.

Lastenia’s major challenge is not having sufficient working capital to effectively meet her customers’ demands. Increasing her capital will also enable her to assist her children in realizing their dreams. This is the reason she has come to request her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy stationary and school supplies, products that will meet seasonal demand. Her later goal is to convert her small business into a variety store. In the meantime, she manages no less than a 37% return on sales, a profitability indicator from which she plans to grow.

loans.use: to buy stationary and school supplies.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Тохирджон умный и молодой парень. Он занимается услугами такси, а также ремонтирует легкового автомобиля. Несмотря на свои молодые годы, он является очень успешным и опытным таксистом и у него много клиентов. Его брат и отец уехали на заработки в Федерации России, а он и его младший брат содержит семью. Тохирджон запрашивает займ для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он надеется на вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Tohirjon is an intelligent young man.  He is engaged in the taxi business and he also repairs passenger cars.  In spite of his young age, he is a very successful and experienced taxi driver and he has many clients.  His brother and father left to work in the Russian Federation, so he and his younger brother support the family.  Tohirjon is requesting a loan to repair his car.  He is relying on your kindness and assistance.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Roy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Roy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale and will help Roy to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Roy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Roy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Roy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Aurora Pastora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora aurora tiene 47 años, es casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos pero uno de ellos falleció  hace algunos años,  tres de ellos son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 13 años y estudia en colegio y es el que aun vive en su casa ya que los otros ya son independientes. Su  esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la cría de pollos y chanchos, a la agricultura y  compra y venta de frutas, su esposo  recorre los campos comprando los productos de la zona como naranjas, mandarinas, limón, sandias, melón, etc. y  llevan a entregar a Portoviejo y también una vez por semana envían estos productos a la ciudad de Quito ya que allá los venden a mejor precio por ser frutas de la costa, uno de sus hijos es el que recibe estos productos en esta ciudad y se encarga de vender y cobrar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas de todo tipo para enviara  a Portoviejo y Quito, así como también alimento para chanchos. Lleva más de 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir. 

Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida y un camión.
texts.en:
Every two weeks Quiroga Communal Bank meets in the Quiroga parish of the city of Calceta, a town where the people work mainly in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.

Aurora, 47, is married and has five children from this relationship.  One of them died a few years ago, three are of age, and the youngest is 13 and studies in high school and still lives at home, because the others are already independent.  Her husband is a storekeeper.

She and her husband work raising chickens and pigs, in agriculture, and buying and selling fruit.  Her husband goes around the fields buying products from the area such as oranges, mandarins, lemons, watermelons, melons, etc.  They take them for distribution to Portoviejo and also once a week they send them to the city of Quito because they sell them at a better price there because they are coastal fruits.  One of her children is the one who receives these products in Quito and takes charge of selling them and charging for them.

She is going to use this loan to buy all types of fruits to send to Portoviejo and Quito, as well as pig feed.  She has been in the communal bank for more than eight years and she likes it because of the benefits she has received from Fundación ESPOIR.

Her dreams are to have a well-built house and a truck.

loans.use: to buy fruit and pig feed.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.ru: Рашида замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Рашида более 25 лет занимается кройкой и шитья женской одеждой. У неё очень большой опыт и имеет много учениц. Так как доход от вышивания одежд на заказ очень мизер, её супруг уехал на заработки в России. Рашида запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки швейной машинки с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Rashida is married and the loving mother of three children.  Rashida has been engaged in dressmaking for more than 25 years. She has a great deal of experience and she has many students.  As the income from embroidering clothes to order is hardly anything, her spouse left to find work in Russia.  

With the goal of expanding her business, Rashida is requesting a loan for 5000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он открыл аптеку. В этой области Бахром три года. Он берет кредит для приобретения медикаментов.
texts.en: Bahrom lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 31 years old, married, and has three children.  He has opened a pharmacy.  He has worked in this field for three years.  He is taking out a loan to buy medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 26 años es un hombre que no le gusta estar sin hacer nada, siempre esta en constante dinamismo y trabajo. Convive con Susan de 18 años con quien tiene un pequeño hijo Bryan de 1 año. Juntos viven en casa de los padres de su pareja. Lo que mas desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. A diario Segundo sale a las calles de la ciudad en su mototaxi, va en busca de eventuales pasajeros que tengan necesidad de movilizarse dentro o fuera de la ciudad de manera segura y sobre todo con tranquilidad. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 5 años y en todo éste tiempo aprendió mucho del negocio. Se siente bien con su trabajo debido a que tiene buenas ganancias, dispone de tiempo suficiente para poder hacer otras actividades. Asimismo nos comenta que anteriormente trabaja con un vehículo ajeno al cual alquilaba, y eso significaba que las ganancias eran bajas, ahora cuenta con uno propio y por ende sus ingresos han aumentado. Este será su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que está muy contento ya que siempre ha deseado que alguna entidad financiera le diera la oportunidad de poder crecer su negocio. Esta muy convencido de ser un cliente puntual y sobre todo no defraudar a la institución que le esta permitiendo realizar en parte su sueño. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará algunas piezas y repuestos para refaccionar su vehiculo ya que con el pasar del tiempo y el mal estado de las pistas se deterioraron, todo lo hace para el bienestar de sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Segundo, 26, is a man who does not like to be with nothing to do.  He always has constant energy and work.  He lives with Susan, 18, with whom he has a young son, Bryan, age 1.  Together they live in the house of his partner's parents.  What he wants most is to give his family a better quality of life.

Every day Segundo goes out to the streets of the city in his motorcycle taxi.  He goes in search of eventual passengers who need to get around within or outside the city securely and, above all, peacefully.  He has been doing this job for five years and in all this time he learned a lot about the business.

He feels good about his job because he has good profits.  He has sufficient time to be able to do other activities.  He also tells us that previously he worked with a vehicle that belonged to someone else that he rented, and this meant that his profits were low.  Now he has his own vehicle and as a result his income has increased.

This will be his first loan with the MFP institution, for which is he very happy because he always has wanted for some financial institution to give him the opportunity to be able to grow his business.  He is completely convinced that he will be a punctual client and, above all, will not disappoint the institution that is allowing him to realize in part his dream.

With the requested loan of 800 PEN he will buy some parts and spare parts to refurbish his vehicle, because they deteriorated with the passing of time and the bad road conditions.  He does everything for the well-being of his passengers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Quinche Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Quinche, tiene 51 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de la misma ha tenido 6 hijos, todos sus hijos son  mayores de edad y aun viven en su casa a pesar de que dos ya tienen compromiso. Su marido es agricultor.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama casa que se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos,  tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, compra los pollos y los chanchos cuando aun están pequeños y luego los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses a los pollos y a los chanchos un poco más de tiempo, cuando están listos los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a los distintos mercados de la provincia. Trabaja todos los días ya que es algo que lo hace sin salir de casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más pollos y alimento tanto para pollos y chanchos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 8 años y le gusta ya que con los créditos ha podido salir adelante.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Quiroga Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Quiroga parish in the city of Calceta, an area where the people largely engage in agriculture, animal raising and the sale of farm and animal products.

Here we meet Sra. Quinche, 51, who lives with her common law husband with whom she has had 6 children, all now adults and all still living at home, even though two are engaged. Her husband is a farmer.

She is a very good mother and housewife who raises chickens and pigs. She has a small farm business at her house. She buys the chickens and pigs when they are young and then feeds and cares for the chickens two or three months and the pigs a little longer. When they are ready, she sells them to merchants who come to her house and carry them off to different markets in the province. She works every day since it is something she can do without leaving the house. 

She will use this loan to buy more chickens and feed for both chickens and pigs. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for more than 8 years and likes it because the loans have enabled her to move ahead.

Her dream is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens as well as feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Vicenta Lucia

texts.es:
Vicenta Lucia actualmente se dedica a brindar enseñanza a estudiantes de un centro educativo. Actualmente es una joven universitaria con espíritu de superación el cual tuvo la oportunidad de conocer que  Ceprodel apoyaba a las personas con créditos para su desarrollo.

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de útiles escolares para continuar sus estudios universitarios estando consciente que logrará sus metas y saldrá adelante, de igual manera, comprará algunos medicamentos debido a que ha estado un poquito afectada de salud pero el pensar que pronto llegará a ser una gran profesional, la motiva a seguir luchando para lograr este sueño tan preciado
texts.en:
Vicenta Lucia currently works teaching students in an educational center.  She is a young university student with the spirit of improving herself who had the opportunity to learn that CEPRODEL was helping people with loans for their development.

This is why she came to request a loan to buy school supplies to continue her university studies, being aware that she will achieve her goals and get ahead.  At the same time, she will buy some medicine because her health has been suffering a bit.  Thinking that soon she will become a great professional motivates her to keep fighting to realize this valuable dream.

loans.use: to buy medicine and school supplies.

loans.name: Qumru

texts.en:
Qumru is a 47-year-old woman, married with two sons. She is a market vendor and sells children's and women's clothes in the central market. She has 15 years of experience and has gained the necessary skills and experience to run her business successfully. Her husband helps her to update merchandise and sell products. The products she sells are in high demand because she has good taste and is always friendly and polite with customers. Her monthly income is 230 Azerbaijani manats (AZN).

Qumru applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase and diversify her winter clothes stock. She has a positive credit history and this will be her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase and diversify winter clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar and soap. To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale and will help Florence to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves microentrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is age 38 and has been in active farming for 15 years producing and selling tobacco, beans, green grams (mung beans), maize and poultry eggs and birds for the local market. He currently employs five casual farmhands on his farm. He notes that limited rains remain the main challenge in farming. Besides his farming business, he trades in charcoal as well. He lives with his family of four children in their rural home in the Nkubu area.

Richard has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy both a bull and a cart to transport his farm produce to the market, as well as to ease the transport costs for his charcoal business. He says this will increase his income from both farming and selling charcoal and will avail him of the finances required to help him meet his family's needs, with the main one being the education of his three children still in school.

loans.use: to buy a bull and a cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers and towels for sale.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is a 55-year-old mother who has been married for 30 years. She has four lovely children who are not living under her care; all of them are married and live in separate houses from each other. 

Presently, Sam generates her income by doing business as a farmer. From her business, she can earn about $2.00 per day to cover her daily family expenses. Besides farming, she and her husband plan to start another business raising fish to increase household income. She is lacking funds for purchasing fish and fish feeds, so she would like to apply for a loan through HKL, partner of Kiva. She will use this loan to buy fish feed. She hopes that this funding will make her business earn more income to provide daily sustenance for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish and fish feeds.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр с женой и тремя детьми живет в Водяном. Он занимается тепличным бизнесом, имеет 8 больших построенных теплиц. Хозяйство у Александра большое, но на огороде всегда порядок. В теплицах Александр ежегодно садит 12 000 кустов помидор, как высокорослых, так и низкорослых. Участок земли, на котором он выращивает помидоры, расположен на берегу водохранилища, что защищает посадки от утренних морозов. Фермерским делом Александр занимается уже 17 лет. Ежегодно на семена и пленку уходит до 50 000 гривен в затратах.  

Александр планирует вложить кредит КИВА суммой в 20 000 гривен в постройку дополнительной теплицы на большом участке земли, который семья приобрела в прошлом году с целью расширения хозяйства. Александр планирует и в дальнейшем ставить новые теплицы на своем новом участке, общим размером в 0.87 гектара. Также есть планы сделать отопление на своем участке. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexander, his wife and three children live in Vodyanoye.  He is engaged in the greenhouse farming business and has eight large greenhouses.  His farm is big, but everything is always kept in order.  Every year, Alexander plants 12,000 tomato bushes of both high- and low-growing varieties in his greenhouses.  The part of his land on which he grows tomatoes is situated on the shore of a reservoir, which protects the plantings from morning frosts.  Alexander has been farming for 17 years now.  Every year he has expenses of up to 50,000 hriven (UAH) for seed and plastic film for the greenhouses.

Alexander is planning to invest the 20,000 hriven loan he receives through KIVA in the building of an additional greenhouse on a large piece of land that his family bought last year with the goal of enlarging the farm.  Alexander has future plans to put new greenhouses on the new piece of land, which is 0.87ha in size.  There are also plans to install heating systems in the greenhouses.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to build an additional greenhouse on a recently purchased piece of land

loans.name: Luiza

texts.ru:
Луиза замужем, у нее две дочки. Вся семья живет в Мелитополе. Луиза занимается торговлей игрушками для детей на одном из местных рынков своего родного города. В торговле она работает уже 17 лет. Опыт работы и интерес к делу очень помогают Луизе эффективно вести бизнес. За время работы Луиза вложила в товар 45 000 гривен. Ее доход составляет около 7 000 гривен. 

Кредит КИВА Луиза планирует вложить в реконструкцию торгового места и закупку мягких игрушек оптом для последующей розничной реализации. Луизе нравится работать с данным товаром и она хотела бы и в дальнейшем развивать свой бизнес, получив дополнительную прибыль от продаж.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Luiza is married and has two daughters. Their family lives in Melitopol. Luiza sells children’s toys at one of the local markets in her native town. She has been in sales for 17 years. A long work experience and enthusiasm for her work help Luiza to manage her business efficiently. Over time, Luiza has invested 45,000 UAH in her inventory. Her revenues are about 7,000 UAH.

Luiza plans to use Kiva's credit to repair her vending booth and to buy stuffed animals wholesale in order to retail them later. Luzia enjoys working with this type of goods, and she would like to continue growing her business  by increasing her sales revenues.

Note: the loan description is in Russian.

loans.use: to repair her vending booth and stock up on stuffed animals for resale

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods in her shop. She has six years of experience.  She is knowledgeable and skilled in her business.  She sells foodstuff like candies, cookies, butter, macaroni as well as hair color and some cosmetics. 

The products she sells is very popular in Azerbaijan and move quickly from shelves. Hafiza's business brings her 350 AZN in profit. It is hard to keep her customers satisfied with this income, because Hafiza needs to make some savings and can’t put all the income into the business again. This is the only financial source for her family. 

Hafiza needs to expand her business and for this purpose she has applied for 1500 AZN in loan. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for her shop. This will be her 2rd loan from AqroInvest CU and she has a good client history.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Vit is a 42-year-old married mother with four lovely children living in Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province. She has one child who is still living under her care, and the other three are married and live in separated houses.  

Vit has a life partner in her husband, who is in the same business as her as a rice cultivator.  Both of them have been involved with this business since 1990. From this business activity, this humble couple is able to get suitable outcomes every year.  

To upgrade their living, this humble couple wishes to start another type of business, hog-raising. So Mrs. Vit decided with her family to request some funds through HKL, a partner of Kiva, to purchase some piglets. Ms. Vit said that “this fund is very useful for her new business”.  She is very thankful to all kind lenders who always help her family to leave poverty. She committed that she will pay back her loan on time to all kind lenders.

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, está decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere reparar algunas viviendas, como parte de su negocio, invirtiendo más que todo el techo, por eso comprara con el dinero de este préstamo teja y madera, para hacer las reparaciones respectivas, dando continuidad al negocio y al servicio de los clientes.   
Él considera que el préstamo anterior fue una buena oportunidad para desarrollo y crecimiento de él y su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan decided to apply for a new loan because he wants to repair some houses, as part of his business. He needs to invest in more than just the roofing, and with the money from this loan he will purchase tiles and wood to complete the repairs. This will enable him to continue his business and provide good service to his customers.

Juan believes that the previous loan was a good opportunity for his professional and personal development and growth.

loans.use: to purchase tiles and wood.

loans.name: Flerida Aracely

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flerida, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 11 y de 1 año, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella realiza el crédito para su negocio y para el negocio de su esposo el cual se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende helados Pingüino, además de colas, jugos y ciertos bocadillos de picar, tiene más de 12 años su negocio y con los créditos ella lo ha podido mejorar conforme ha ido pasando el tiempo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más helados, sodas y ganado para el negocio del esposo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 10 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad de Calceta.
texts.en:
The parish of Quiroga, in the city of Calceta, is a town where people are largely involved in agriculture, animal breeding and selling their products. The Communal Bank of Quiroga meets every fortnight.

Here we met Mrs. Flerida, 33, who is married with three children aged 12, 11 and one. The eldest two study at school. Her husband is a businessman.

She is taking this loan for her own business, and for her husband's business which is buying and selling cattle.  Flerida has a place in her house from which she sells 'Penguin' ice cream, as well as sodas, juices and snacks. She has had her business for over 12 years, and through the use of loans she has been able to improve her business as time has gone by.

Flerida will invest her loan in buying more ice cream and sodas, and livestock for her husband's business. She has been a member of the communal bank for over 10 years and likes it because the loans have allowed her to improve her business.
 
Her dream is to have a premises in the center of the Calceta city.

loans.use: to purchase ice creams, sodas, and livestock.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a single mother and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where she lives with her family of two children, aged 9 and 3.  Her farm produces maize and beans, which she sells to the local market.  She also runs a cereals shop within the local market for additional income.

Pamela has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming.  She says the loan will help her improve her farming income and enable her to educate her children.  She is focusing on buying two dairy cows for a venture into dairy farming as well.

She says finding sources for funding is her main challenge and is glad Juhudi Kilimo is helping farmers with loan services.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married 53-year-old farmer with 4 adult children.  He has been in farming for over 20 years.  His farm produces and sells maize, beans, milk, potatoes to the local market.  He also supplies water to the local market for additional income besides farming.

Joshua has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy dairy goats.  He says dairy goats are popular because of their nutritional values and ready market since farmers have not ventured into it in big numbers.  He adds its easy to run a goats farm due to their ability to survive during dry seasons.

Joshua says farmers are facing many challenges, with the major ones being poor infrastructure, drought and the high costs of inputs like seeds.  He appreciates the trainings Juhudi Kilimo organizes for its clients.

loans.use: buy dairy goats

loans.name: Belisa Cathy

texts.es:
Belisa es una mujer muy luchadora, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, por su agricultura, la pesca y sobre todo por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, como buena peruana ama nuestra comida y uno de los platos que más le gusta es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”, cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta bailar ya que eso le ayuda a despejarse cuando se siente preocupada o esta de mal humor.

Belisa trabaja en la venta de calzado para damas, caballeros y niños ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 15 horas a la semana ya que ella vende sus productos los días domingos, atiende alrededor de 25 clientes a la semana, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos bonitos y al gusto del cliente.
Belisa agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar calzado de temporada de verano, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos y poder tener más ingresos y así seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Ser una empresaria de Éxito”.
texts.en:
Belisa is a feisty woman living in the city of Camaná, which is characterized by its beautiful beaches, agriculture, fisheries and especially the friendliness of its people. As a good Peruvian, she loves her food and one of the dishes she likes most is the delicious "chupe de camarones" (shrimp chowder). When she has a little time off she likes to dance, which helps her to relax when she feels worried or is in a bad mood.

Belisa works in the sale of men;s, women's and children's footwear. She works about 15 hours a week, and she sells her products on Sundays. She serves about 25 clients a week, she says her business is going well because she offers very good products to her customers.

Belisa is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to your help she can buy summer shoes, allowing her to offer a greater variety of products, increase her income, and keep fighting to fulfill her dream of "being a successful entrepreneur".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (summer footwear)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 41 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children, one of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells drinks. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks like sodas and beer for resale, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey is a married 68-year-old man who has five children aged 35, 33, 30, 27 and 25 years old.  His spouse is Nancy, a business lady who hawks milk. Aggrey is a dairy farmer in the Lelechwet location and has been in operation over a period of 30 years earning a monthly income of KES. 18,000.

He is taking a second loan of KES. 94,000 after he successfully paid the previous loan. He will use the loan amount to purchase two dairy cows and dairy feeds. 

The anticipated amount will be used to expand the dairy farm and add more animals and to repay the loan. His dream is to prosper in dairy farming and live a happy life.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Hadiyya

texts.en:
Hadiyya is a 43-year-old married woman with two children.  Hadiyya breeds poultry and  raise fruits and vegetables in her garden. She has 5 years of experience.  She is a knowledgeable and skilled person in her business.

Hadiyya usually raises and fattens the chickens for a month and then resells them for more profitable prices in the livestock bazaar and to neighbors. Her monthly income is 320 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for her family.  

Chicken and turkey meat is very popular and people use it in everyday cuisine.  In autumn and winter, turkey is the most popular meat and meals like kababs and turkey soup exist in everyday meals.
  
Hadiyya wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions for her family. She applied for 1000 AZN in loan to purchase poultry, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: buy chickens, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mov

texts.en:
Mov is a 37-year-old married woman living in Reussey Keo Commune in Phnom Penh City.  She is a responsible mother of three children who are living under her care. She is a hard-working and kind woman.  All inhabitants who live near her are very friendly with her because she is the one person who always takes care of other persons like her family. 

Presently, Mov operates a business as a tailor in a market near her community.  Because of her friendliness and honesty, she has lots of clients who prefer to use her services. She would like to expand her business but is lacking some capital.  Therefore, she wishes to request an amount of $200 from HKL for the purpose of purchasing a sewing machine.  She is expecting that this fund will make her career grow more in benefit and sustainable income, and she wishes to see her children get a high education.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 53-year-old married man blessed with 2 children both aged 22 years old.  His spouse Alice rears poultry on their family farm.  Charles is a farmer in the Kaptich location and has been in operation over a period of 13 years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

He is taking a second loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase two dairy cows.  

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his farm and improve the living standards of his family. He hopes to own more livestock and expand the farm.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Yavar

texts.en:
Yavar is a 51-year-old married woman with three children. She is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies.  She has ten years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients. 

The food products she sells is very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 300 AZN.  Her husband helps to purchase the products and bring them to the shop.  This is the sole financial income for her family.  She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

Yavar applied for 900 AZN in loan to purchase more food products and diversify her range of goods to cover customers' demand.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a farmer in Nkubu in Central Kenya.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 13 and 9, both are schooling.  She has been active in farming for 15 years and sells her current produce of maize, tomatoes and potatoes to the local market.

Florence has requested a loan of 25,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.  She hopes to get eggs for family consumption and for sale to meet other family needs.  Her main focus is to pay for the education of her children with the farming loan as well as build a better residential house for her family.

She laments of low market prices for farm produce and the cost of dairy feeds, and appreciates the services Juhudi Kilimo is giving to farmers.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Ms. Chorn is an 18-year-old married young mother of one kid. She is living in a region which commonly produces crops such as rice, vegetables, potatoes and also livestock. She now runs a potato planting business on about two hectares of land. Presently, she is lacking some capital for collecting her output from this business, so she has decided with her family to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva, for the purpose of hiring some employees to pull potatoes out of the ground. Through these funds, she hopes that her business will improve and she will save more profit. For her expectation in the future, she would like to see her family live in comfort and prosperity and she wishes her child to be a very knowledgeable person.

loans.use: to hire some employees to pull potatoes out of the ground.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 31-year-old lady from Kisumu city, West of Kenya.  She is married to John and they have three children, aged between seven and twelve years.

Lilian operates a beauty salon, a business she has been doing for the last 2 years, and makes a monthly income of KES 18,000.   She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy a stock of hair weaves, wigs and hair pieces. She will use profits to establish a clothes shop.  Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: buy hair weaves, wigs and hair pieces

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is a resident of Nkubu area. He is 49 years old and married with five children who are all adults, save for the last two. He has been in farming for 20 years and currently employs two farmhands on a permanent basis with seven others engaged regularly on a casual basis. His farm produces maize, beans, green grams, tobacco and poultry.

Japhet has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a bull and a cart. He says these will help in making his deliveries to the market, in earning more from transport to other farmers and in plowing the farm. He says he also wants to increase the acreage of his farm and expand his farming business from all fronts.

He, however, points at low rains, pests and animal diseases as constant threats to his production.

loans.use: To buy a bull and a cart

loans.name: Handfory

texts.en: Handfory live in Jacobs Town. She is 24 years old and single with a two-year-old child. For the past 12 years, she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She started this with help from her oldest sister. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem, 50, is a windowed mother, living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is living dependently and the other two are working in various career: one is a construction worker and another is a factory worker in Phnom Penh city where she can earn enough salary per month. Presently, Hem is in the business of cultivating rice, from which she is able to earn approximately $1.50 per day. In order to upgrade her living to comfortable conditions as others, she would like to request some funds from all kind donors to purchase construction supplies to support her son’s business. She said that, the funds are very advantageous for her family. She committed to pay punctually all kind lenders.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to support her son’s business.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a business lady who owns a salon that she has been working in for five years now. She is married to Stanley and they are blessed with two children aged two and nine years respectively.

The salon business earns her KES. 8,000 per month. She has requested Kshs 30,000 to buy a blow drier, weaves, and hair chemicals.

The profit she gets would help her open other businesses. Her dream is to own multiple businesses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy a blow drier, weaves, and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 52 years old married to Hellen. They are blessed with three children aged 26 years, 21 years, and 17 years respectively. He sells cereal products, a business he started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 8,500. 

Alexander has requested a loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase bags of beans, rice, maize and green grams (a type of bean) to stock in his business. 

The profit he makes from his business would help him repay his loan. He hopes to construct a cereals store and manage it.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans, rice, maize, and green grams, to stock in his business.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 51 years old, married, and owns a retail shop. She has been in this business for 17 years and earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. She has requested a loan worth KES 100,000 to purchase four bags of sugar, three boxes of soap, and 15 crates of soda.

She will use her profit to repay her loan and open up an M-pesa shop. Her dream is to open a wholesale store. This is her fourth loan.

loans.use: To purchase four bags of sugar, three boxes of soap, and 15 crates of soda.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and only two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She sells African attire (clothes) in a shop on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from selling firewood. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. 

She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more pieces of African attire (clothes). Her major business challenges are transportation, the increasing prices of clothes, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build rental houses, and also to start importing African attire from the Democratic Republic of Congo. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of African attire.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a farmer in Kitale in Western Kenya, where he lives with his family of six children who are all schooling. He has been in active farming for six years and reiterates that farming has been his sole source of family livelihood for the time he has been in active farming. He sells his produce of milk and eggs to the local market.

Abel has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to focus on being among the major suppliers of milk for the local market. He wants to own five dairy cows in five years.

Abel says animal diseases remain a major challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Jackline is a business lady who owns a boutique and a dairy farm, a business she has been doing for the past seven years. She is married to Stephen and is blessed with four children who are aged 22, 17, 14 and 11 years respectively. 

The business helps her support her family and earns her a monthly income of 20,700 Kenyan shillings (KES). 
 
She has requested a loan worth 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase ladies skirts and blouses for her boutique and also to buy animal feeds. 

The anticipated profit will help her venture into poultry farming. Her dream is to become a prominent businesswoman. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy more animal feeds and purchase ladies skirts, blouses and suits for the boutique.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a farmer in Kitale. She is married with 7 children - the youngest five children are still in school. She is 50 years old and produces maize and milk for the local market. She fully relies on her farming income for the daily upkeep of her family.

Christine has requested a loan of 41,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and construct a dairy unit at 10,000 KES. She says her improved milk production will go into meeting the family's daily needs.

She laments serious food shortage for dairy cows at times. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 29 years old and is married to Japheth. They are blessed with one child. She is a tailor in the area of Kangundo. She has been in this business for the last 3 years and gets an income of 10,000 KES per month.

Christine is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy material for making clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into her business. She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 45 year old lady from Kisumu City and is married to George. They have seven children aged between 12 to 25 years.

Florence is a water distributor, a business she has done for the last 12 years, making a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD., which she will use to buy a water tank. Her profits will be used to educate her children.

Her dream is to buy land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Domitila Filadelfia

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Domitila, tiene 65 años,  está casada hace muchos años y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, los cuatro ya son mayores de edad y uno de sus hijos falleció hace algún tiempo atrás. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, compra y venta de leche. También tiene una pequeña granja de pollos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 que recibe la leche cerca de su casa, mas tarde  se dedica  junto su esposo a entregarla por todo  el sector, en cuanto a los pollos los tiene por espacio de dos a tres meses, luego los pela y los entrega en tiendas o los vende por libras a personas de la localidad. Lleva más de 14 años en esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar leche, pollos, medicinas y alimentos para los pollos.  Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. 

Su sueño es tener una granja más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Ilusión Communal Bank meet every fifteen days in the Cadí area of the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, which is known for its hardworking people who practice farming and ranching for a living.

This is where we met Domitila, who is 65 years old, has been married for many years, and who has five children, four of whom are now grown and one of whom passed away some time ago.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a housewife who deals in buying and selling milk in order to help her husband with their household expenses.  She also has a small chicken farm.  She works every day starting at 6:00 a.m., when she receives the milk close to her home.  Later, she and her husband deliver it all around their area.  As far as the chickens are concerned, she keeps them for a period of two or three months, then she plucks them and delivers them to stores or sells them by the pound to people in her neighborhood.  She has been doing this for over 14 years.

She will use this loan to buy milk, chickens, medicine, and feed for her chickens.  She is a founding member of her communal bank and she likes it because the loans are very helpful.

Her dream is to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: to buy milk, chickens, medicine, and feed for the chickens

loans.name: Herber Humberto

texts.es:
Herber, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en mejoras al negocio, ya que la demanda ha aumentado y ya sus mobiliario no alcanza, comprando mesas, manteles y sillas, con la instalación de nuevo mobiliario, podrá mejorar la atención a la clientela.
Él manifiesta haber tenido una muy buena inversión con el préstamo anterior, ya que le ha permitido crecer y mantenerse fortalecido para atender la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
Herber is asking for a new loan to spend on improvements to his business, as his demand has increased and he no longer has enough furniture.  He will buy tables, table cloths, and chairs.  With the installation of the new furniture, he will be able to offer his clientele better service.

He has proven to have made a very wise investment with his previous loan, as it allowed him to grow and stay strong in order to meet his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy tables, table cloths, and chairs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carlos Asmel

texts.es:
Carlos, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de insumos agrícolas para utilizarlos en la siembra, pues está comenzando con un nuevo proceso de siembra, su compra será en herbicidas, abono, semilla mejorada.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió tener lo necesario para realizar su trabajo en el negocio de medicinas, mejorando en lo económico y la alimentación de la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos has decided to request a new loan to buy farming supplies to use in planting, as he is starting to use a new planting process.  He will buy herbicides, fertilizer, and improved seed.

He believes his previous loan allowed him to get what he needed to perform his work in his medicine business, which improved his finances and his ability to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer, and improved seed

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es: Ruth de 36 años de edad con su anterior credikiva compró ranchos, víveres, licores y verduras, las vendió y volvió a invertir en su negocio. Ahora sus inventarios están mejor organizados y esta bien surtida. En la actualidad aprovechará la temporada de carnaval para hacer un nuevo credikiva, porque es en esta época en la cual, sus ventas se incrementan especialmente en los productos de misceláneas, porque sus clientes bajo el lema disfrázate como quieras, compran temperas, escarcha, accesorios entre otros artículos, con los cuales la gente se va a divertir en los diversos escenarios naturales de la capital de departamento del Atlántico y de los municipios que también celebran sus carnavales. Su nuevo credikiva tendrá éxito porque lo hace sobre la base de su experiencia en esta época, en la que conoce perfectamente las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Estoy muy agradecida por el apoyo que me han brindado, que me ha  permitido obtener mejores ingresos para mi negocio y mis familia”.
texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old Ruth used her previous Kiva loan to buy food, supplies, liquor, and vegetables.  She sold them and reinvested in her business.  Now her inventory is better organized and she is well stocked.  Currently, she will take advantage of the carnival season to take out another Kiva loan because this is the time when her sales increase, especially of miscellaneous products.  This is because her customers, in the name of dressing up, buy poster paint, glitter, and accessories, among other items with which people go and have fun in various natural settings in the capital of the department of Atlántico and the towns that also celebrate carnival.  Her new Kiva loan will be successful because she is taking it out based on her experience with this season; she knows the wants and needs of her customers perfectly.  Her message to Kiva's lenders is the following, "I am very thankful for the help you have offered me, which has allowed me to earn more for my business and my family."

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items such as poster paint, glitter, accessories, and other items

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro vive en la ciudad de Camaná, tierra generosa la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus hermosas playas, su agricultura y su gente generosa, como buen peruano ama la comida y uno de los platillos que más le agrada es la riquísima “Carapulcra”, Alejandro estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar agronomía porque le gusta mucho el campo, el es casado y junto a su esposa tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad el cual cursa el segundo año de educación secundaria y por el cual el y su esposa darían la vida por darle lo mejor y que él sea feliz.

Alejandro se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, se levanta muy temprano para iniciar sus labores, dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes de manera mensual, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque cria a los cerdos de manera adecuada con alimentos naturales.

Alejandro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá construir un corral de bloquetas para los cerdos y de esa manera habrá mas limpieza para la crianza de los cerdos, con ello los clientes sentirán mas confianza en comprar los cerdos y aumentaran los ingresos de Alejandor, para asi seguir luchando y cumplir su gran sueño:” Comprarse una moto para movilizarse”.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives in the city of Camaná, a rich land known for its warm climate, its beautiful beaches, its agriculture, and its generous people.  Like all good Peruvians, he loves food, and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious carapulcra.  Alejandro studied up until the fifth grade, but he would have liked to have studied agronomy because he really likes the country.  He is married and has a 14-year-old son with his wife who is in his second year of high school.  He and his wife would give their lives to offer him the best and make him happy.

Alejandro raises and sells pigs for a living.  He gets up very early to start his work and he spends about 12 hours a day working.  He sees up to 20 customers monthly.  He thinks that his business is going well because he raises his pigs responsibly with natural feed.

Alejandro is very thankful to Kiva's lenders as, thanks to their help, he will be able to build a pen out of cinder blocks for his pigs.  This will make raising his pigs cleaner, which will make his customers more comfortable buying his pigs and which will increase Alejandro's income.  This will allow him to keep fighting and to realize his greatest dream: to buy himself a motorcycle to get around.

loans.use: to build a pig pen

loans.name: Elisa Abigail

texts.es:
Elisa, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales, para fortalecer el negocio, adquiriendo pescado seco, elotes, aceite, para continuar en sus ventas, pues ella considera que estos préstamos le han ayudado mucho para permanece los materiales necesarios en el negocio.
Ella tuvo una buena experiencia con su préstamo anterior, por esta solicitando nuevamente para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Elisa is asking for a new loan to buy materials to strengthen her business.  She will get dried fish, corn, and oil to continue with her sales.  She believes that these loans have greatly helped her remain stocked in the materials she needs for her business.

She had a good experience with her previous loan, which is why she is asking for another loan to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, corn, and oil

loans.name: Birail

texts.es:
Birail, vive acompañada de su esposo que es albañil y agricultor, tambien tienen dos hijas de 2 y 4 años de edad, ella es comerciante de ropa, este surgió por la necesidad de aportar para el hogar y mejorar las condiciones económicas que tiene el hogar, trabaja de forma ambulante desde horas de la mañana.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de más ropa vestidos, interior, faldas, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños, permitiéndole esta inversión surtir el negocio, tener mayor oportunidades de venta y crecer en el. .
Su objetivo es que a través del mejoramiento del negocio tener más capacidad para responder a las obligaciones del hogar, sobre todo a la alimentación y salud de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Birail lives with her husband, who is a bricklayer and a farmer.  They also have two daughters, who are two and four years old.  She sells clothing for a living, which came up because she needed to contribute to their home and improve their financial conditions.  She works on foot starting out early in the morning.

She is asking for a loan to buy more clothing, such as dresses, underwear, skirts, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.  This investment will allow her to stock her business and offer her more opportunities to sell and grow her business.

Her goal is to be better able to handle her home expenses by improving her business, especially in terms of the nourishment and health of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy clothing, such as dresses, underwear, skirts, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old, married and blessed with four children aged 22, 19, 17 and 12 years.  She owns a salon, a business that she has been in for six years where she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 which she will use to purchase chemical oil, shampoo and conditioners. 

The profit she makes will be ploughed back into her business. Her dream is to give her children the best education. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase chemical oil, shampoo and conditioners.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 52-year-old Kenyan entrepreneur from Vihiga, Western Kenya. He is married to Norah and they have six children.

Solomon operates a retail shop, a business that he has had for the past six years where he earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. He is taking out a school fee loan product from KADET LTD which he will use to pay for his child to attend high school.

His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya where she works as a teacher. She also carries on with farming which she says is her main source of income for needs such as her children's education. She has been farming for 11 years. Her farm produces mainly maize and beans which she sells locally.

Consolata has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says that this will provide her family with milk for daily consumption and income to help in educating her children. She also hopes to grow her farm so she can rank among the leading dairy farmers and help her to venture into the transport business as well.

Consolata says that market prices are poor within the local markets and animal diseases too remain a major challenge for farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old, a business lady from Vihiga town. She is married to Evans and they have four children.
