Florence sells maize cereals. She has been running this business for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 19,500. She is taking out her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more maize cereal to boost her current stock.

She will use the anticipated profits to provide her family’s basic needs. Her dream is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy maize cereal.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 23-year-old lady from Kisumu town. She is married to Zachariah and they have two children aged three and five years.

Susan operates a second-hand clothing business, a business which she has operated for the past five years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy ladies' skirts and trousers to sell. She will use her profits to expand her business.

Her dream is to have a big clothing business.

loans.use: To buy ladies' skirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen, aged 56, is the mother of four adult children. She has been farming for nearly 40 years with her farm currently supplying maize, milk and beans to the local market. She now employs one farmhand to help her manage her farm.

Kellen has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into poultry farming by buying poultry. She says that she wants to spread her farming risks and ensure that her production runs during dry seasons as well. She aspires to buy a car to transport her produce to the market.

Kellen is glad Juhudi Kilimo is helping farmers with a means to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Belin

texts.en:
Belin is a 25-year-old lady from Kisumu town. She is married to Samson and they have two school-going children.

Belin operates a beauty salon which she has been doing for the past six years earning a monthly income of KES 6,000. She has applied for her first loan which she will use to buy a steaming machine for the salon. She will use her profits to buy more beauty products.

Her dream is to open a training school.

loans.use: To buy a steaming machine for the salon

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 54 years old, married to Josephine and blessed with five children. He is a carpenter, a business he has been doing for the past five years. He wants to buy timber, nails and glue for his business and has requested a loan of KES 15,000. 

The anticipated profit will help him to educate his children and to improve his job status. His dream is to become a dairy farmer.

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails and glue for his business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 29-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children aged three and one, one of whom goes to school. 

Joseph runs a clothing sales business and has been in this business for three years. He has one employee. Joseph heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officer’s promotion in the market. He is taking out a loan of 4000 SDG to purchase women's dresses and other clothing. This business is Joseph's only source of income. 

In five years' time, Joseph hopes to increase his business size and to have two shops.

His major challenges include his low rate of income and the expensiveness of goods because the products are not bought from South Sudan.

Joseph says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s efforts in South Sudan which are able to lift him from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase women's dresses and other clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer in the Nkubu area. He is aged 61, has been in farming for 35 years and produces mangoes, maize, bananas, arrowroot, coffee and milk for the local market. He currently employs one farmhand. He is married with four adult children.

James has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank at 40,000 KES and water pipes at 20,000 KES. He plans to buy more acres of land to expand his banana and coffee plantations. He adds that the tank and pipes will help him have sufficient water throughtout the season.

His challenges are animal diseases and low market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Quinter

texts.en:
Quinter is a 22-year-old lady from Migori town. She is married to John and they have one child.

Quinter operates a college in Migori, a business she has been running for the past three years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a photocopier for the college. Her profits will be used to expand her college. Her dream is to own a university.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Jecinter

texts.en:
Jecinter is a 35-year-old lady from Kisumu town. She is married to Cleophas and they have five children aged 3-15 years. 

Jecinter is a tailor and has been doing this business for the past two years and makes a monthly income of Kes 10,000. She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy textile materials. Her profits will be used to expand her tailoring business.

Her dream is to open a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy textile materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, royco, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara lives in Kutaisi District, West Georgia. She is fifty-one years old, and is married. Her family consists of herself, her husband – Lustine and their twenty-one-year-old son, Tornike. Tornike works as a welder in the village. Lamara and Lustine run the family's agricultural business. They have a small poultry farm and sell hens in the village, as well as in the nearby town. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Lamara requested credit to expand the business. She plans to purchase additional cages, as well as food for the chickens. With new cages she will be able to keep more chickens on the farm and increase sales. It will positively reflected on the family's income and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cages for her poultry farm and food for her chickens.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander, aged 70, is a married man who supports two members of his family.  His spouse is Anna, a businesswoman, and they are blessed with three children aged 37, 35 and 31 years old. Alexander farms in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of 41 years earning a monthly income of KES 24,000.

He is servicing a sixth loan of KES 36,000 from KADET LTD after he successfully repaid the previous loans. He intends to use this amount to purchase tea seedlings, passionfruit seedlings and pesticides.  The profits will be used to repay the loan and will be ploughed back into the business.

He hopes to improve his tea plantation and own a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase tea seedlings, passionfruit seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is from the village of Godogani, West Georgia. She is fifty-four years old and lives with her family: her husband – Teimuraz and a thirty-one-year-old son. All the family members are involved in the family's agricultural business, which is their main source of income. The family owns a small dairy farm with three milk cows and a calf. Nargiza produces and sells on average 60 kg of traditional Georgian cheese. She sells it on the local open market. Also the family grows maize on the family-owned plot of land. Part of the corn they harvest is used for feeding the cows and the rest is sold on the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Nargiza requested credit to purchase a milk cow. She will get more milk and increase the production and sales of cheese. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to spend more on satisfying their daily needs and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian is a forty-seven-year-old man with five children. He runs a poultry business which he has operated for a period of four years. He started with capital he got from farming and bought chicks. His challenge is the high cost of operation due to feed and vaccine costs. He dreams of educating his children and increasing the number of chicks. 

Sebastian wants a loan to buy chicks to rear and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicks to rear and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo is 53 years old. He lives in the village Akhalterjola, West Georgia, with his wife Irma. Sergo is a musician. At the same time he is actively involved in his family agricultural business. Irma and Sergo have a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Irma produces cheese and sells it on the local market. Also the family owns a vineyard with 400 vine-trees. Sergo makes wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris.

Sergo requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With three cows Irma can increase production and sales of cheese by 50%. It will increase the monthly income of the family by 150 Laris. Irma and Sergo will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a fifty-nine-year-old farmer from the village of Kursebi, West Georgia. She lives in the village with her husband Nugzar. Their main source of income, along with Nugzar’s pension, is the family's agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm with four milk cows and two calves. Manana produces traditional Georgian cheese and sells it on the local market. Also, the family is busy with bee-keeping. They have ten beehives with bee-families. They sell the honey they gather on the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris per month. 

Manana requested credit to expand the bee-keeping business. She will purchase 8 – 10 beehives with bee-families and double the amount of honey they gather and sell. It will increase the income of the family. Manana plans to use the increased income to purchase household goods, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee-families.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with a child. She runs a retail business which she has operated for a period of a year. She started with capital from her husband. She dreams of educating her child and growing her business to greater heights. She has a problem of inadequate capital to expand her business. Juliet wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil lives in the village Kantauri. He is 63 years old, married, and lives with his wife Zhuzhuna and his mother (retired). 

Avtandil works in a village canteen as a cook and gets a monthly salary. Along with his main job, he is also involved in a family agricultural business. They own a 0.8 hectare plot of land, where fruits and vegetables are grown. He sells harvested fruits to local greengrocery retailers. Also the family runs a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Zhuzhuna produces cheese and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Avtandil requested credit for purchasing a milk cow and hay. With three cows, Zhuzhuna will increase production and sales of cheese and the monthly income of the family will grow by 150 Laris. It will allow the family members to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Maxwel

texts.en:
Maxwel is a 20-year-old entrepreneur from the Othoo area of Migori County, along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Lilian and they have one child.

Maxwel operates a motorcycle transport business (locally known as boda boda) and has been running this business for the past two years. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy motorcycle spare parts. He will use the profits to repay the loan.

His dream is to own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is forty-five and lives with her two daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker. She earns a living by washing laundry. She began this job four years ago.

She would like to expand her business by taking a loan to purchase one more washing machine for her business.

Thon hopes that the loan will bring her more earnings and improve her family living conditions and bring better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Tuoi

texts.en:
Tuoi is thirty-six years old and married with two children - a son and a daughter. Her husband works as a mason.

Tuoi supports her family by selling meals in the local community. She would like to take a loan to buy quality better ingredients and food which she can sell at higher margins. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions and have more savings to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy better food which she can sell at higher margins.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 50-year-old woman with 7 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop which she has operated for a period of 4 years. She dreams of having her children educated and of moving her business to higher heights. She has a problem of customers taking goods on credit and delaying payment. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa, forty-nine, is single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has worked as a babysitter for fifteen years. She takes care of the children of people in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy furnishings and toys. She hopes to provide a good environment for the children to stay in, so their parents can work without worrying. She also hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furnishings and toys for her childcare business.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is fifty-six.  

She has been earning a living by operating a coffee stall from the door of her house for the past ten years. She sells coffee and a variety of soft drinks. 

Be would like to borrow money to expand her current business by buying a greater quantity and variety of coffee and soft drinks to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy coffee and a variety of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is a thirty-eight-year-old woman with two daughters. Her husband earns a living working as a dealer in electronics. Huyen lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling coffees and soft drinks. 

For the past twelve years, she has run a food stall to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy many kind of beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy coffee and many kinds of beverages.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is forty-five years old and married with two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh city. 

Van established a stall to sell bread in the local community nine years ago. She plans to get a loan to invest capital in her business by purchasing more bread to sell.  

She hopes that the loan will help her to earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bread to sell.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a thirty-one-year-old single woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. Trang earns a living running a general store, which she has done for ten years. 

Trang would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock in her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is the mother of four children all of school-going age. She lives with her family in their home in Kitale where she has been farming for 15 years mainly producing maize and vegetables for the local market. She is aged 50. She earns additional income from a cereals processing plant and low cost rental houses in the local market.

Ruth has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will improve her farming income as she ventures into dairy farming which will also provide milk for the family's consumption.

She faces the challenges of poor infrastructure and high cost of inputs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en:
Ioseb is 50 years old. He lives in the village of Martkopi, East Georgia, with his wife, Irene, his 27-year-old son and his daughter-in-law. Ioseb works as a taxi driver in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. Irene takes care of a milk cow, owned by the family. She makes cheese and sells it in the village. Their son works in the local water company and gets a monthly salary. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Ioseb requested credit for purchasing calves. He will grow them for 5-6 months and sell the grown calves in the summer for a higher price. It will give additional income to the family, which Ioseb plans to use for purchasing needed household goods, which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Twekambe Kigezi Group

texts.en:
Edward is thirty-eight years old, married, with nine children and living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and has been in business for a long time. His dream is to educate his children and expand his business into a wholesale shop. He also wishes to diversify his income sources and venture into motorcycle transport. Seasonal weather and thieves hinder his business. 

Edward wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is a member of Twekambe Kigezi group where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motor cycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is forty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Hana has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 29,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Hana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Thi, 33, is married with one son and earns a living to support her family by sewing clothes. Her husband works as a mason. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thi started the business fifteen years ago. She would like to take a loan to expand the business. With the loan she intends to increase her working capital by buying good materials that will enable her to make better quality products for her customers. She hopes that this will generate more income and allow her to set aside savings to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes for customers.

loans.name: Yesim

texts.en:
Yesim's husband abandoned her and married another woman. She has since divorced him and is supporting her three children on her own and she is managing to succeed. Her youngest child is seven years old and the eldest is twenty-one. She believes that she can do any kind of job but as she has a disabled daughter, she can only work at home. 

The most suitable job for her is selling cosmetic products for Avon and Oriflame. She also makes handicrafts as a side income. She has been doing these jobs for four years. With the loan Yesim will receive from Maya through Kiva, she is going to buy a large supply of special-offer products. Since she will have more products, she can earn more money. 

Yesim can not make plans for the future but she wants to ensure her children have a better future. Yesim is a woman who resists bravely the tough conditions of her life.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Yeşim Özütok,boşanmış.Üç tane çocuğu var,en küçüğü 7,büyüğü 21 yaşında.Avon oriflame ve el işi ile uğraşıyor.Bu işi 4 yıldır yapıyor.Aslında her işi yapabileceğini fakat çocuğu engelli doğduğu için,sadece evde iş yapmakta sınırlı kaldığını söylüyor.Bunun yanında eşi de başka biri ile velenip ,kendisini terk etmiş.Üç çocuğu ile hauatı devam ettirmek zorundaydı ve ayakta kalmayı başardı.En kolay yapabileceği iş  avon ve oriflame işiydi.Bu kredi ile kampanyalı ürün almak istiyor.Ürünü çoğalınca daha çok para kazanacak.Gelecekle ilgili çok plan yapamıyor.Gelecekte çocukların iyi bir gelecek sağlamak istiyor.Zor hayatın içinde bir kadın,yılmadan direniyor.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of special-offer cosmetic products.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a married man aged thirty-seven, with two children, aged fourteen and four months. He is a farmer, thus contributing some monthly income for the family. Musa owns an electrical shop in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of eleven years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He is applying for a first term loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. He wishes to use this amount to purchase some electronic items for sale. The anticipated profit will be plowed back into the business and used to repay the loan.

His dream is to own a well stocked electronic shop and improve the living stands of his family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is aged fifty-three and married with five children, three of whom are still at school. He  works as a clergyman in the local church alongside his farming which caters for the family needs. He has been in farming for fifteen years, producing and selling maize and vegetables for the local market.

John has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his family living standards with milk being available to supplement daily meals and to provide income to meet other basic needs.

He laments of high production costs and animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian lives in a small village-type settlement near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. He is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife, Inga, his mother and his younger sister. Inga is a housewife. Mirian’s sister and mother work in the local leather factory as workers and get a monthly salary. 

Mirian is running the small dairy farm owned by the family. He has 2 milk cows. He produces traditional Georgian cheese and sells it locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Mirian requested credit for purchasing calves. He will grow them for 6-7 months and sell the grown calves in the fall for a higher price. The family will get additional income. He plans to reinvest the income in the dairy farm. He plans to purchase additional milk cows, in order to increase sales and the production of cheese. He hopes that in the future he will be able to make some savings for the renovation of the house, to improve the living conditions of the family members.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Gion

texts.en:
Gion is a 47-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband works in a local company. Gion earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 22 years. 

She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as rice, instant noodles, snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as rice, instant noodles, snack foods and confectionery to stock her general store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is 34 years old and married with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. For the last seven years he has been in a transport business. He started as a milk seller and later bought a motorcycle. His dream is to educate his children and expand his business despite the challenge of high fuel costs. Fred wants a loan to complete his house.

loans.use: to complete building his house.

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en: Carlosa is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Carlosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2005.  In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia wants a loan to pay for school fees and to buy soap and sugar to sell.  She is aged 32 and lives in Masindi-Uganda.  She is a single mother and charged with the responsibility of taking care of one child.  

As a retailer, Sylvia’s business is hindered by price fluctuations and inflation.  She desires to buy a car or motorcycle so as to diversify her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Elsa has a rice field that she harvests and she sells rice grains during harvest time.  She has had this business for ten years.  She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with five children.
 
Evangeline has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for ten years.  She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nyiro

texts.en: Nyiro is a 35-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 4 and 8. He is intelligent, social and a go-getter man. He operates a retail store where he provides the services of printing, typing and scanning to customers. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. He has one employee. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is the high cost of printing materials. He plans to use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more printing materials. Nyiro's business goal is to venture into a bookshop and a hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy printing materials.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 

Nelfa has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for five years.  She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Nelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 44-year-old married woman.  She has a daughter who is 23 years old.  She describes herself to be intelligent and determined with her business.  She operates a retail store where she sells cosmetics, handbags and clothes etc.  She has been involved in this business for five years.  Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are frequent and local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve her business.  

Margaret will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more items such as handbags, cosmetics and clothes to sell.  Margaret's business goal is to run her own fashion retail business within five years.  She hopes that in the future, her business will have improved.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, bags and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 69 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is widowed.
 
Emma has a coffee shop that sells and serves coffee, milk and chocolate drinks with bread and pastries.  She has had this business for eleven years.  She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients and breads for the cafeteria.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2006.  In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and breads for the cafeteria.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo, necesita un nuevo préstamo para la compra materiales para elaborar más pan para el negocio (harina, azucar, levadura), ya que estos préstamos él los considera que sirven para superar las dificultades que atraviesan los microempresarios, el préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar la motocicleta que utiliza para el negocio, hoy en día tiene una condición más estable y considera que la inversión que realizara le ayudara para mejorar el negocio.
texts.en: Ricardo needs a new loan to buy ingredients to bake more bread for his business (flour, sugar, yeast). He considers these loans to be a means for micro-entrepreneurs to overcome the difficulties they face. The last loan helped him to improve the motorcycle that he uses for the business. Today, things are more stable and he thinks that this loan will help him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: Maria Gabriela  es una de las emprendedoras que se le ha apoyado con el financiamiento para que invierta en el negocio en la compra de mercadería en general para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad.  Maria Gabriela nos expresa que gracias al apoyo que se le brindo ha podido salir adelante y brindarle a su hijo lo mejor. La emprendedora actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos ya que tiene varios pedidos, con el financiamiento comprara blusas, pantalones, camisas, calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior y sabanas entre otros productos.
texts.en: Maria Gabriela is one of the entrepreneurs who has previously been helped with a loan to invest in her business by purchasing general merchandise so that she can offer her customers greater variety. Maria Gabriela tells us that, thanks to the loan that she was offered, she has been able to move ahead and give her son the best. This entrepreneur is currently requesting a loan to buy more products as she has a number of orders. She will use the loan to buy blouses, pants, shirts, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and sheets, among other products.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, sheets and other products.

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
Edson, es empleado y trabaja todo el día  en una  imprenta en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para  comprar una maquina MAC-64 de impresión grafica para realizar trabajos extras y obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Edson, es soltero,  no tiene hijos  y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
Su historial de créditos muestra que Edson, paga dentro de los límites en su plan de pagos.
texts.en:
Edson is employed, and he works all day at a print shop in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy a MAC-64 graphic impression machine in order to do extra jobs and get better income so he can help his family.

Edson is single and does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the second time he has worked with KIVA.

His loan history shows that Edson makes his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a MAC-64 graphic impression machine in order to do extra jobs

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán, trabaja todo el día como empleado en una imprenta  de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material (papel y tinta) para sus trabajos extras y de esta forma obtener más ingresos.
Hernán, es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez que trabaja junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Hernán works all day as an employee at a print shop in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy materials (paper and ink) to do extra jobs in order to get more income.

Hernán is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials (paper and ink) to do extra printing jobs.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo trabaja como empleado en una entidad pública en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para cancelar la matricula de la universidad y culminar sus estudios para ayudar a su familia.
El es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona central ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcelo is employed by a public entity in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to pay for university tuition and to finish his studies in order to help his family.

Marcelo is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the central area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition in order to finish his studies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 69 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed with 9 children. 

David has a barber shop that provides hair cutting & styling. He has had this business for 21 years. He requested a loan for 10,000 to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

David has been a member of HSPFI for since 1999. In the future, David hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the barber shop

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Jemelyn has a pigpen that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Jemelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jemelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Benbinedo

texts.en:
Benbinedo is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 9 children. 

Benbinedo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Benbinedo has been a member of HSPFI for since 2008. In the future, Benbinedo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a 44 year old widowed woman. She has a daughter who is 21 years old. 

She is an intelligent and hardworking woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells herbal medicine. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of herbal medicine. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more herbal medicine to sell. 

Kuvuna's business goal is to venture into a green grocers retail store alongside her herbal medicine business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 72 years old and married with 12 children living in Masindi, Uganda.

For the last 6 years he has been in the transport sector. He started with farming and later saved money to buy a lorry. His dream is to buy other cars and diversify the business. Bad roads and high fuel costs hinder his business.

Julius wants a loan to pay medical bills.

loans.use: to pay his medical bills.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday owns a general merchandise shop in Hioma, Uganda. She started it using her savings which she made when she used to work as a bank teller. 

She faces problems with price fluctuations and hopes to expand her business to new markets. 

Friday is a single mother of 4 and hopes to educate her children and give them a bright future. She intends to use the loan to buy sugar and juices to sell.

loans.use: to buy juices and sugar to sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is married with 7 children living in Hioma, Uganda.

He started as a subsistence farmer but now he is farming at a commercial level. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes to buy more land for growing crops.

Andrew intends to use the loan to buy maize and ground nuts for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts for planting.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 31 year old married woman. She has a son who is 11 year old. She describes herself as a focused woman. 

She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located in an urban area and her customers are both frequent and walk-ins. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase bales of wheat and maize flour, sugar and rice. 

Pamela's business goal is to own a big hotel in her town area within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour and maize flour, sugar and rice for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Chrisestom

texts.en: Chrisestom, a 42-year-old father of four children, has been operating a  poultry business for the past six years. Starting with only 20 chicks, he now has over 300 birds and is requesting a loan to purchase more. Chrisestom dreams of having his children educated and diversifying his business to include a piggery.

loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Sirasi

texts.en: Sirasi is twenty-two years old and has business buying and selling popcorn. He has been doing this for over three years. He faces a challenge of high fuel and transport costs. He does not allow his challenges to put him down and he intends to expand his business to new markets. His family goal is to educate his children. Sirasi intends to use the money to buy maize to make popcorn.

loans.use: to buy maize to make popcorn.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is twenty-three years old with two children and she is a farmer. She grows a variety of crops and she has been farming ever since since she was fifteen years old. She faces a challenge of seasonal variations which affects her farm yields. Her personal goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house however she also hopes to expand her business to new markets in order to achieve her dreams. Florence needs the loan to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Tainage

texts.en: Tianage, a 58-year-old married man, lives with his wife in Hioma, Uganda where he has been farming for 20 years. Despite facing the hardships of price fluctuations and seasonal variations, Tianage hopes to expand his business to new markets and also diversify into animal rearing. Now requesting a loan to pay for labor and buy farm inputs, his family goal is to educate those of his children who are still of school-going age.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 54 years old, married, and has seven children living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been a teacher for seven and a half years.

After realizing that his meager salary could not help him support his family he decided to venture into produce selling. His goal for his family is to educate his children and his dream for his business is to have a food store in town. He intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more home products for resale

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is single and runs a poultry farm. She began the business through a partnership owing to her limited capital but has now begun her own business.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and has joined the organization in order to receive credit so she can expand her business. Rukia is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to purchase more feeding troughs and stock. She aspires to be a wholesale supplier of ducks and chicken in the future despite the challenge of the high cost of materials.

loans.use: To purchase more feeding troughs and stock.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has six children and has been a food vendor for ten years. This has helped her to fend for her family. Mwanakombo was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase sacks of beans, flour and oil for the business.

She looks forward to setting up a restaurant in the future. Her only challenge is the high cost of products. The extra income from this loan will help Mwanakombo meet the emergency needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, flour and oil for the business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia lives in the Coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. She is widowed and has one child. She sells detergents to the residents of Mombasa. After being introduced to Milango by her friends, Teresia is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to purchase more soap making materials e.g. ungerol, salt, caustic soda etc.

Teresia aspires to be a wholesale trader of detergents and also to diversify to other types of businesses in the future. The additional income will be saved to meet emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more soap making materials such as ungerol, salt and caustic soda.

loans.name: Wafa'a

texts.en:
Wafa'a is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of six children. 

Wafa'a is selling clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more, with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en: Mutunga, a resident of Mombasa, Kenya, is single and has two children. The operator of a cyber cafe for six years, he started off with one machine, doing typesetting, etc. and now has a number of computers. Facing the challenge of requiring more capital which is difficult to raise, Mutunga is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more machines for his enterprise. He will save the additional income arising from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more computers for his cyber cafe.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Amal is a private teacher. She teaches English from her home and is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to finalize the building of an additional room at her house for teaching purposes with an aspiration of establishing a teaching club for English.

Amal  is going to expand her business into teaching employees through contracting with their corporations in addition to providing translation services.

loans.use: to finalize the building of an additional room at her house to teach English in.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 34-year-old married man from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a father of one child.

Ali is a tailor and he is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase materials ( fabrics, thread, etc) and he is looking to expand his project so that he can employ more people and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase materials ( fabrics, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan.

Maryam is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase a new sewing machine with the aspiration of customizing a room at her home for her business.

loans.name: Alejandrina Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.,

En este lugar vive la señora Alejandrina, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no ha tenido hijos. El marido trabaja realizando trabajos con estructuras metálicas.
 
Ella trabaja de secretaria en una empresa de la localidad pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa del todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, aprovecha los fines de semana para realizar sus recorridos,  deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad y le está yendo muy bien ya que cada vez tiene más clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener una linda familia.
texts.en:
The La Mocora community bank meets twice a month in La Mocora, a neighborhood in the Ecuadorean city of Portoviejo.  The people of Portoviejo work hard, many at farming and livestock-rearing.

Alejandrina, 30, is a member of the group.  She and her husband, a metalworker, have no children.  
 
Alejandrina works as a secretary for a local company, but she has a business of her own, as well.  She sells all kinds of clothing, going from door to door, making the most of her weekends to grow the business.  She buys the merchandise she sells in Guayaquil once or twice a month.  She sells on credit and collects from her customers at weekends.  She has operated the business for a year and says that she is happy with her progress because she is steadily adding new customers.

Alejandrina will use this loan to stock her business with the clothing she sells: shorts, bathing suits, shirts, etc.  This is her third loan from the group and she says that she is grateful for the help.

Her goals for the future are to grow the business and start a family.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 12  años, ambos estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, para lo cual en su casa tiene una pequeña granja. Los pollos y chanchos cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animalitos y también vende por su localidad. Para ayudarse también vende deliciosos helados que ella misma prepara y que son muy apetecidos por sus vecinos. Lleva más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bien ya que se gana algo sin salir de su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para sus animalitos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su vida.
 
Su sueño es tener muy buena salud.
texts.en:
La Moroca, which is in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, is known for its hard-working people and its farming and livestock.  The members of the La Mocora communal bank meet every two weeks.

This is where we meet María.  She is 45 years old, married, and has two children, ages 16 and 12.  The children both go to school.  Her husband is a professional driver.  She is a very good housewife who raises chickens and pigs.  To do so she has a small farm at home.

When the chickens and pigs are ready, she gives them to the merchants who come to her house to buy her little animals.  She also sells in her area.  To help out she also sells delicious ice cream that she prepares herself.   Her neighbors really crave her ice cream.  She has had this business for over six years, and it is going well for her because she earns something without leaving her house.

This loan is to buy feed and medicine for her little animals.  She is the founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because the loans are a great help to her.

 Her dream is to have very good health.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her animals.

loans.name: Martha Melissa

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de  1 y 4 años. Ella en su condición de estudiante de psicología, hace 4 años decidió emprender su aventura de negocios como comerciante, de manera simultánea a su actividad como estudiante, a través de la promoción de productos, mediante guías especializadas, para con ello contribuir a los gastos familiares, hasta entonces solo a cargo de su cónyuge.   La actividad que desempeña le permite la transversalidad de las tareas como madre y esposa, estudiante y oficios domésticos. Su meta es lograr terminar sus estudios de psicología y sobre todo fortalecer su negocio como empresaria de un almacén especializado en ropa  estilo boutique. Martha siempre está pendiente de la oportunidad de crecimiento de su negocio y de ofrecer a sus clientes la mejor opción especialmente en precios, por eso su clientela crece cada vez más y su efectivo resulta insuficiente, para dar una respuesta oportuna; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa y calzado para complacer a su clientela fija, especialmente en la época de carnaval que se acerca, en la que ellos desean vestir ajustados a esta fiesta, lo cual hace que su inversión logre el éxito esperado.
texts.en: Martha is a 28-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 1 and 4 years old. As a psychology student four years ago, she decided to take up a business venture as a merchant simultaneously with her studies. She did this through the promotion of her products, using specialized guides, in order to contribute to the household expenses, which up until that point where being supported only be her husband. Her business allows her to undertake various tasks as mother, wife and student as well as domestic chores. Her goal is to achieve the completion of her psychology studies and above all to strengthen her business as a store specializing in clothes, boutique style. Martha is always looking out for the opportunity to grow her business and offer her customers the best option, especially pricewise. Because of this, her customer base grows more and more and her cash turns out to be insufficient to provide a timely response; this is why she has turned to a Kivacredit, her first loan, which she is doing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothes and shoes to please her fixed customer base, especially in the carnival season that is approaching, in which they wish to dress in accordance with the festival, which will make her investment achieve the expected success.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: A Socorro le fue muy bien comprando todo lo necesario en materias primas e insumos, con lo cual dio curso a su creatividad y generó clientes muy complacidos. Desde que obtuvo su credikiva su negocio ha marchado muy bien y agradece mucho este financiamiento. Su meta más adelante es poder comprar un apartamento, para dejar de pagar arriendo y tener un taller mejor dotado. Con sus consecutivas inversiones en el negocio, ha generado mayor capacidad de contratación, porque su capital se ha incrementado. Su meta en este momento es continuar consolidando su negocio y especialmente en su puesto de ventas, el que planea poco a poco tenga más auge con un buen surtido, esta es la justificación de su nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para fabricar nuevos diseños, que ofrecerá al mercado. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es “Mi gratitud por apoyar este sector de la economía como es la microempresa que pocas oportunidades tiene. “
texts.en: It went very well for Socorro buying all the necessary primary materials and inputs with which she gave free reign to her creativity and generated very pleased customers. Since she obtained her Kivacredit, her business has been going very well and she is very grateful for this funding. Her goal in the future is to be able to buy an apartment so as to stop paying rent and to have a better equipped workshop. With her consecutive investments in her business, she has generated more contracting capacity, because her capital has grown. Her goal in this moment is to continue growing her business, especially her sales point, which she plans to grow little by little with good stock. This is the justification for her new Kivacredit, with which she will buy raw materials and inputs to make new designs that she will offer at the market. Her message to the lenders of Kiva is: “My gratitude for supporting this sector of the economy, since it is the microenterprise that has few opportunities.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials and inputs to make new designs.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 31-year-old married man and has two children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

He has been operating an oil mill for 20 years. He has employed two persons in his business which  is the main source of his income.

Ameen started his business by purchasing simple raw materials like mustard and sesame seed  and a camel to power the mill which is close to his house. Because his business is located in "Old Sana'a" where the historical area is and there are lots of people, a lot of clients come to him in order to buy so many kinds of oils such as corn oil and grain mustard and sesame seed oils. He is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. 

Being an ambitious man, Ameen would like to expand his business so he can provide his clients' needs and get more profit. So, he took out a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy raw materials like corn, grain mustard, and sesame seeds for producing oil.

In the future, he would like to improve his business so it appears more attractive among Old Sana'a places of interest.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for producing oil such as corn and grain mustard and sesame seeds.

Mary is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Francita

texts.en:
Francita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child.
 
Francita has a shop that sells food seasonings, spices and vegetables like string beans. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

Francita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Francita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 23 years old. He is married to one wife and has one child. The two depend on Pius for their daily living. 

He has been in business for two years and makes a monthly profit of approximately KES 5,000. This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use to use the loan to repair and service his motorbike. Pius intends to plough back the profit he will get and also educate his child.

His hopes are to have a successful business and live harmoniously with his neighbors.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Angelita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Angelita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Arcelie has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Arcelie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arcelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Merie An

texts.en:
Merie An is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Merie An has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Merie An is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merie An hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

James has a pigpen to sell grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

James is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,James hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf is a 48-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Etaf is looking to improve her family living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her home with an aspiration of providing better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Lolita is providing motorela or motorcycle-transport services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services. Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 2 children. 
Manuela has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Manuela is a new member of HSPFI .  In the future, Manuela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married . 
Claudia has a shop that sells & serves coffee with breads & pastries. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy breads & beverages for the cafeteria.
Claudia has been a member of HSPFI since 1998.  In the future, Claudia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads & beverages for the cafeteria

loans.name: Edvin

texts.es: Edvin, tiene la edad  de 19 años está soltero, y vive con sus padres y que son mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos como abonos y plaguicidas para la asistencia de su chile. El cuenta con un terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo por lo cual es que realizara esta siembra, además tiene varios años de trabajar en estos cultivo por lo cual conoce del buen manejo de la siembra. El tienen como meta tener una muy buena plantación y así cosechar bastante para vender su producto al mercado de la localidad. El con las ventas y el dinero generando quiere salir con el crédito y  ayudarle a su padre con las responsabilidades del hogar para así tener una mejor estabilidad económica familiar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Edvin is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents, who are his top priority.  With this loan, he will buy supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides to care for his chile.  He has a plot of land that is perfect for growing this crop, which is why he will be planting it.  He has also been working with this crop for several years, so he knows how to manage the planting well.  His goal is to have a very good planting so he will harvest enough to sell his produce in the local market.  With his sales and the money he earns, he wants to take advantage of the loan to help his father with their home responsibilities, so they can have better financial stability as a family.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hadn't taken out loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered him this loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant chile

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, en esta ocasión comprara maíz para revender, pues considera que le quedara ganancia de esta actividad.
El préstamo anterior ayudo a María a la compra otros productos comestibles para el negocio, hoy espera que este nuevo financiamiento igual le ayude a mejorar.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan to strengthen her business.  This time she will buy corn to resell because she thinks it will earn her money.

María's previous loan helped her buy other food products for her business.  She now hopes that this new loan will help her improve in the same way.

loans.use: to buy corn to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Teresita has a shop that sells bags, accessories & jewelry. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stock like bags, accessories & jewelries to sell.
Teresita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock like bags, accessories & jewelry to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Nilda has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Nilda is a new member of HSPFI .  In the future, Nilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Genara has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Genara is a new member of HSPFI .  In the future, Genara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María forma parte del Banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de La Pintana, ciudad de Santiago.
Se dedica a la reparación y confección de ropa de casa y de vestir, además de la venta de productos preparados en su casa, como jaleas y helados. Trabaja en estos dos negocios desde hace 3 años, su horario de atención es de 9ºº de la mañana hasta las 21ºº horas de la noche.
Sus materiales para el negocio de la confección, los compra en la comuna de Independencia, donde existen locales comerciales con precios muy baratos, para comerciantes. Respecto al negocio de alimentos los compra en supermercados mayoristas.
Con el crédito comprará una congeladora y materiales para abastecer su negocio de confección, entre telas e hilos.
Ana María vive junto a su marido y su hija de 10 años de edad. Uno de sus sueños es instalarse con un local establecido de comida rápida. Por lo que sus motivaciones son seguir trabajando en sus negocios, para generar mayores ganancias, de ésta manera concretar sus proyectos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio, lo cual ha sido un gran aporte la institución. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás integrantes dl Banco comunal, ya que son unidas, responsables y realizan diferentes actividades juntas.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, comenta que le han servido para organizar sus ingresos.
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes.
texts.en:
Ana María is part of Luchando por el Progreso Communal Bank in the community of La Pintana in the city of Santiago.  She works mending and making casual and dress clothing.  She also sells prepared products in her house, such as jelly and ice cream.

She has worked in these two businesses for three years.  Her hours of service are from 9:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening.  She buys her materials for the sewing business in the community of Independencia where commercial businesses have very cheap prices for storekeepers.  Regarding the food business, she buys her materials in wholesale supermarkets.

With the loan she will buy a freezer and materials to supply her dressmaking business, from fabric to thread.

Ana María lives with her husband and her 10-year-old daughter.  One of her dreams is to set herself up in an established fast food place.  This is why her motives are to continue working in her businesses to generate greater profits and in this way realize her projects.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza because it has allowed her to invest in her business, so the institution has been a big contribution.  Also, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other members of the communal bank because they are close and responsible, and they do different activities together.  Regarding the training, she comments that they have been useful for organizing her income.

La Pintana is a community located to the south of Santiago (capital of Chile) in the Metropolitan Region.  It is known for being a community with a high poverty rate, where more than ten percent of the residents live in poverty.  Because of this, the local authority (the municipality) has looked after developing various social programs focused on improving the quality of life of its residents.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and materials to stock her dressmaking business, from fabric to thread.

loans.name: Gresanta

texts.en:
Gresanta is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Gresanta has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Gresanta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gresanta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Vannessa

texts.es: Vanessa,  tiene la edad  de 22 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su esposo y su hijo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende asistir y comprar los insumos como el concentrado para engordarlos. Ella cuenta con un chiquero establecido y con sus cerdos ya en etapa de crecimiento por lo cual necesita alimentarlos para que estén gordos para una muy buena temporada de venta. Ella quiere tener sus animales en buen peso para cuando los valla a vender sacarle el máximo de las ganancias para así ayudar a su esposo con las responsabilidades del hogar y así mantener una muy buena economía familiar.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Vanessa is 22 years old and has a domestic partnership.  She lives with her partner and her son, who is her top priority.  With her loan, she plans to tend to her pigs and buy supplies, such as concentrate food, to fatten them.  She already has a pen set up and her pigs are in their growth stage, so she needs to feed them so they will be fat and she will have a good selling season.  She wants to get her animals to a good weight so that when she goes to sell them she will make as much as possible to help her husband with the household responsibilities and keep their family's finances in good shape.  This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She hadn't taken out loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered her this loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to tend to her pigs and fatten them

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Marisel Bereniza

texts.es:
Marisel es una joven madre soltera, ella tiene un pequeño de 8 años y está muy contenta en compañía de su pequeño, para poder compartir tiempo con él, disfrutan viendo películas juntos, actividad que les agrada a ambos. Ellos viven en la ciudad de Ica, lugar aclamado como la “Tierra del Sol”, este hermoso lugar rodeado de Dunas, donde se pueden realizar diversos deportes de aventura, es aquí en este lugar que se ha desarrollado económicamente en los últimos años, donde Marisel y su hijo viven y tienen su propio negocio.

Como se puede observar en la fotografía, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y también de ropa, algunos aretes, collares y prendas de vestir, en este su negocio ella atiende aproximadamente a 10 clientes en un día, es decir solo 10 personas efectúan compras, lo que le permite efectuar los pagos de los productos que vende y también generar las ganancias que necesita. Marisel está muy agradecida con su madre, ya que ella fue la que la incentivo a que pusiera este negocio y  también la apoyó en los momentos en los que ella más la necesitaba.
Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá comprar mercadería por campaña escolar, (Blusas, Polos, Medias, Cuadernos, Entre Otros). Con este apoyo ella podrá incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer nuevos productos, los mismos que serán necesarios para sus clientes.

Su sueño es continuar progresando y sabe que lo logrará a base de esfuerzo y dedicación extrema, con este dinero que logre ganar, ella desea poder juntar sus ahorros con el fin de por fin tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marisel is a young, single mother with a little eight year old boy.  Spending time with him makes her very happy.  They watch movies together, an activity that they both enjoy.  They live in Ica, a city acclaimed as the “Tierra del Sol” (Land of the Sun).  It is a beautiful place, surrounded by sand dunes, where people can participate in various adventure sports.  This area has developed economically in recent years, and here is where Marisel and her son live and where she has her own business.

As you can see in the photograph, she sells cosmetics, earrings, necklaces, clothing and other items of attire.  In her business, she serves approximately ten customers per day, that is to say, ten people make purchases.  This allows her to pay for her products and generate the profits she needs.  Marisel is very grateful to her mother since she was the one who gave her the incentive to start her business and supported her in the times when she needed her the most.  

With the help of the Kiva loans, she will be able to buy merchandise for the “Back to School Campaign” (blouses, polo shirts, socks, and other items).  This will enable her to increase sales and offer new products that her customers need.  Her dream is to continue making progress.  She knows that, with hard work and extreme dedication, she will succeed.  With the money that she earns, she wishes to pool together her savings in order to finally have her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (blouses, polo shirts, socks, notebooks, and other items).

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, con el cual comprara un cerdo y concentrado para alimentarlo, con este préstamo estará manteniéndose en el negocio.
La inversión anterior de María tambien fue en cerdos, ya que ella vive de su granja, hasta el momento ha tenido buenas ganancias de las ventas de los cerdos que obtuvo en este periodo.
texts.en:
María decided on a new loan, with which she will buy a pig and concentrated feed to feed it.  With this loan she will be supporting herself with her business.

María's previous investment was also in pigs because she lives from her farm.  Up to now she has had good profits from selling the pigs she got in this period.

loans.use: to buy a pig and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de quintales de harinilla para darle de comer a los animales de la granja (gallinas, ganado y cerdos), con esto tendrá el suficiente alimento para unos meses.
Él considera que estos préstamos le ayudan para mejorar el negocio, mantenerse en actividad y ha generar dinero para las necesidades de su familia, Partor lleva ya tres prestamos en la institucion y dos con Kiva, pero cancelo con unos dias de atraso por eso no se ha podido republicar este prestamo.
texts.en:
Pastor is asking for a new loan to buy quintals of blue corn flour to feed to his farm animals (chickens, cattle, and pigs).  This will give him enough food for a few months.

He believes that the loans help him improve his business, stay in business, and make money for his family's needs.  Pastor has already taken out three loans with his institution and two with Kiva, but he made a payment a few days late, so he wasn't able to re-post this loan.

loans.use: to buy quintals of blue corn flour

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque está iniciando el proceso de la siembra, para esto necesita alquilar tres manzanas de terreno y la reparación de cercos, con esta inversión espera realizar la siembra de la mejor manera, con abundante producción de maíz y frijol.
El considera que por medio de estos préstamos ha mejorado su trabajo agrícola.
texts.en: José is requesting a new loan because he is beginning the sowing process.  He needs to rent three “manzanas” (a unit of area: 1 Manzana (mz.) = 1.68 acres) of land and repair fences.  With this investment, he hopes to make the best of the sowing time and produce an abundant amount of corn and beans.  He feels that he has improved his farming practices through these loans.

loans.use: to rent three "manzanas" of land and repair fences.

loans.name: Anally

texts.en:
Anally is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Anally has a food shop that sells "banana-cue" (fried bananas on a stick). She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy ripe bananas needed  for making snacks to sell.

Anally is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ripe bananas needed  for making snacks to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo,  tiene la edad  de 30 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como el concentrado  para la asistencia. El cuenta con los cerdos en etapa de crecimiento y es cuando hay que darle la mayor alimentación para tenerlos en un tiempo rápido para la venta. El quiere obtener de sus cerdo la mayor producción de carne y a la hora de venderlos generar el máximo de ganancias para tener una estabilidad económica mejor para él y sus padres. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Domingo, 30, is single and lives with his parents, who are his highest priority.

With the loan he plans to buy agricultural inputs, such as concentrated feed, for assistance.  He has pigs in the growth stage, and this is when you have to give them the best nourishment to have them ready for sale quickly.  He wants to get the greatest meat production from his pigs and, when he sells them, generate the maximum profit to have better financial stability for himself and his parents.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously, he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help his fattening pigs.
