Cuando cae la noche, sale a la vereda y habilita un espacio para colocar todos los ingredientes, insumos y sus demás materiales para iniciar con su negocio de venta de pollo broaster y salchipapas, van muchas personas aconsumir los alimentos que prepara y por ello aprovecha para vender bebidas gaseosas o refrescos preparados por ella misma. En el tiempo que lleva realizando´éste trabajo aprendió que siempre tiene que tener una sonrrisa en los labios y darle buen trato a sus clientes para que puedan ir contentos y volver mas adelante. Le esta yendo muy bien lo que hace ya que tiene muchos clientes que le generan buenas ventas y ganancias diarias. Espera seguir trabajando, pues tuvo cerca de 1 mes paralizado su negocio por motivos de salud, pero ahora esta mucho mejor y con ganas de salir  seguir con su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para reiniciar con su negocio, además de algunos materiales que le hacen falta para poder empezar a trabajar con fuerza.
texts.en: Leni, 44 years old, is a very hardworking and friendly woman. She is married to Netali, 55 years old, who’s her inseparable spouse of 20 years. She has 4 children, 2 are grown and only 14 year old Divana and 15 year old Diego live with her in their home where every day she gives them the best so that they can be good people later on. When night falls, she goes out to the sidewalk and sets up a space in order to put out all the ingredients, supplies, and her other materials to begin doing business selling broasted chicken and fried potatoes with sausages. Lots of people eat the foods she makes, and she took the opportunity to sell sodas and prepared refreshment herself. In the time that she’s been doing this work she learned that she always has to have a smile on her face and give good service to her clients so that they will be satisfied and return in the future. She’s been doing very well since she has many clients who generate good sales and daily income. She hopes to continue working, since for one month she had to miss work for health reason, but now she is much better and with a desire to succeed she continues with her business. This will be her first loan with MFP. For that reason she hopes that with their partnership she can continue towards her goals. With the requested amount of 800 soles, she will buy ingredients and supplies to restart her business as well as some materials that she needs in start off on the right foot.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and perishable products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Christine has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Christine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Christine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan is a 41-year-old married woman who works on a few plots of farmland to generate income. Her common crops are rice and potatoes. However, presently she plants her potatoes on rented land. She has been in this business for many years in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Her husband shares his responsibility for the family by working as a construction worker around the province. This couple has been blessed with 4 single children, two of whom are unemployed and still students in local schools.
With her first loan requested from HKL and Kiva, Mrs. Chan will pay for the land that she’s rented to grow her potatoes. In the future, she wishes to own additional farmland to increase her output thereby bettering her living condition.

loans.use: to pay for the land that she’s rented to grow her potatoes.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is married with 2 children. She is 33-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Marites is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community member to earn a living. She's been doing this for 2 years and every month she earns 5,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2011, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Marites hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La señora Susana se dedica a la venta de comida,  su estado civil soltera, tiene un hijo menor de edad. La señora es nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz vive actualmente en el Barrio 18 de Noviembre. Su negocio esta ubicado  en su mismo domicilio. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida (Locro y Pollo a la Broaster) hace 1 año, trabaja de lunes a domingo de horas 18:00 a 23.00. La señora demuestra ser responsable y muy trabajadora. El crédito otorgado a la señora lo invertirá  para capital de inversión (compra de mesas y sillas), La señora esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes ya que tiene mucha clientela por la buena sazón de sus comidas, ella se siente muy contenta por las ventas que tiene ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Susana sells food.  Her marital status is single.  She has a young son.  She was born in the city of Santa Cruz, and she currently lives in the "18th of November" Neighborhood.  Her business is located in her own home.  She has been selling food ('locro" [a dense, rice-based soup of chicken and vegetables] and broasted chicken) for a year.  She works Monday through Sunday from 6:00 pm to 11:00 pm.  She proves to be responsible and very hardworking.  She will use the awarded credit to invest in resources (to buy tables and chairs).  She is very thankful to the lenders for trusting in her and for being able to give her the opportunity to make her business grow.  In this way she will offer greater comfort to her customers since she has a large clientele due to the good flavor of her foods.  She feels very happy about the sales that she has since this is the only activity that allows her to care for her family.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is a married woman who has 2 children. She is 35 years old, and resides at Jimenez, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Cristina owns and operates a gardening business venture for a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This year, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Cristina wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is married with 2 children. She is 23-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Janeth is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for 2 years and every month she earns 10,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2011, Janeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Janeth hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos para lo que cuentan con pequeña casita ubicada en el caserío “Santa Isabel” a unos 20 minutos del distrito de Morrope el cual pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y departamento de Lambayeque 
La comunidad en la que vive es pequeña y se encuentra en vía de desarrollo por lo ya cuentan con los servicios básicos necesarios.

José Manuel se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la unión entre sus hijos y su esposa ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

José Manuel al tener ya sus objetivos claros y establecidos desea comprar materiales de construcción para construir corrales mas grandes y su mejor acondicionamiento y así mantener a sus animales en buen estado, para lo que esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito por el monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles para poder hacer realidad su deseo

José Manuel su esposa y sus hijos son personas trabajadoras, amables y muy respetadas por sus vecinos de la zona en la que viven, derechos que se lo han ganado en base a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo.
texts.en:
José Manuel is a 42 year old father. He lives with his wife and their 4 children in their small house in the Santa Isabel neighborhood some 20 minutes from the Morrope district, in the Chiclayo province and the Lambayeque department. 

The community in which he lives is small and in the process of developing, and they already have the basic necessary services. 

José Manuel works every day breeding and later selling pen animals like ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, etc. He was able to install special places in his home for the animals. His children and wife’s work took on new family goals and for that reason they work every day to achieve them and improve their quality of life. 

José Manuel, already having clear and established objectives, wants to buy construction materials to build larger pens, improve conditions, and maintain his animals in good health. To do that, he’s asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan in the amount of 100 nuevos soles so that he can realize his dream. 

José Manuel, his wife and their children are hardworking, friendly, and very respected by their neighbors in the area where they live, which they have earned from their hard work, effort, and dedication.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build larger pens and better accommodations.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es un joven de 30 años de edad se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, vive con su esposa y su menor hijo. Wilmer ha logrado construir su propia casa, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío rural de nombre “San Pedrillo” Lote 12, pues queda  unos 20 minutos del distrito de  Tambogrande, por ser una zona rural que se encuentra en vía de desarrollo por el momento solo cuentan con el servicio de luz. Tambogrande es un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Wilmer tiene como actividad económica la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado menor (ovinos y pavos), los cuales los adquiere recién nacidos, él y su esposa se encargan de su cuidado y alimentación hasta que obtengan un tamaño y peso ideal para su comercialización en el mercado local del caserío donde vive, ha mencionada actividad se dedica ya un aproximado de 1 año, adicionalmente a eso y con mas tiempo dedicándose a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con 0.75 has de terreno propio en donde ha sembrado Limón y Maracayá, actividad que le genera ingresos adicionales para el sustento de su familia.

Wilmer es una persona que siempre tiene deseos de salir adelante junto a su familia y es por eso que desea hacer más grande su negocio por lo que necesita capital para la compra de alimentos balanceados que le permitan crecer y engordar a sus animales en un tiempo mucho mas corto.

Wilmer siempre ha sido un hombre muy trabajador desde muy pequeño y mucho mas ahora que tiene familia, y es por eso que se ganado el respeto, admiración y cariño de todos sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a young man of 30 who is known for being responsible. He lives with his wife and young child. Wilmer has built his own home in the rural village of San Pedrillo Lote 12, which is 20 minutes from the district of Tambogrande. Because it's a rural zone it is still developing and they only have electricity. Tambogrande is a district in the province of Piura, which is located about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Wilmer's work is raising and selling small animals (sheep and turkeys). He buys them shortly after birth, and he and his wife take care of them and feed them until they are an ideal size and weight to be sold in the local village market. He has been doing this work for about a year, and he has been farming for longer than that. He has 0.75 acres of his own land where he has planted limes and passion fruit. This generates additional income for sustaining his family. 

Wilmer always wants to move forward together with his family, and for that reason he wants to make his business bigger. He needs capital to buy balanced feed so that he can grow and fatten his animals in a shorter amount of time. 

Wilmer has always been hardworking since he was very young, and much more so now that he has a family. He has earned the respect, admiration and affection of all of his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Miriam  Aurora

texts.es:
Miriam Aurora es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos para lo que cuentan con una casita ubicada en el caserío “CP-14”   a unos 20 minutos del distrito de las Lomas  el cual pertenece a la provincia de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo y departamento de Lambayeque, la comunidad en la que vive es pequeña y se encuentra en vía de desarrollo por lo que solo cuentan con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Miriam Aurora se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales  como ganado, ovinos y aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, en la actualidad cuenta con 8 cabezas de ganado y unas 12 aves entre pavos y gallinas, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la unión entre sus hijos y su esposa ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

Miriam Aurora al tener ya sus objetivos claros y establecidos desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y a la vez materiales para construir corrales mas grandes y su mejor acondicionamiento para poder comprar mas animales que puedan aumentar sus ventas y así satisfacer los solicitudes de sus clientes. Maria ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles para atender a sus necesidades.


Miriam Aurora  y sus hijos son personas trabajadoras, amables y muy respetadas por sus vecinos de la zona en la que viven, derechos que se lo han ganado en base a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo.
texts.en:
Miriam Aurora is a 29 year old mother. She lives with her 2 children in a small home in the CP-14 neighborhood, some 20 minutes from the Lomas district in the Piura district which is 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo and the Lambayeque department. The community in which she lives is small and developing, so they only have electricity. 

Miriam Aurora works every day breeding and later selling animals like cattle, sheep, guinea pigs, and poultry such as ducks and turkeys. Right now she has 8 head of cattle and 12 birds between hens and rooster. She had installed strategic places in to her home to raise the animals. The partnership between her children and spouse was made to undertake new family goals and it’s for that that they work each day to achieve those goals and improve their living conditions.  

Miriam Aurora, who already had clear and established objects, wants to buy feed to raise her animals and at the same time materials to build larger corrals and improve conditions in order to be able to buy more animals that can increase her sales and satisfy the orders of her clients. Maria has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles in order to meet her needs. 

Miriam Aurora and her children are hardworking, friendly, and well respected by their neighbors in the area where they lives which they’ve earned through their work, effort, and dedication.

loans.use: to buy feed to raise her animals as well as materials to improve conditions in the corrals in which she keeps the animals.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 58 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salr adelante, es viuda hace 22 años. Vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 34 y 25 años de edad quienes la acompañan y apoyan, habitando juntos en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Dina es la venta de periódicos para eso se levanta muy temprano y se dirige a  la imprenta donde compra sus periódicos para luego llevarlos a su puesto en un mercado conocido de la localidad, pero además sale a vender de manera ambulatoria caminando por las calles de la ciudad. Lleva realizando éste oficio desde hace 22 años logrando hacerse conocida y contando con una clientela regular quienes la esperan por su periódico diariamente, contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la venta en sus ratos libres. Le gusta su negocio, ya que gracias a las ganancias logró sacar adelante a su hijos. Ahora con la avanzada edad que tiene, y por tanto en un futuro ya no podrá salir a caminar, tiene planes de hacer arreglos en su casa y construir cuartos para alquiler. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.  Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de periódico y un saldo en la compra de maderas para el arreglo su casa y la construcción de cuartos pequeños para alquiler
texts.en:
Dina, 58, is a hardworking and persevering woman with a lot of desire to get ahead. She has been a widow for 22 years. She lives with her 2 children, ages 34 and 25, who accompany and support her, living together in the home they own. Dina sells newspapers. She gets up very early and goes to the printer where she buys newspapers to take to her stall in the town market. She also sells by walking through the streets of the city. She has been doing this for 22 years and is well known. She has regular customers who wait for her for their daily paper. Her son helps her with sales during his free time. She likes her business because thanks to her earnings she has been able to help her children get ahead. 

Now that she is getting older, and because in the future she won't be able to go out to sell, she has plans to make repairs to her house and build rooms to rent out. This is her 10th loan with the institution MFP and she hopes for your collaboration to continue working towards her objectives. With the amount requested, 3000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying newspapers and will use the balance to buy wood for repairing her house and building small rooms for rent.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers as well as materials for repairing her house and making rooms to rent.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 53 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos ya todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella una de ellas es madre soltera y vive con su pequeña hija. Su esposo es maestro.

Ella  es maestra en una escuela de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio,  vende  ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días de la semana recorriendo la ciudad y también vende  sus productos en la escuela donde imparte sus conocimientos tanto a sus compañeras como también a madres de familia que llegan hasta este centro de estudios. Deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva cinco años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa sobretodo lo de temporada, trajes de baño, bermudas, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco  ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. 

Sus sueños son tener un gran local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank José Cesario Reyes meets every 15 days in the canton Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its crafts that are known nationally and internationally.  It’s the location of the famous straw hats. 

In this place lives Ana, 53 years old. She is married, and they have four children who are all already grown. Two of her children live with her; one is a single mother and lives with her young daughter. Her husband is a teacher. 

She is a teacher in a local school, and she also works in retail. She sells all types of clothes, and her method of sales is door to door. She works three days of the week all over the city, and she also sells her products in the school, where she passes along her knowledge, mostly to her co-workers as well as they mother who come to this study center. She sells on credit and collects every fifteen days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil as she needs it. She’s been in this business for 5 years, and it’s going very well. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, especially seasonal clothing, bathing suits, shorts, blouses, shirts and baby clothes. She has been in the communal bank through 5 loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are fast. 

Her dream is to have a large store in which to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy bathing suits, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Las Del Río (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las del Rio está formado por 10 socias quienes son personas amables, trabajadoras, y muy  gentiles, quienes luchan día a día para mejorar la situación economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de exuberante vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y realizan artesanías como sogas y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.  Mantienen la cultura, tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Martha, tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera, vive con sus padres, su papá labora en la albañilería y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. La casa donde vive es propiedad de sus padres.
 
Ella está estudiando en la universidad el tercer año de enfermería y solo en las vacaciones labora ejerciendo su profesión. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y en los gastos de sus estudios. 

Su meta es culminar su carrera y ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
The village bank Las del Rio is made up of 10 women who are friendly, hardworking and very nice. They fight day to day to improve their economic situation at home and help their families get ahead. They live in the parish of Jadan in Cuenca. This area is surrounded by lush vegetation and the people raise animals, farm and make crafts like ropes. Many people commute daily to the city for work. They maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Martha, 22, who is single and lives with her parents. Her dad works as a mason and her mom is a housewife. They own their home.

She is in her third year of nursing school at the university and only works during vacations. At home she raises guinea pigs which she sells when she needs the money.

This is her fourth loan with the village bank and she will use it to buy guinea pigs and pay school expenses. Her goal is to finish her degree and be a good professional.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and pay for school expenses.

loans.name: Paul Walter

texts.es:
Paul es un joven de 19 años de edad muy trabajador y dedicado, vive en la ciudad de Ica, tierra generosa que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también por su agricultura, y sus espectaculares dunas, el nos comenta que ama mucho la comida peruana y que uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo arroz con pollo y en sus tiempos libres le encanta cocinar por ello le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía.

Paul es chofer de mototaxi, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es respetuoso con los clientes y sobre todo honrado.
Paul está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar un mantenimiento  general a su mototaxi, con ello tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y manejara con seguridad, esta mejora le permitirá tener más ingresos y seguir luchando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Ser un Chef”.
texts.en:
Paul is a hard-working and dedicated young man who is 19 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, a generous land characterized by its climate that is warm any time of year. Ica is also known for its agriculture and spectacular dunes. Paul tells us that he loves Peruvian food and that one of his favorites is the rich dish "arroz con pollo" [rice with chicken]. Paul loves to cook in his free time; he would have loved to study gastronomy.

Paul drives a "mototaxi." He works about eight hours a day and can serve up to 30 customers in a day. He thinks things are going well with his business because he respectful of his customers and, above all, an honorable young man.

Paul is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your help, he will be able to perform general maintenance on his mototaxi. This will make it possible for him to have a vehicle in good condition and to drive safely. With these improvements, he can earn more income and continue working towards his greatest dream: "to be a chef."

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang is 50 years old. She is living and cultivating rice in Kompong Cham province. She has been involved in this business together with her husband since 1982. She earns a low income from it because she owns only a few small pieces of farmland. In sight of the difficulties of living, three of her daughters decided to leave home for work in Phnom Penh city. They work for a garment factory in various positions and they normally send a part of their salaries home every month to support the entire family. 

Mrs. Lang decided to take out some funds from HKL, a Kiva partner, to buy a plot of farmland from a villager. She hopes that her situation will become better through using the precious funds from our lenders. However hard it is, Lang has a strong commitment to support her children until they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René, trabaja independientemente realizando ensamblaje y  mantenimiento de computadoras y también brinda servicios de electricidad.
El crédito lo requiere para pasar un curso y actualizar sus estudios en computación y así brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.
René es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en una casa alquilada en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
René works independently assembling and maintaining computers in addition to offering electrical services. 

He needs this loan to take a course and refresh his knowledge in computing and in that way offer better service to his customers.

René is single and does not have any children. He lives in a rented house in the Villa Fátima area of the city of La Paz. This is the first time he has worked together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a refresher course in computing that will help him with his computer assembly and repair business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children. She is 43 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Veronica used her last loan to purchase more computers. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan to purchase more printers and other accessories. She positively hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase printers and other computer accessories.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad muy responsable y respetuoso, vive con su esposa y su hijo menor de edad, tienen una casa en la que viven en un caserío de nombre “Los Almendros”, es un caserío rural que pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande y el que pertenece a la provincia de Piura la misma que se encuentra a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la zona en la que vive Guido es una zona en la que tienen como actividad económica principal la agricultura y ganadería.

Guido se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales  como ganado, ovinos y aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, en la actualidad cuenta con 15 cabezas de ganado y unas 25 aves entre pavos y gallinas, para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la unión entre su hijo y su esposa ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

Guido desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde Y posterior venta de sus animales y a la vez mejorar el acondicionamiento de sus animales para que puedan aumentar sus ventas y así satisfacer las solicitudes de sus clientes. Guido ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles con los que atenderá sus necesidades.


Guido su esposa y su hijo son personas de buen carácter, nobles y trabajadores por lo que son bien considerados por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Guido, 32, is a very responsible, respectful father who lives with is wife and youngest son.  They have a house in a rural community called "Los Almendros" which belongs to the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is about three hours from the city of Chiclayo.  The main business activity in Guido's area is agriculture and livestock farming.

Guido raises livestock such as cattle, sheep, ducks, turkeys, and guinea pigs, among others.  Currently he has 15 heads of cattle and 25 turkeys and hens.  He has been able to set up strategic spaces around his house to raise the animals.  The close relationship between his son and wife has led to establishing new family goals which they work toward daily in order to improve their lifestyle.

Guido wants to buy balanced feed for his livestock and improve the animals' living conditions in an effort to increase sales and satisfy customer demand.  He has requested a loan through Edpyme Altnerativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN to meet his needs.

Guido, his wife and his son are kind, noble, hard-working people who are held in high esteem by their neighbors.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Holalla Dominga

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Holalla, tiene 57 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido trabaja en la liga cantonal.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a elaborar y vender artesanías, elabora flores de tela, vestidos para muñecas,  además ella compra canastas de mimbre sin pintar, después  les adorna en diversos colores y  lleva todos sus productos una vez a la semana hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a entregar a distintos bazares y lugares donde le  compran toda su mercadería. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta la noche cuando tiene pedidos que llevar,  lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 20 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más canastas, pinturas, telas, hilos, botones, alambre y más materia prima para todos los productos que elabora. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del mismo  y le gusta porque con los créditos le han ayudado mucho para continuar en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "José Cesario Reyes" meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and crafts, both nationally and internationally.  It is also known for the famous Panama straw hat.

This is where Mrs. Holalla, 57, lives with her common-law husband and three children who are all adults and independent.  Her husband works for the canton league.

She is a great housewife who earns her own income making and selling crafts.  She makes cloth flowers, doll clothes, and paints and decorates wicker baskets in different colors.  Once a week she takes her products to the city of Guayaquil to the different shops that buy her merchandise.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until nighttime when she has orders, and has been doing business successfully for over 20 years.

The loan she has requested is to buy baskets, paints, fabrics, threads, buttons, wire and other raw materials to make her products.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and is its acting president.  She enjoys belonging to it because the loans have been of great help in keeping her business going.

Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working.

loans.use: To buy baskets, paints, fabrics, threads, buttons, wire, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La señora Susana es casada, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales dos son dependientes. La señora es nacida en la provincia Florida del departamento Santa Cruz,  vive actualmente en la zona Villa Alegre. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayuno (tojori, somos y otros) hace 5 años, Su negocio esta ubicado  en su mismo domicilio, ella trabaja de lunes a domingo de horas 5:30 a 11.00. La señora demuestra ser responsable y muy trabajadora. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para capital de inversión (construcción de un tinglado para su negocio). La señora esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio ya que esta es la única actividad que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Susana is married and has five children, two of which still live at home.  She was born in the Florida Province in the department of Santa Cruz, but currently lives in the Villa Alegre area.  For five years she has been selling breakfast food (tojori - corn pudding, juices, etc.).  She runs her business out of her home and works Monday through Sunday from 5:30 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.  She is very responsible and hard-working, and plans to use the loan as investment capital to build a food stall.  She is very grateful for the confidence shown in her and for the opportunity to grow her business, since this is the sole income for maintaining her family.

loans.use: To build a food stall.

loans.name: Phloan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phloan is  44 years old and in a hog-raising business. She lives in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. 

She built a wooden pig pen in her yard and put in a breeding pig for the purpose of making offspring. As a result, Phloan noticed that her business is growing well. So now she intends to improve this business through a loan from HKL and Kiva. 

She told us that she will purchase pig feed and an additional eight piglets, which will be placed in the new pig pen. She hopes that this business will provide a good income when her pigs become big enough for sale. She is very happy with the funds given to her to improve her pig-fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and an additional eight piglets.

loans.name: Sara Petrona

texts.es: La emprendedora Sara Patrona  su actividad a la que se dedica  es a una pulpería,  ella ya tiene años de experiencia y conoce lo que sus clientes le solicitan, esta emprendedora es una cliente de Fundación León 2000 en el cual en el crédito otorgado anteriormente lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de productos para la pulpería. Esta emprendedora esta solicitando nuevamente financiamiento para la compra de productos como  granos básicos, jabón, detergente, pan, tan, huevos, verduras entre otros productos.
texts.en: The entrepreneur, Sara Patrona, runs a general store and has two years' experience and knows what her customers want.  She is a customer of the Fundación León 2000 and used the previous loan to buy products for her store.  Now she is requesting a new loan to buy products such as basic grains, soap, detergent, bread, eggs and vegetables, among other items.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soap, detergent, bread, eggs, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So operates a clothes-selling business from place to place and lives in Ang Snoul district. 

She sells many types of clothes, which she buys from a nearby factory, including silk and traditional Khmer clothing. And normally, she’s able to earn $5.00 per day from this business. She currently lives with her younger sister who works as part of a sewing staff in Phnom Penh city.

With her requested amount, Mrs. So will pay for construction laborers to fix and decorate some parts of her house. As a future plan for her business, Mrs. So aims to open a clothes shop in a busy market of the city.

loans.use: to pay for construction laborers to fix and decorate some parts of her house.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Otgon is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband, mother and a daughter in the Uvurhangai province of Central Mongolia. 

Her husband is unemployed and her mother is too old and stays at home. The daughter studies at the secondary school. 

She worked for the animal hides sales center for five years and in 2005 she became independent and started selling animal hides. Now she plans to get the supplies in large amount and trade them so that she could earn enough to feed the family. 

She is a clever and hardworking woman who says that "I would like to extend my business by getting the supplies in large quantities". The total amount she is requesting is 2,100,000 MNT for more animal hides from herders.

loans.use: To buy more animal hides from herders

loans.name: Yumjirlhan

texts.en:
Yumjirlham is a 41-year-old woman and lives with her husband and two children in Uvurhangai province of Central Mongolia. 

The husband often runs a taxi service. The children study at the secondary schools. 

She started a meat retailing business in 2001. Since that time, she has become very experienced and made a number of regular customers. 

She wants to extend her business activity by getting the supplies in large quantities, due to the approach of the biggest festival in Mongolia when they purchase meats in large amounts. 

She is a hardworking woman who says that "I want to extend the business by using the right timing and save for my daughters college fees". The total amount she is requesting is 1,700,000 MNT for the meat supplies.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Chona works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Chona is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This time Delia is borrowing PHP 50,000 to fund her restaurant business. 

The restaurant business that she previously funded though NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell.

Editha has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Editha would like to build and expand her business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Josephine is married and has seven children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like vegetables, spices and meat. In 2011, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like vegetables, spices and meat

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a married woman with six children. Teresita is sixty-six years old and resides in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Teresita operates a service-based business, providing laundry to local community members to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase materials that are needed in laundry services such as soaps, liquid and etc. Teresita has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Teresita wants to serve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase materials that are needed in laundry services such as soaps, liquid and etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Geswendebala De Sect15 Group

texts.fr:
Mme GISELE est la représentante du groupe GESWENDBALA DE SECT 15. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. 03 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les agents des différents services et ses voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter  11 pièces de pagnes.

Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour  renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour ses pagnes.
texts.en: GISELE is the representative of the GESWENDBALA DE SECT 15 group.  She is married and mother of five children.  The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is six-months old.  Three of her children attend school. She has five dependents.  She has been selling "pagne" (traditional colorful cloth) for six years.  She stocks up at the Sector 10 market in the city.  Her customers are agents from different departments and her neighbors.  She wants to buy 11 pieces of pagne fabric.  She wants to use her profits to build her business. Her goal is to open a store for her pagnes.

loans.use: to buy 11 pieces of pagne (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva is 29 years old.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Eva has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
Melchorita is 43 years old, married and has five children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melchorita has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Melchorita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Melchorita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial. Está separada del padre de sus hijos. Habita en su propia casa, en compañía de sus dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Rocío es la venta de periódicos, levantándose muy de temprano en la madrugada y se dirige a la imprenta, donde compra sus periódicos, para luego venderlos de forma ambulante por las calles de su ciudad. Atiende sus clientes de manera amable y cordial, logrado ganarse su preferencia. Tiene más de 08 años dedicándose a  éste negocio,  y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico, que le sirve para mantener su hogar. Oficio que aprendió de su madre, quien también se dedicaba  a éste negocio. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja,  y por tanto desea continuar con su negocio, además de querer incursionar en la venta de perfumes y productos de belleza, de esa manera busca generarse más ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías como periódicos de otras casas de imprenta, de esa manera desea  tener variedad disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
29-year-old Rocío is a hard-working and determined woman.  She is also cheerful and friendly.  She is separated from her children's father and lives in her own home together with her two children who are 7 and 5 years old.  Rocío's business is selling newspapers.  She gets up very early in the morning and heads to the printer's where she buys her newspapers which she then sells as an itinerant vendor, in the city streets.  She serves her customers in a kind and friendly manner, thereby gaining their loyalty.  Rocío has been in this business for more than eight years.  Up to now she has carried out her work alone.  She enjoys her business as it makes her an income which she uses to provide for her household.  She learned the trade from her mother who was also in this business.  She considers it to be fairly profitable as it makes her good profits.  For this reason, she would like to continue in her business.  She would also like to start selling perfumes and beauty products so that she can make more income.

This will be Rocío's third loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue reaching her goals. Rocío feels comfortable with her community bank because she considers it to be a united and supportive group.  She will invest her 1,500 soles in buying more merchandise such as newspapers from other printers'.  This will allow her to have a greater variety to sell.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Maritza es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, con una gran belleza natural. Su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y se caracterizan ser personas ambles y gentiles.

La Señora. Maritza tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 4 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Maritza se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y en sus tiempos libres vende ropa, les vende a sus amigas y hay veces sus clientes la visitan en la casa.
 
Se encuentra en el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es tener una boutique para tener un negocio fijo.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the 'Bankito Progresista' community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which was declared a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  It is the third most important city in the country and has great natural beauty.  The locals maintain the culture and traditions of their villages and are noted for being kind and friendly people.

Maritza is 28 years old, married, and has three children who are 7, 5 and 4 years old.  All of her children are attending elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a car mechanic.  They do not own their own home but live in a rental house instead.

Maritza cares for her children and, in her free time, she sells clothes to her friends.  Sometimes her customers come to visit her at home.

This is Maritza's fifth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying clothes with which to stock her business.

Maritza's goal is to own a clothes store so that she can have a permanent business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is married and has 2 children.   He is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Oscar operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years and every month he earn 6,630 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Oscar became a member of GDMPC recently. In the future, Oscar hopes for his children to finish their studies and gain double income out from his business.

loans.use: repair his transport vehicle

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: La señora Apolonia no es casada pero convive  con el señor German,  tienen 2 hijos uno de 2 años y otra de 5 años, ellos viven en casa propia en la zona Unión Esmeralda,  es un lugar alejado, pero cuentan con servicios básicos, como ser agua y luz.  La señora Apolonia se dedica a la venta de salchipapas de lunes a sábado, tiene un carrito donde vende salchipapas, donde ambula vendiendo sus salchipapas y los días domingos vende papa en la localidad de Sacaba solo el día domingo. El préstamo es para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus salchipapas como aceite y papa y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, ella es una persona joven dedicada a su trabajo y al cuidado de sus hijos se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Apolonia is not married but she lives with German.  They have two children: one is 2 years old and the other is 5 years old.  They live in their own home in Unión Esmeralda.  It is a remote place but they receive basic services such as water and electricity.  Apolonia's business is selling 'salchipapas' (traditional fast food) from Monday to Saturday.  She has a cart where she sells 'salchipapas'.  She pushes her cart around selling her 'salchipapas' and, on Sundays only, she sells potatoes in the town of Sacaba.

Apolonia will use this loan to buy supplies for making her 'salchipapas'.  She will buy oil and potatoes.  This will increase her working capital.  Apolonia is a young person who is committed to her work and to caring for her children.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and oil for making 'salchipapas'

loans.name: Luz Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999, es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, con una gran belleza natural. Su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos y se caracterizan ser personas ambles y gentiles.

Doña Luz tiene 43 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 26, 24, 21 y 19 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, dos de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente  y su ultima hija estudia en Universidad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Luz es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, actividad que la desempeña hace 5 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, tiene un local propio en un mercado de la ciudad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería.

Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the 'Bankito Progresista' community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which was declared a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  It is the third most important city in the country and has great natural beauty.  The locals maintain the culture and traditions of their villages and are noted for being kind and friendly people.

Luz is 43 years old, married, and has four children who are 26, 24, 21 and 19 years old.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Two of her children work and help out financially and her youngest daughter is studying at University.  Her husband works in the building trade as a builder.  They do not own their own home but live in a rental house instead.

Luz is a saleswoman and her business is selling all kinds of clothing.  She has been in this business for 5 years and works from Sunday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She has her own sales location in a market in the city.

This is Luz's third loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying clothing to stock her business.

Luz's goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the materials needed for the renovation of her boarding house.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 64 years old and married with six children.

Pacita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Pacita has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood retail business for 30 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Pacita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food vending business.

Remedios has been in this business for 27 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 48 years old and married with five children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Thelma has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Basiliana

texts.en:
Basiliana is 62 years old and married with eight children.

Basiliana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Basiliana has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Basiliana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Djéneba

texts.fr:
Mme Djéneba est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 34ans et le moins âgé a23ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de l’eau glacée, du jus de bissaps du jus de gingembre depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de la cité AN II en ville. Ses clients sont les élèves, les enfants et la population en générale.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de sucre, 01 sachet de 100 paquets pour attacher le jus, 01 sac de 100 kg de bissaps et 01 tine de gingembre.

Mme économise ses bénéfices pour s’acheter un congélateur. Elle ambitionne aider la famille surtout les enfants dans leur études et acheter une machine à coudre les sachets.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djéneba is married and mother of four children. The eldest is 34 years old and the youngest is 23. Three of them go to school. She has four dependents. She has been selling iced water, bissaps juice (made from dried hibiscus flowers), and ginger juice for three years. She gets her supplies at the AN II market in the city. Her customers are students, children, and the general population. 

She wants to buy two bags of sugar, one bag of 100 pouches to package juice, one 100 kg bag of hibiscus, and one tine of ginger. Mrs. Djéneba will use her profits to buy a freezer. She plans to help her family, especially her children in their studies, and she wants to buy a machine to sew the pouches.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sugar, 1 bag of 100 pouches for juice packaging, 1 bag of 100 kg of bissap, and 1 tine of ginger.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un padre de familia muy responsable de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres menores hijos en su casa la cual han construido con gran esfuerzo en un caserío rural de nombre “Tierra Rajada” perteneciente al distrito de Olmos y el cual esta a una hora aproximadamente la provincia de Chiclayo y el departamento de Lambayeque, por ser zonas rurales aun no cuentan con los servicios básicos.

Por ser una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera por donde vive Tomas es que viene dedicándose hace 6años atrás a la compra/venta de animales como el ganado, ovinos, caprinos entre otros, él recorre anexos de su caserío realizando compras de animales para posteriormente criarlos o revenderlos en la diferentes ciudades como puede ser Trujillo o el mismo Chiclayo, Tomas ha logrado ya tener una buena cantidad de clientes fijos a quienes tiene que abastecer de manera semanal o quincenal para lo que trabaja con la modalidad de pago al contado o al crédito. Su esposa se dedica a cuidar a sus menores hijos y a la crianza de animales menores como aves de corral en lugares apropiados en su propio domicilio.

Tomas en su deseo de seguir creciendo y abasteciendo a todos sus clientes cree conveniente ampliar su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles el cual será destinado para la compra de animales (ganado y ovino) por lo que considera que tiene demanda suficiente por satisfacer.

Tomas y su familia son naturales del caserío en el que viven por lo que han venido trabajando de manera honesta y responsable por salir adelante como familia y eso les ha permitido ganarse la consideración y el respeto de todos sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Tomas is a responsible 34 year old family head. He lives with his wife and his three young children in a house which they built with a lot of hard work in a rural village called "Tierra Rajada", in the district of Olmos. It is located approximately an hour away from the province of Chiclayo and the department of Lambayeque. As they are rural areas they still do not have basic services.

As the area where Tomas lives is entirely agricultural and livestock based, he has spent the last six years making a living buying and selling animals such as cattle, sheep, goats and others. He travels round the annexes of his hamlet buying animals to later raise or resell in various cities such as  Trujillo and Chiclayo. Tomas has managed to make a large numbers of regular customers who he must supply for weekly or fortnightly. For this reason he works with either cash payments or credits. His wife looks after their young children and raises smaller animals such as poultry in appropriate places in their own house.

Tomas hopes to continue growing and providing for all his customers. He thinks it is necessary to extend his business and for this reason he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 2000 PEN. This amount will be used to buy animals (cattle and sheep) as he believes he has sufficient demand to attend to.

Tomas and his family are originally from the hamlet where they live. They have worked honestly and responsibly to get ahead as a family. This has allowed them to win the respect and consideration of all their neighbours.

loans.use: to buy animals (cattle and sheep).

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Es conviviente con Juan quien se dedica al transporte, y es padre de sus hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad. Juntos habitan en casa de su madre, en compañía de su mamá, papá y hermanos. La actividad que realiza Mónica es la venta de verduras, instalando  todos los días una mesa al costado de la bodega que tiene su madre en su casa, de esa manera oferta sus productos. Tiene más de 01 año realizando éste negocio, y hasta el momento se dedica sola atender a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio rentable ya que logra vender todos sus productos y obtiene ganancias razonables, por tanto desea incrementar su stocks de mercaderías así logrará hacer crecer su negocio. Además tiene planes de comprarse otra unidad de transporte y alquilarlo, para generarse más ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de diversas verduras al por mayor.
texts.en:
21-year-old Mónica is a hard-working and determined woman who is also cheerful and friendly.  She lives with her partner, Juan, who provides a transport service.  He is also the father of her children who are 4 years old and 1 year old.  They live together in her mother's house together with her mom, dad and siblings.  Mónica's business is selling vegetables.  Every day she sets up a table next to the grocery store that her mother has at home and offers her products for sale.  She has been in this business for more than a year and, up to now, she has worked alone, serving her customers in a kind and friendly manner.  Mónica enjoys her business because it makes her an income and allows her to have a job and feel like a productive person.  She believes that her business is profitable as she manages to sell all her products and makes reasonable profits.  For this reason, she would like to increase her stock of merchandise so that she can grow the business.  She also has plans to buy another vehicle and hire it out so that she can make more income.

This will be Mónica's second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  She feels comfortable with her community bank as she knows all the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people.  Mónica will invest the 800 soles she is requesting in her business, buying a range of vegetables wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Tor

texts.en:
Mrs. Tor is 38 years old and a loving mother of two school-age children, living in Baray district. 

She generates her income from rice husbandry as well as from a grocery selling business. She is able to earn an average of $3.20 per day to support her family. 

Recently, Mrs. Tor has run out of her stock, so she decided to look for some funds from our lenders to replenish her stock and to maintain the continued sustainability of her business. This is a forth cycle loan from HKL. With her previous loans, she has never made any late payments to our MFI. 

In the future, she hopes to pursue a comfortable life as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to replenish her stock and to maintain the continued sustainability of her business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 56-year-old married woman with a 10-year-old child. 

She and her husband run a fishing business in their town. Esterlita's husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Esterlita sells the fish at the market. They also catch crabs to sell. Esterlita does her best to provide for their needs and send her child to school.

Esterlita has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and repair the fishing boat. Esterlita plans to use her profit to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and repair the fishing boat

loans.name: Cecilla

texts.en:
50-year-old Cecilia has had a food production business for 6 years.  She is single and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

She earns PHP 2,000 every month for doing this type of business.  Cecilia intends to use the money from the loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Cecilia became a member of GDMPC in 2008.  In the future, Cecilia wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with 4 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 34 years old.

Helen has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

In the enclosed photo, Helen is shown posing with her customized Tricycle with the cab enclosing the motorcycle to protect the passenger and driver from the wind and rain.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en:
Emilita is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Emilita runs a business buying and selling dry goods such as housewares and plasticware in the Philippines. She has been running the business for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Emilita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Emilita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more dry goods such as houseware and plasticware to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is forty-four years old, married, with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorena has a business buying and selling kitchen and plastic ware in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance.

Victoria has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Haide requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family..

Haide is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support six children. She is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

Yolanda requested a 3,600 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is purchasing the Envirofit cookstove because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food, and she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer. Yolanda is aware that, by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Nazemse Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est la représentante du groupe NAZEMSE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. Un (01) va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vendait de la farine de maïs depuis 07ans. Mais après son accouchement elle vend maintenant des pagnes et habits car avec ses jumeaux elle peut plus faire la transformation de sa farine.Elle s’approvisionnement au marché de  secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes

Elle veut s’acheter 05 pièces de pagnes et des habits pour enfants.

Avec ses économies, elle veut  augmenter ses articles de vente et s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne agrandir sa boutique et diversifier ses produits.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatimata is the representative of the Nazemse group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is four and the youngest is six-months old. One attends school. She has three dependents. She sold corn flour for seven years. But after giving birth, she is now selling pagne (colorful traditional fabric) and clothing because with her twins she can no longer make flour. She buys her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women and men. She wants to buy five pieces of pagne and children's clothing. With her savings, she wants to increase her items for sale and to take care of her family.  Her goal is to expand her store and to diversify her products.

loans.use: to buy 5 pieces of pagne (traditional cloth) and children's clothing.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with two children. She is 43 years old and resides at Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Elsa has owned and operated a coconut production business for 20 years to earn a living. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow. In 2007, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elsa wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline earns a living through fishing. She is 39 years old, married and has six children aged between two and eighteen. Evangeline's husband is a fisherman.

Evangeline and her husband started their fishing business 15 years ago. They are able to provide food, clothes and other basic needs with their income. Evangeline also makes dried fish that she sells to her community. 

Now that five of her children go to school, Evangeline said it is a struggle to make ends meet. She works hard to earn a better income and sustain her family.

Evangeline has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, floaters and other materials. She hopes their business will grow and that their children will continue with their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, floaters and other materials

loans.name: Violeta's Group

texts.en:
Violeta is 54 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married with three adult children. 

Violeta has a general store that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and more. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase more canned goods, noodles, soap, etc. to sell. Violeta has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Violeta hopes to start another business.

Violeta is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, noodles, soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leom

texts.en:
Mrs. Leom is 41 years old and married with 2 single children. She has resided in Prey Chor district for ages. She’s a low-educated mother, thus, she has tried to work hard in her career as a rice cultivator to provide a good education for her children. She doesn’t want her children to become low-educated people and work in a business like hers. 

Leom, along with her husband, grows her rice crops twice a year. She has enough farming equipment for her projects, such as cows, a plow, a rake and a pumping machine.

Leom is requesting her first loan from HKL in order to cultivate her dry-season rice. She’ll use this fund to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. 

Leom is very hopeful in life and for her business. She intends to improve her business and increase her rice production as much as she can in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 42 años de edad, es una hombre trabajador y empeñoso, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Rita quien es empleada. Fruto de esa unión tienen tres hijos de 20, 18 y 16 años de edad, a quienes quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Raúl es la crianza de pollos, para esto alquila un galpón con una capacidad para 2000 pollos a un amigo suyo, logrando sacar una producción contante de pollos. En lo que lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 6 años, contando con el apoyo de sus hijos en el mantenimiento de los pollos desde el comienzo hasta la venta de los mismos. Le gusta su negocio pues ve la integración de su familia y la colaboración de su hijos, además de contar con una demanda constante de su producción ya que es el alimento principal en la mesa de las familias de su localidad, por tanto viendo lo rentable que le resulta su negocio tiene planes de mantenerse y continuar con su negocio, deseando ampliar y contar con su propio galpón. Este será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta estar a gusto con banco comunal pues los considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1300  nuevos soles los adicionará a su capital y lo invertirá en la compra pollos bebes así con alimentos y vacunas para comenzar con una nueva producción.
texts.en:
Raúl, 42 years old, is a hard working, persevering man who greatly wishes to get ahead. He lives with Rita, who is employed. From this union they have three children of 20, 18 and 16 years of age, who he loves very much and who live in his own house. Raúl makes a living raising chickens. He rents a coup with capacity for 2000 chickens from a friend of his, from where he manages a constant production of chicken.

He has made a living in this activity for the last 6 years, with the support of his children in looking after the chickens from their birth until their sale. He likes his business as he can see how his family are united and his children collaborate, as well as counting on a constant demand of production. It is the main food set on the tables of the local families. Therefore, seeing how profitable his business is, he has plans to continue with his business, wishing to extend it and have his own coup.

This will be his 5th loan with MFP. He hopes to receive this support to be able to accomplish his plans. Apart from this, he mentions that he feels comfortable with his communal bank as he considers them to be a united and supportive group. With the requested amount of 1300 PEN he will add it to his capital and will invest in buying baby chicks as well as food and vaccines to start a new production.

loans.use: to buy chicken, balanced food for poultry and vaccines for these.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um is a 50-year-old married mother who lives with her three lovely children in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, a province in Cambodia. Two of the children are married and live in separate houses. Mrs. Um currently works in the rice business, an occupation she has been involved with for a long time. She is a responsible mother who always takes care of her livelihood and provides a good education to her children. She earns a low income per day for covering her family's expenses. To improve her quality of life, she would like to build steps to get up to her house as presently she has used temporary wooden steps, that is not strong and safe enough for the whole family. She has decided, with her family, to take out a loan from HKL, a partner of Kiva, so her family can live in comfort and happiness.

loans.use: to build steps to get up to her house.

loans.name: Beatriz María

texts.es:
