En la localidad el Cadi de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar conocimos La señora Beatriz, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y dos años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella  tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí  vende de todo un poco y a pesar de que es pequeña su tienda allí tiene de todo ya que sus clientes son muy importantes y siempre trata que ellos tengan plena  satisfacción, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 18h00, su negocio le gusta ya que  le deja buenas  ganancias y no tiene que salir de su casa y además está al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos, aquí lleva más de 6 años y con cada crédito trata de mejorar el negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos de primera necesidad para su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Ilusión' community bank meet in Cadi, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 30-year-old Beatriz who lives with her common-law husband and has two children who are 9 and 2 years old.  Her eldest is in school.  Her husband is a trader.

Beatriz has a small grocery store in her home where she sells a little of everything.  Although her store is small, she stocks everything as her customers are very important and she always tries to ensure that they are fully satisfied.  She works every day, from 6.30am to 6.00pm.  She likes her business because it makes her good profits and she doesn't have to leave the house which means that she is able to care for her children.  She has been in this business for more than 6 years and she uses each loan to try and improve her business.

Beatriz will use this loan to buy more basic household products for her store.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.

Beatriz's dream is to have a much larger store.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say, 53, is one of the residents of Kompong Cham province. She is a mother of 3 children, all of whom are single. Presently, two of them are working to help cover the family’s daily expenses. 

Mrs. Say has spent most of her life dedicated to rice husbandry. She has been in this business for many years. She typically earns around $2.50 per day, the same as her husband.

Every year during the dry season, the entire family meets many difficulties due to the lack of water. They usually use the water brought from another distant area. However, it is not enough for the family. 

Mrs. Say decided to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to dig a well in her yard, and then there will be enough water to use. She is very appreciative to our lenders who always kindly help low income families as well as hers.

loans.use: to dig a well in her yard.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
This is Emelyn, 31, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rommel, a farmer, and is the mother of two children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Emelyn operates a river spinach growing farm. She grows river spinach, or kang kong in our native language, on their farm located in Cavite. It is easy to maintain and it grows where there is a lot of water. The tender hollow stems of kang kong, as well as its leaves, are used in cooking.  It can be stir-fried, steamed, boiled, or lightly fried in oil. 

She sells her product to market stalls that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emelyn dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming inputs and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive por la parroquia Paccha en Cuenca, lugar de hermosos paisajes naturales, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Julia tiene 45 años, vive en unión libre a concebido 5 hijos de 27, 26, 23, 21 y 8 años de  edad, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, dos trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente y su último hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Julia se dedica a la venta de granos tiernos, producto que lo vende recorriendo la ciudad de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, esta actividad la desempeña hace 25 años. También labora en el arreglo de casas y lava ropa ajena.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su séptimo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de granos tiernos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank "Bankito Progesista". She lives in the parish Paccha in Cuenca, a place full of beautiful natural landscapes. Its inhabitants are devoted to raising animals, agriculture and many work in the city carrying out various activities, following the traditions and culture of their villages.

Julia is 45 years old. She lives in free union and has five children of 27, 26, 23, 21 and 8 years old age. Two of her children are married and live independently, two work and help her economically and her youngest son studies in a school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. The house they live in is their own.

Julia makes a living selling tender grains, which she sells by travelling the city from Monday to Saturday without a fixed timetable. She has spent the last 25 years in this activity. She also works fixing houses and washing peoples clothes.

In her communal bank this will be her 7th loan and she will invest it in buying tender grains to continue with her business.

Her aim is to have a shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy tender grains.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es padre de familia, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en una casa que ellos han logrado construir con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a su trabajo, su casa esta ubicada en un caserío rural donde solo cuenta con el servicio de luz, el caserío en el que viven lleva por nombre “CP-2 Colera” esta ubicado a unos 15 minutos del Distrito de Tambogrande el cual pertenece a la provincia de Piura, aproximadamente a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Se sabe que la zona en la que vive Miguel es una zona agrícola y ganadera por lo que siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con 1 has de terreno en la que siempre siembra sus productos de acuerdo a la temporada o estación, y en la actualidad ha decidido sembrar limón. Como actividad adicional él y su esposa se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral los cuales cría, engorda y luego comercializa a los mercados cercanos a su caserío 

Miguel es un esposo y padre responsable por lo que mantiene sus objetivos y sus metas bien claras para salir adelante por su familia , es por eso que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 3000 Nuevos Soles los cuales utilizará para la compra de de fertilizantes para cultivo de limón y compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales que cría.


Miguel y su familia siempre se han mantenido unidos, sus vecinos les tienen una gran estima y consideración por ser personas de buen carácter y trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Miguel is a father.  He lives together with his wife and son in a home that they have managed to build through a lot of effort and commitment to their work.  Their home is located in a small rural village which only has access to electricity.  The village in which they live is called "CP-2 Colera" and it is 15 minutes from Tambogrande district, Piura province, approximately 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

The area in which Miguel lives is an area where people farm and raise livestock and so Miguel has always worked in farming.  He has one hectare of land where he grows his products in accordance with the season. He is currently growing lemons.  As an additional business activity, he and his wife also raise farmyard animals which they raise, fatten and then sell in nearby markets.

Miguel is a responsible husband and father and his aims and goals are very clear: to get his family ahead in life.  For this reason, he has decided to request a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop and nutritionally-balanced feed to fatten the animals that he raises.

Miguel and his family have always been united.  Their neighbors hold them in high regard because they are good-natured and hard-working people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop and nutritionally-balanced animal feed

loans.name: Top

texts.fr: Madame top est une femme de  47 ans qui habite dans une des communautés sénégalaises. Elle est mariée et mère  de 6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 14 et 25 ans.  Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et pratique depuis plus  de 20 ans la vente de draps, tissus et parfums. Elle a une double activité car elle est en meme temps coiffeuse depuis plus  de 5 ans.  Ce  sont deux activités  qu’elle a choisi par passion  mais aussi dans le but d’assister sa famille. Elle  est  surtout intéressée  par l’aspect lucratif de  l’activité qu’elle exerce. Elle est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis janvier 2009. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de draps et de tissus en vue de renforcer son activité de commerce. Son objectif consiste  à accroitre ses bénéfices  et  améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Top is a 47-year old woman who lives in a Senegalese community. She is married and mother of six children, ages 14 to 25.  She has been in business, selling sheets, fabric, and perfume, for over 20 years.  She has also been a hairdresser for over five years.  She chose these two professions out of passion but also to help her family.  She is especially interested in the lucrative aspect of the businesses she is in.  She has been a member of the U-IMCEC in her area since January 2009.  She is requesting a 200,000 franc loan to buy sheets and fabric to strengthen her business.  Her goal is to increase her profits and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheets and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable, es separada del padre de sus hijos. Vive en compañía de su hijo de 8 años de edad, siendo ella padre y madre para él, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Jessica es la venta de pollos vivos, para eso los compra a los avicultores quienes crían estos pollos, y los lleva a vender en unas jaulas por el río, teniendo que realizar viajes cortos en bote por el río, llegando a los caseríos en las orillas del río, para venderlos a los lugareños o habitantes de ese lugar. Lleva realizando éste negocio desde hace 8 años llegando ser conocida por los lugareños de la zona quienes la esperan por sus productos a donde llega sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico, ademas de realizar viajes y conocer nuevos lugares, además de ser rentable por el precio que vende en esas zonas. Por lo contario, no le gusta cuando se le mueren algunas de sus pollos en el viaje lo que le ocasiona algunas perdidas, pero eso no la desanima y desea seguir en su negocio y ampliar llevando también otras mercaderías como ropa para venderlos. Este será el préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con banco comunal pues le agrada la ayuda que le están brindado para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como ropa y pollos para llevarlos por los caseríos en las riveras de los ríos.
texts.en:
Jessica, 36 years old, is a hard working, persevering woman. Apart from being happy and friendly, she is separated from the father of her children. She lives together with her eight year old son, and is both mother and father to him, living in her own house. Jessica makes a living selling live chickens. For this she buys them from the poultry farmers who raise them and she takes them in cages to sell them by the river. She has to make short journeys by boat along the river, to reach the hamlets on the banks of the river, to sell them to the inhabitants of these places. 

She has made a living in this business for the last eight years. She is well known by the inhabitants of the area who wait for her products, as she is the only one who comes. She likes her business as it allows her to receive an economic income as well as making journeys and visiting new places. As well as being profitable due to the price that she sells at in these areas. On the other hand, she doesn't like the fact that some of her chickens die on the journey which cause her some loss. But she is not discouraged by this and wishes to continue in her business and also extend it by taking other products with her, such as clothing to sell. 

This will be her 14th loan with MFP. Therefore, she requests a small loan to be able to fulfil her objectives. Apart from this she is happy with her communal bank as she appreciates the help she is receiving to move forward with her business. With the requested amount of 2000 PEN she will invest in buying supplies such as clothing and chickens to take them to the hamlets along the banks of the river.

loans.use: to buy more chickens as well as items of clothing to include in her sales.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 43 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar, es casado con Lilia quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen 05 hijos de 17, 14, 13, 10 y 4 años de edad, habitando cómodamente una casa alquilada. La actividad que realiza Wilfredo es la crianza de pollos para eso cuenta con un galpón en la casa alquilada que habita, donde logra un producción constante, teniendo una venta regular de sus pollos cuando están listos con el peso y tamaño adecuado. Realizando este negocio desde hace 02 años logrando hacerse conocido y contando con el apoyo de sus hijos en el mantenimiento y crianza de los pollos hasta la venta en el mercado. Le gusta su negocio pues lo ven un negocio fácil de realizar, como por la ganancia asegurada que tiene por la demanda constante de este producto, logrando una buena rentabilidad ya que cuenta con pedidos anticipados. Por lo contrario, en algunas ocasiones tuvo pérdidas debido a la peste, pero eso no lo ha desanimado logrando levantarse y seguir con su negocio, y con las ganancias tiene planes de abrir una bodega en su casa alquilada donde pueda generarse más ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera un grupo unido y solidario Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de pollos bebes para una nueva producción, y con el saldo comprará alimentos balanceados.
texts.en:
43-year-old Wilfredo is a hard-working and determined man who has a great desire to make progress in life.  He is married to Lilia who is a saleswoman.  The couple have five children who are 17, 14, 13, 10 and 4 years old.  They live together comfortably in a rental house.  Wilfredo's business is raising chickens.  He has a chicken shed at the rental house in which they live and he achieves constant production.  He regularly sells his chickens when they are ready and are of a suitable weight and size.  He has been in this business for two years and has become well known.  He has the support of his children in caring for and raising the chickens until he sells them in the market.  Wilfredo enjoys his business because it is an easy business to carry out and because it makes a guaranteed profit owing to the constant demand for this product.  It makes him good profits as he has advance orders.  On the other hand, sometimes he has suffered losses owing to disease.  However, this has not discouraged him.  He manages to get up and continue in his business.  With the profits he makes, he plans to open a grocery store in his home where he can make more income.

This will be Wilfredo's second loan from MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support as this will make him feel secure in making progress with his business.  He feels at ease with his community bank as he considers it to be a united and supportive group.  Wilfredo will invest his loan for 1,000 soles in buying baby chicks for new production.  He will use the remainder to buy nutritionally-balanced feed.

loans.use: to buy chicks and nutritionally-balanced bird feed

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa es casada, tiene 64 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la tejeduría de fajas típicas, inicio este negocios gracias al apoyo de un familiar, y hasta el momento lleva 25 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizar para la compra de materiales para el trabajo que realiza, va a compran hilos de diferente colores y clases, espera seguir mejorando su negocio y tener empleados.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is married.  She is 64 years old and didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  Her business is weaving traditional belts.  She started out in this business thanks to the support of a family member and has 25 years experience.

Maria Luisa is requesting a loan which she will use to buy the materials she needs for her work.  She will buy different types and colors of thread.  She hopes to continue improving her business and to hire employees.

loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia de 37 años de edad casado con Renol de 37 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos ellos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari Baja. Delia es una madre joven dedicada a las labores agrícolas juntamente con su querido esposo, ellos trabajan siempre en coordinación para que sus labores lo realicen de una manera ordenada y programado. Esta labor lo aprendieron de sus queridos padres, es por ello que siempre realizan  buenas practicas de la agricultura para obtener mejores producciones.
Delia siempre ha deseado contar con una parcela cerca de su domicilio con la finalidad de poder avanzar los trabajos ya que mas antes tenía una parcela que estaba muy alejada y no realizaba oportunamente los trabajos por lo que no producían como debe ser, asi que lo vendió con la finalidad de comprarse uno nuevo. Ahora ella esta contenta con su nueva parcela que le esta produciendo de manera constante por la buena asistencia que realizan. En un futuro ella esta pensando comprar un nuevo terreno agrícola con la finalidad de seguir expandiendo sus cultivos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Delia esta contenta con su banco comunal por que todo el grupo son buenas personas y los trabajos lo realizan en equipo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la poda de su campo agricola, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
37-year-old Delia is married to 37-year-old Renol.  The couple have four children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari Baja district.  Delia is a young mother who farms together with her much-loved husband.  They always coordinate their work so that they carry out their jobs in an ordered and organized manner.  They learned this business from their parents and so they always use good farming practices to obtain better production.  Delia has always longed to have a plot of land near her home so that she can make progress in her work as, in the past, she had a plot which was a long way away and she couldn't carry out her work in a timely manner which meant that her land didn't produce as well as it should have. Delia sold that plot in order to buy a new one.  She is happy with her new plot of land which is producing constantly thanks to the good care that she takes of it.  In the future, she plans to buy a further plot of farmland so that she can continue expanding her crops.

This is Delia's second loan from MFP and she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time.  Delia is happy to be a member of her community bank because all of the group's members are good people and they work as a team.  Delia will use her 2,000 soles to prune her farmland.  In order to achieve this, she will hire laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia, de 52 años de edad casado con Guillermo de 55 años fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Eufemia es una mujer afortunada gracias a los grandes esfuerzos que realiza juntamente con su querido esposo en la agricultura, logran obtener una buena producción tanto de cacao, plátano y papaya, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Ahi sus compradores escogen el mejor producto, que tenga buen tamaño. Es por ello que Eufemia tienen que estar al pendiente de sus plantaciones para obtener buenos frutos con la características que el mercado los requiere. Habitualmente Eufemia trabaja con su esposo y 5 peones quienes son los encargados de realizar la cosecha el mantenimiento del campo agrícola  (limpieza de malezas, control de plagas). Eufemia esta contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera una buena rentabilidad económica, es por ello que mas adelante esta pensando comprar una movilidad con la finalidad de llevar sus productos hacia la ciudad y venderlos a un mejor precio. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella está feliz y contenta con su banco comunal por que son amables y solidarios. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles invertirá en el pago al personal que trabaja en su campo agrícola que realizó la fumigación de plagas y el desyerbo de las malezas.
texts.en:
52-year-old Eufemia is married to 55-year-old Guillermo.  The couple have three children from their marriage.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari district.  Eufemia is a lucky woman thanks to the hard agricultural work that she carries out together with her much-loved husband.  They manage to obtain a good production of cacao, bananas and papaya.  These are products that are in great demand in the market, where her buyers choose the best produce which is the best size.  For this reason, Eufemia has to take good care of her plantations so that she obtains good fruit with the characteristics demanded by the market.  Eufemia often works with her husband and five laborers who take care of harvesting the crops and maintaining the farmland (weeding and pest control).  Eufemia is happy with the work that she does because it makes her good profits.  In the future, she is planning to buy a vehicle so that she can take her produce to the city and sell it for a better price.

This is Eufemia's second loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She is happy with her community bank because the members are kind and supportive.  Eufemia will invest the 2,000 soles she has requested in paying the staff who work on her land who sprayed the pests and got rid of the weeds.

loans.use: to pay laborers

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia muy responsable, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad, vive en su casa propia la cual ha sido construida en base a su esfuerzo y gran trabajo, viven en un caserío rural y pequeño de aproximadamente 50 familias a las afueras del distrito de Lambayeque de nombre “Caserío Nuevo San Miguel”, el cual esta a unos 40 minutos de Provincia de Chiclayo. 

Martha cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su propio domicilio, actividad a la que se dedica ya un aproximado de 3 años, según nos comenta, aprendió a los negocios desde muy pequeña y quienes le enseñaron fueron padres quines han sido comerciantes toda su vida, y es que con el tiempo de dio cuenta de que por la zona en la que vivía hacia falta una bodega, oportunidad que ella no quiso desaprovechar y decidió invertir lo poco que tenia en su negocio.
Su esposo y sus hijos al igual que ella están comprometidos con los objetivos trazados para mejorar sus condiciones de vida

Martha ha decidido invertir en la compra de abarrotes  y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir aun más su bodega debido a que se ha dado cuenta de que hay demanda y que con el tiempo crecerá su clientela, por lo que solicita un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1200 Nuevos Soles para dicha inversión.

Martha al igual que sus padres son naturales de la zona en la que viven, dedicándose siempre al comercio lo que ha permitido generar buenas relaciones con los habitantes de su caserío.
texts.en:
Martha is a very responsible mother who lives together with her husband and her two dependent children.  She lives in her own home which has been built as a result of all her efforts and hard work.  She lives in a small, rural village of approximately 50 families.  It is called 'Caserío Nuevo San Miguel' and it is on the outskirts of Lambayeque district, 40 minutes from Chiclayo province.

Martha has a small grocery store in her home.  She tells us that she has been in this business for approximately three years.  She learned the business from a very young age, having been taught by her parents who have been traders all their lives.  Over time, Martha realized that the area in which she lived needed a grocery store.  This was an opportunity that she did not want to let pass by and so she decided to invest the small amount of money she had in the business.  Martha's husband and children are also committed to achieving the goals they have set out so that they can improve their living conditions.

Martha has decided to invest in buying groceries and other basic household products so that she can further stock her store.  She has realized that there is demand and that, over time, she will increase her number of customers.  She is requesting a loan for 1,200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can make this investment.

Martha and her parents were all born in the area in which they currently live.  They have always worked in commerce and this has enabled them to forge good relationships with the people who live in the village.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other basic household products

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 59 years old.  She is a married woman and has eight children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Florencia sells fish to her community. She sells her husband's catch and also buys more fish from other fishermen to sell. Aside from fish, Florencia also buys and sells sea cucumbers. She works hard to provide for her family and keep them healthy always.

Florencia plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets and more sea cucumber to sell. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more sea cucumber to sell.

loans.name: Joy Ann

texts.en:
Joy Ann is from Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Joy Ann is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Joy Ann owns and operates a store, selling daily-use products in the local community. Joy Ann has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Joy Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Joy Ann is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hedalie

texts.en:
Hedalie is married and has three children. She is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Hedalie used her last loan to purchase pesticides and to pay for banana planting. Her business is successful, and she is taking a new loan to pay for labor for banana planting. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor for banana planting.

loans.name: Korb

texts.en:
Korb, 42, is a good mother of three single children. She helps her husband in earning income by cultivating rice from year to year. This type of business only provides her family daily food to eat. Consequently, two of her children decided to work as garment workers in Phnom Penh city to help the family.

In the following month, Korb’s daughter will get married. So Korb needs some funds from HKL and Kiva to prepare for the wedding party that will come soon. She is very grateful for the loan given to help her family. She said that she will pay back her loan to our lenders according to the schedule.

loans.use: to prepare a wedding party for her daughter.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 28-year-old married woman with three children ages 8, 6 and 3. She is engaged in a fishing business. Gemma's husband operates their fishing boat. Gemma sells her husband's catch at their town's market. They also grow seaweed to sell.

Gemma has requested a loan to purchase materials to repair a fishing boat such as marine plywood, nails, wood and adhesive. Gemma hopes to have a stable income to sustain her family and pay her obligations.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair a fishing boat such as marine plywood, nails, wood and adhesive.

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa is 29 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Central Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed but he helps her prepare and handle the sacks of coal and wood for her business. Her daughter goes to the kindergarten. 

Alimaa started her business by purchasing milk products and expanded a bit by purchasing sacks of coal and wood. She bought a van with the income to get the supplies and deliver them to the customers. Now she plans to buy the milk products in large quantities to sell them during the festival. 

Alimaa is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to extend my business by buying the supplies in large quantities so I can raise the household income." The total amount she is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to buy dried curd from the Arhangai Province.

loans.use: To buy dried curd from the Arhangai Province.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem is forty-three years old, living in the Prey Chor District of Kompong Cham province. Mrs. Sem is a happy and enterprising woman who is a mother of six children who are living under her care. To help cover daily expenses, two of her daughters work as factory workers in Phnom Penh city where they earn a decent salary each month. Mrs. Sem's husband drives a horse and cart. From this, he is able to earn about $4.00 per day. 

To improve her living environment, she would like to request some funds through HKL with the aim of mending her house. She and her family hope that this loan will enable them to live in good conditions and prosperity.

loans.use: to mend her house.

loans.name: Sdaeung

texts.en:
Mr. Sdaeung is a 41-year-old married man with four lovely children. He currently has a business planting soybeans on a plot of land that is two hectares long. Additionally, Mr. Sdaeung and his wife run another business as fish sellers. They typically earn about $4 per day. 

Currently Mr. Sdaeung is lacking funds so he wishes to request some funds from kind lenders. He will use this loan to purchase soybean seeds and fertilizers. Through this loan, he hopes his business will earn more profits. In the future, he wants to see his children have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase soybean seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 22-year-old married woman. Beatrice operates a café. She's worked in this business for six months. Her primary customers are her neighbors. 

Beatrice's other source of income is farming. She describes her greatest business challenge as competition and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Beatrice will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for her café. Beatrice aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for her café.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a 40-year-old married man. He has six children, four of whom are enrolled in school. Raphael operates a café. He's worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are his neighbors and passersby. 

Raphael's other source of income is farming. He describes his greatest business challenge as seasonality and his highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Raphael will use the KES 13,449 loan to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for his café. Raphael aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. He joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans and cooking oil for his café.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married and she is a mother of three adult children. She is 45 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Marlyn used her last loan to purchase corn fertilizers and pay for their application. Her farming business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In the future, she hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Alawe

texts.en:
Alawe is a 26-year-old, single man. Alawe operates a retail shop and sells his goods there. He's worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are his neighbors and passersby. Alawe describes his greatest business challenge as transportation and his highest monthly expense is food. 

Alawe owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Alawe will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil and detergents for resale. Alawe aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy belts wholesale

loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sope Khadim a été crée le 24-12-2010. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes issues du même quartier et exercent la activité qui est le commerce.	
	
La responsable; Nogoye debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.	
Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Une activité qu'elle maîtrise pour l'avoir exercé depuis plusieurs années
 
Avec son prêt reçu elle va acheter 2 brebis qu'elle va engraisser avant de revendre au bout de 5 à 6 mois.
		
Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et renforcer ses épargnes dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Sope Khadim was established on December 24, 2010. It is made up of ten women coming from the same neighborhood and operating in the same sort of business, trading.

Nogoye, standing on the right and rising her hand in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 40 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.

She raises sheep, a business she masters well due to the fact that she's been running it for several years.

She will use her part of the loan to buy two ewes that she will fatten and then resell after five or six months.

Her profits will enable her to improve the standard of living of her family and bolster her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy two ewes to fatten

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena, age 49, a mother of two children, lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She used her last loan to purchase snack items to vend. Her business is successful and now she's taking out a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. She hopes to gain double profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 53-year-old widowed woman. She has seven children and three are enrolled in school. Hadija operates a retail shop and sells her goods in this shop. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are the local area villagers. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is food. 

Hadija owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil and detergents for resale. Hadija aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en: Sulpicia is a 57-year-old widow having one child.  She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Sulpicia used her last loan to order additional cosmetic products from Avon to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking out a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 51 years old, married and the father of six children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

 He started his business using his own capital, money that he had earning from his previous job. He began selling firewood, through which his business grew. He continued bringing in more products until he noticed he had converted his business to a grocery store. He has been operating this business for ten years. He always relies on his strength and plans to expand his business and have his own store.

He is taking out the loan of 150,000 YER to buy oil, beans, sugar, bread, coffee, milk and soft drinks. He hopes very much that added inventory will help him with his business.

Mohammed's goal is to give a good future to his children and make his grocery store productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, soft drinks, sugar, bread, milk and other products  for his business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
27-year-old Geraldine is a married woman with two children aged 8 and 2. She is engaged in fishing. Geraldine helps her husband, who is a fisherman, by selling his catch at the market. She also makes dried fish to sell. Geraldine works hard to improve their business and take care of their children.

Geraldine requested this loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials. In the future, she hopes to expand their business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Carina Rocio

texts.es:
Carina vive en la ciudad de Pisco, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos a los cuales saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que por causas diversas se separo de su esposo y tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder salir adelante.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y pudo tener este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias ,se levanta muy temprano para poder conseguir el pescado fresco y poder vender a sus clientes productos de buena calidad, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismatica con sus clientes, les brinda una buena atencion y sobre todo es muy honrada en su trabajo.

Carina agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podra comprar mas pescado de carne blanca ya que en epoca de verano vende mas, con esta mejora podra aumentar sus ingresos y asi poder seguir luchando para seguir sacando adelante a sus hijos, ya que son el regalo mas grande que Dios le ha dado y su razon de vivir y ser feliz con solo tenerlos a su lado
texts.en:
Carina lives in the city of Pisco.  She is 33 years old and a single mother.  She has two children who she provides for through a lot of hard work.  Carina separated from her husband for a number of reasons and needed to work in order to support herself.

Carina's business is selling fish and she set up her business with a lot of effort and, above all, savings.  She works around 9 hours a day.  She gets up very early in order to obtain fresh fish so that she can sell good-quality products to her customers.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is very charming to her customers, provides them with good customer service and, above all, is very honest in her work.

Carina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more white fleshed fish.  During the summer she sells more and so this improvement will enable her to increase her income and continue working hard so that she can continue providing for her children.  Her children are the biggest gift that God has given her and her reason for living.  She feels happy just having them by her side.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (white fleshed fish)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme Léonie est la représentante du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans le moins âgé a 06ans. Les 03 de vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est coiffeuse et vend aussi des céréales. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville, à Po et à Léo villages environnants. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut s’acheter  de la laine pour la coiffure et 01 sac d’haricots.

Avec ses bénéfices elle épargne un peu et aide dans les dépenses familiales. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour vendre les produits et accessoires de coiffure et améliorer son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Mrs. Léonie is the representative of Renaissance Group. She's married and the mother of three children, of whom the oldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 6. The three children go to school. She has three persons to support.

Léonie is a hairdresser, and she also sells cereals. She's been working at this trade for eight years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town, and from two surrounding villages, Po and Léo.

Her customers are women and men. Léonie wants to buy wool for hairdressing, and one sack of beans. With the profits, she puts some money away and helps out with the family expenses.

Her ambition is to open a shop to sell hairdressing products and accessories and to improve her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy wool and one sack of beans

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Le BV  a été crée le 12/12/2009. Il est composé de 29 femmes issues du même village exerçant la même activité qui est le commerce et l'embouche.		
La présidente Awa, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.		
Avec son prêt reçu elle va acheter de l'arachide pour faire la transformation en huile et des brebis.		
Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et soutenir ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois was created on December 12, 2009. It consists of 29 women from the same neighborhood and practicing the same activities of trade and cattle fattening.

Awa is the president of the group. She is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised. Awa is 30 years old and married with three children.  She will use her loan to buy groundnuts and ewes. The groundnuts will be processed into oil. 

The profits earned will help her to improve her family’s living conditions and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy ewes and groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, firewood, lime and propane gas

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta de cincuenta y cinco años de edad  vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de productos de uso personal en el lugar de su residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues los artículos que comercia  son de primera calidad y los vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es único; Violeta es una mujer decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante esta dispuesta a cumplir todos sus sueños, piensa que se construye una vida acertada día con día, para poder llegar al éxito, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permite comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos entre otros. Violeta tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Violeta is 55 years old and lives with her live partner and children in her own home.  She has a sales location in her home where she sells personal products.  She has gained a lot of customers because the items she sells are top quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  In addition, she offers excellent customer service.  Violeta is a committed woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  She is ready to fulfill all of her dreams.  Violeta believes that you build a good life day by day in order to achieve success.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy creams, perfume, cosmetics, etc.  Violeta believes that this will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria de 37 años casado con celestino de 72 años fruto de este amor tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Hilaria cuenta que salio de su tierra natal a los 14 años con la finalidad de buscar mejores condiciones de Vida, empezando a trabajar como empleada del hogar, donde aprendió las labores del hogar. Pocos años después se caso con celestino quien se dedicaba al cultivo del cacao y piña en su parcela ubicada por otari. Es de esta manera que hilaría empezó a incursionar en las labores agrícolas con la necesidad de poder sobresalir juntamente con su querido esposo, ellos trabajan constantemente desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde con el único fin de avanzar con los trabajos que tiene para que sus productos puedan tener una mejor fructificación para luego obtener beneficios que satisfagan sus necesidades.
Usualmente Hilaria trabaja con el apoyo de su querido esposo pero en épocas de cosecha siempre recurre a algunos peones quienes le facilitan en la extracción de sus productos. Ella esta contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera buenos beneficios. En un futuro esta pensando instalar plantas de cacao. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Hilaria esta feliz con su banco comunal por que son puntuales y solidarios. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de plantas de cacao para incrementar su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Hilaria, age 37, is married to 72 year old Celestino.  They have three children.  They live in their own house in the Pichari district.  Hilaria says that she left her native land when she was 14 years old in order to look for better living conditions.  She started working as a household employee where she learned how to do the housework.

A few years later she married Celestino, who devotes himself to growing cacao and pineapple on his land in Otari.  This is the way the Hilaria started to get involved in the farm work.  She did it out of the necessity to be able to prevail together with her beloved husband.  They work constantly from 7:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon.  Their only goal is to advance with the work they have so that their products are able to come to better fruition.  They want this so that they will then get benefits that meet their needs.

Hilaria usually works with the help of her beloved husband.  However, during the harvesting season she always turns to help from day workers who make it easier to extract her products.  She is happy with this work because it generates good benefits for her.

In the future she is planning on setting up more cacao plants.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments on time.  Hilaria is happy with her communal bank because they are punctual and supportive.  She will use the 2,500 soles to buy cacao plants to increase her farmland.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living, which she has been doing for five years. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy tomatoes, beans, potatoes, and maize to sell. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, beans, potatoes, and maize

loans.name: Jimmy Javier

texts.es:
Jimmy vive Carlos vive en el ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por la generosidad de sus pobladores, como buen peruano ama nuestra comida y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, en sus tiempos libres le gusta pasear para así distraerse cuando está preocupado.

Cada día Jimmy sale a trabajar desde muy temprano brindando el servicio de taxi, el le dedica alrededor de 10 horas a su trabajo y puede atender hasta 45 clientes en el día, el cree que le va muy bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha fe en Dios y por ello trabaja de buena manera y puede llevar dinero a casa de manera honrada.

Jimmy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para conducir de manera más segura, con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Ser Ingeniero Civil”.
texts.en:
Jimmy lives in the city of Ica, in Parcona district.  This area is noted for the generosity of its residents.  Like all good Peruvians, Jimmy loves our food and one of his favorite meals is the delicious 'Arroz con Pollo' (chicken and rice).  In his free time, he enjoys going out for walks so that he can distract himself when he is worried.

Every day, Jimmy goes out to work very early.  He provides a taxi service and works around 10 hours a day.  He is able to serve up to 45 customers a day.  He believes that his business is doing very well because he has a lot of faith in God and so he works well and is able to provide money for his household in an honest manner.

Jimmy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help that they have given him, he will be able to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle which will allow him to drive more safely.  This will enable Jimmy to improve his income and continue working hard in order to fulfill his biggest dream "to be a civil engineer".

loans.use: to have his vehicle serviced

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys, wallets, nail polish, gift wrap and shoelaces

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Maria es una madre de familia de 62 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo para lo que cuentan con una casita ubicada en el distrito de Túcume, a unos 45 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo y el departamento de Lambayeque, el lugar donde reside Maria es un distrito en vía de desarrollo en donde ya cuenta con los servicios básicas necesarios, el caserío en donde vive es uno de los muchos que se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura.


Maria se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales  como ganado, ovinos y aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado siempre teniendo ya un aproximado de 20 años al misma, negocio ya heredado de sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a la compra/venta de animales. Para lo que podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, la unión entre su hijo y su esposo ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

Maria al tener ya sus objetivos claros y establecidos desea comprar arroz en cáscara y alimentos balanceados los cuales servirán para el engorde de sus animales. Maria ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos los cuales ayudaran a generar mayores ingresos con los que podrán mejorar su calidad de vida y a la vez para pagar su crédito solicitado.


Maria es una mujer emprendedora desde muy pequeña gracias a los valores inculcados por sus padres, valores los cuales ahora son reconocidos por su vecinos quienes le guardan mucha admiración por que siempre esta preocupando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, age 62, lives with her husband and her son.  They have a small house in the Túcume district, which is 45 minutes from the Chiclayo province in the Lambayaque department.  The place where Maria lives is a district on the road to development, and it already has the basic services needed.  The settlement where she lives is one of the many that is devoted to livestock and farming.

Every day Maria devotes herself to raising and later selling animals like cows, and sheep.  She also raises poultry like ducks, turkeys, and guinea pigs, among others.  She has always done this work, having spent approximately 20 years at it.  She inherited the business from her parents, who taught her about buying and selling animals when she was very young.  She has been able to set up strategic spaces for raising animals at her own house.  The union between her son and her husband has made them undertake new family objectives.  That is why they work every day in order to achieve their objectives and improve their living conditions.

Upon having clear and established objectives, Maria wishes to buy husked rice and balanced feed, which will serve to fatten the animals.

Maria has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan will help her generate more income, with which they will be able to improve their quality of life and pay for the requested loan.

Maria has been enterprising ever since she was young thanks to the values her parents instilled in her.  Her neighbors know she has these values, and they greatly admire her for always worrying about her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy husked rice and balanced feed, which will serve to fatten the animals.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 27 years old, married with one child. She sells sweaters and blouses to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sweaters and blouses to sell.

loans.use: To buy sweaters and blouses to sell
